finding: The variant rs1229984 in the ADH1B gene was found to be strongly associated with alcohol flushing in East Asian populations. It showed significant statistical association (P = 1.1 × 10^-13) after adjusting for rs671, indicating its role in influencing flushing symptoms related to alcohol consumption.
title: Genetic influences on alcohol flushing in East Asian populations

finding: The SNP rs717947 was also identified in the initial studies from the PGC-PTSD, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for PTSD.
title: Leveraging large-scale genetics of PTSD and cardiovascular disease demonstrates robust shared risk and improves risk prediction accuracy

finding: Similarly, rs11722554 in CYTL1 exhibited age-dependent effects with a Bonferroni corrected P value below 5.14×10^-5, thus highlighting its role in the relationship between age and lung function metrics.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The putative causal variant rs2290846 in LRBA showed pleiotropic associations with lower FVC and FEV1, as well as notable connections to various traits including lower neutrophil levels and reduced risks for multiple diseases, suggesting broader health implications.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs62297721 at 4q13.1 was identified during the analysis of SCZ and medication use, potentially implicating its role in psychiatric conditions.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs143260331 was associated with two nested atrial fibrillation phecode traits (427.2 and 427.21), which aligned with prior associations reported in the GWAS Catalog for atrial fibrillation and flutter.
title: The Michigan Genomics Initiative: a biobank linking genotypes and electronic clinical records in Michigan Medicine patients

finding: The variant rs2282679, mapped to the gene GC, was validated for its association with vitamin D levels. Findings from Kew et al. corroborated its involvement in the accumulation of white blood cells and neutrophils, aligning with the three direct effects identified by PRISM corresponding to this variant.
title: Inferring genetic variant causal networks by leveraging pleiotropy

finding: In complete LD with a rare deletion (chr4:188173309-188183202) associated with AD, this SNP highlighted the significance of regulatory variations in the genetic landscape of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The SNP rs116022080, within the intronic region of UNC5C on chromosome 4q22.3, was linked to an increased risk of HTPR with an odds ratio of 3.689, illustrating a significant increase in risk corroborated by a p-value of 9.02×10^-7. The association drew interest due to UNC5C's previous connections with cardiovascular disease.
title: Discovery of Ancestry-specific Variants Associated with Clopidogrel Response among Caribbean Hispanics

finding: This SNP was associated with the FLL IIa phenotype and found to be upstream of the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma, coactivator 1 alpha (PPARGC1A). This suggests a link between this genetic variant and lipid metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: This SNP was uniquely associated with the type IIb phenotype, with an odds ratio of 1.04, suggesting its involvement in lipid abnormalities related to this dyslipoproteinemia.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC), with a beta coefficient of -0.410 (p=0.048). Each minor allele was associated with a decrease in ANC of approximately 410 cells/mm3, suggesting a negative impact of this variant on neutrophil levels.
title: Clozapine metabolism is associated with Absolute Neutrophil Count in individuals with treatment-resistant schizophrenia

finding: The variant rs770505620 was part of the variants analyzed with a risk difference (RD) of 1.00, indicating a significant impact on hereditary factor XI deficiency, a serious autosomal recessive (AR) condition. Despite this high RD, instances in the population were rare.
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The SNP was associated with increased GFAT, similar to other loci, demonstrating a trend towards beneficial fat distribution despite its association with increased body fat.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: Associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis, rs4624724 was also found in the GWAS Catalog, showing its broader phenotypic associations beyond smoking behavior.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The study by Hibbert et al. found that the rs13123010 SNP was significantly associated with an increased risk for HPV-driven oropharyngeal cancer. This association was highlighted through a systematic literature review and meta-analysis, which underscored the importance of this SNP in the susceptibility to HPV-OPC.
title: Quantification of Human Papillomavirus cell-free DNA from low volume blood plasma samples by digital PCR

finding: For SNP rs7697189, which is linked to the gene HHIP, DeepPheWAS showed an increased effect on FEV1 in men, compared to women, corroborating findings from Fawcett et al. (2021).
title: DeepPheWAS: an R package for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The analysis revealed that the variant rs3822019, an intron variant in the gene TMEM175, was significantly associated with Parkinson's Disease (PD). It was found that all subjects homozygous for rs3822019_TT were affected by PD. Additionally, a majority of individuals who were heterozygous for rs3822019_TT also had PD, indicating a strong correlation between this SNP variant and the disease.
title: Interaction-based feature selection algorithm outperforms polygenic risk score in predicting Parkinson’s Disease status

finding: linked to ADH1C and supported the metabolic processes involved in substance use disorders.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: this SNP was related to BANK1, highlighting its role in the genetic architecture of substance use disorders.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: rs1229984 was the top signal for problematic alcohol use (PAU) linked to ADH1B with a p-value of 4.11E-68, underscoring its significant association with alcohol metabolism.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: this SNP in KLB was associated with problematic alcohol use and highlighted its role in sugar metabolism pathways.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: this ADH1B variant was identified as significant for alcohol-specific effects in a meta-analysis involving African ancestry.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: associated with both AUD and tobacco dependence, likely representing the location of ADH1B locus.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs4699836 was associated with the UNC5D gene, being present in 29% of ASD cases, affirming its importance in axon guidance, integral to ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs7664347 related to SLIT3 was noted in 13% of ASD individuals, marking it as part of the systemic axon guidance implications in ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs1717098 within AADAT was found in over 20% of individuals in ASD populations, implicating its involvement in neuromodulatory pathways altered in the disorder.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs6532194 located at chromosome 4:89859751 was one of the top 20 SNPs linked to 'fast' PD progression, showing that the presence of its non-reference allele posed a higher risk for faster disease progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs7662029 was associated with the UGT2B7 gene, which is involved in the glucuronidation of estradiol for its elimination, suggesting its critical role in estrogen metabolism.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The study identified a colocalisation of the genetic signal for GUCY1A3 levels with coronary artery disease (CAD) outcome within a 1-Mb window of the gene. This colocalisation suggested that the SNP rs72687508 exhibited genetic association with CAD risk, highlighting its significance in the context of hypertension and related cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Triangulating Evidence for Antihypertensive Drug Class Efficacy on Cardiovascular and Metabolic Outcomes Using Mendelian Randomisation and Colocalisation

finding: rs7696877 was noted for a stronger effect in females compared to males, marking a novel CAD association linked to the MYOZ2 gene.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The SNP rs4458523 in WFS1 was newly identified as associated with early T2D diagnosis, adding to the understanding of genetic factors influencing early-onset diabetes.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs4859682 SNP at SHROOM3 was associated with serum magnesium levels where previously reported associations showed a P-value of 2.39×10^-9. This indicates a strong genetic connection between SHROOM3 variations and magnesium levels.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses of kidney function genetic loci in a general population study

finding: The rs13146355 SNP at SHROOM3 revealed associations with magnesium levels and eGFRcrea as demonstrated in prior GWAS. The effect on eGFRcrea from this SNP was reduced by 11% when adjusting for magnesium, supporting the idea of partial mediation with overlapping mechanisms.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses of kidney function genetic loci in a general population study

finding: The rs28386916 variant was identified as a genome-wide significant association with OA among European ancestry individuals, achieving a p-value of 9.04 × 10^-9, although this variant was not found in the MVP or PH cohorts.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study of opioid addiction: OPRM1 and Beyond

finding: The study confirmed that the SNP rs111978466 was associated with 25(OH)D being a protective factor for multiple system atrophy (MSA), with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.562 and a p-value of 0.008. This indicated a significant protective effect of vitamin D metabolites against MSA.
title: Relationships between 25-Hydroxyvitamin D and Alpha-synucleinopathies: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Similar to rs111978466, the SNP rs1352846 was also found to correlate with 25(OH)D, reinforcing the protective role of vitamin D against MSA, as established in the study's univariable Mendelian randomization analysis.
title: Relationships between 25-Hydroxyvitamin D and Alpha-synucleinopathies: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs62318873 further supported the finding of 25(OH)D's protective effect on MSA, as demonstrated in the univariable Mendelian randomization analysis conducted by the researchers.
title: Relationships between 25-Hydroxyvitamin D and Alpha-synucleinopathies: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The missense variant rs754837473 A>G (p.Tyr169Cys) in the SRD5A3 gene was identified in affected individuals in homozygous state, and was previously linked to intellectual disability (ID). The alternate allele G was predicted to be potentially damaging, supported by moderate and supportive evidence from computational tools. It exhibited partial concordance with a known condition, SRD5A3-congenital disorder of glycosylation (SRD5A3-CDG). Multiple lines of genomic evidence supported the pathogenicity prediction, thus making it a likely cause of ID in the ARID-76 family.
title: Rare splice and missense variants with evidence of pathogenicity in consanguineous families with autosomal recessive intellectual disability from Pakistan

finding: rs7681750 within <italic>RAPGEF2</italic> had positive associations in the GRaD cohort but negative in the ALSPAC cohort, showing inconsistencies in its contribution to reading ability.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs77285108 associated significantly with neuropathologically-confirmed AD (ncAD) in females, achieving a p-value of 4.67×10−8, underscoring its potential impact in female-specific aspects of Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: The missense variant rs34811474 was associated with a higher frequency in blood donors, previously noted for its negative correlation with body mass index.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The SNP rs13107325, located in the SLC39A8 gene at locus 4q24, was found to be a shared causal variant linked to both onion liking and BMI, as well as highly palatable food liking and BMI. This variant was highlighted as a pleiotropic variant, strengthening its associations not only with food preferences but also with various diseases, including obesity and schizophrenia.
title: A genome-wide cross-trait analysis identifies causal relationship and shared loci of food preference with obesity

finding: The SNP rs117130410 was identified as a novel ancestry-specific index variant associated with bipolar disorder (BD) in the East Asian cohort. It exhibited a frequency of 16% in East Asian BD cases and 9% in controls, while being monomorphic in non-Asian populations.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: This SNP associated with pituitary gland volume showed a significant difference in effect size by sex (females: β = 0.001, males: β = 0.09, P = 4.22 x 10^-5), suggesting genetic differences in neuroanatomical traits related to hormonal regulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: Associated with hypothalamic grey matter volume, it showed a marked difference in effect size between sexes (females: β = 0.24, males: β = 0.01, P = 6.65 x 10^-5), highlighting its potential role in neuroanatomical variation.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: This missense variant in SLC39A8 was significantly associated with the volumes of the left (β = 0.43) and right ventral striatum (β = 0.41), the left (β = 0.39) and right putamen (β = 0.40), and T1 intensity in the right hemisphere accumbens area, underscoring its relevance in broader brain anatomy.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: This upstream variant of REST was associated with hypothalamus volume (β = 0.04), positioning it as a key genetic factor related to neuroendocrine structure and function.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs3775291 was associated with Zika virus microcephaly in newborns, suggesting that genetic variations in the Toll-Like Receptor 3 may influence susceptibility to the effects of prenatal Zika infection on brain development.
title: Building a growing genomic data repository for maternal and fetal health through the PING Consortium

finding: The SNP rs1481012, associated with the ABCG2 locus, was a notable finding replicated from previous studies in the context of habitual coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs112764911 at the SORCS2 locus was newly reported to be associated with caffeine consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs13107325 linked to SLC39A8 was significantly associated with caffeine consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The rs116135844 SNP was indicated to have a potential causal role in the presence of an unclassified group of bacteria within the Bacteroidales order and its increased risk for CRC. Unlike rs4988235, there was limited evidence of horizontal pleiotropy with rs116135844, with only a few independent associations observed. The presence of this unclassified group of Bacteroidales bacteria supported previous observational evidence linking these microbes to CRC risk, suggesting that this SNP could plausibly contribute to the observed effect.
title: Exploring the causal role of the human gut microbiome in colorectal cancer: Application of Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs10516589 was associated with RBS-R compulsive with p = 4.3 × 10^-7 and is located within the ANK2 gene, a high-confidence autism risk gene.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs62321572 was associated with RBS-R injurious with p = 1.4 × 10^-7 and is located within 50 kb of USO1 and PPEF2, which were implicated in specific language impairment through CNV analysis.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The NOCT:rs13116075-G variant showed a protective effect against Alzheimer's disease in African carriers, though it increased risk in the African Admixed ancestry.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs13144992 demonstrated genome-wide significant (GWS) evidence of differing effects on cigarettes per day (CPD) between major depressive disorder (MDD) cases and controls with p-diff values of 3.23×10^-8 and 3.43×10^-8 for binned and log transformed CPD, respectively.
title: Investigating heterogeneous genetic effects contributing to smoking behaviors

finding: The rs28577061 variant at the FGG locus was identified as a novel conditionally distinct lead variant for plasma fibrinogen levels. This variant had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 18% in African populations, contrasting with an extremely rare MAF of 0.8% in European populations. Its association with fibrinogen levels had not been previously documented in genetic studies.
title: Whole genome analysis of plasma fibrinogen reveals population-differentiated genetic regulators with putative liver roles

finding: The SNP rs72649118, identified in a novel credible set at chr4 73256856-74885359, was a non-synonymous missense variant in RASSF6, a tumor suppressor. Its association with PrCa was considered insignificant with a minimum p-value of 6.5×10^-4.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The rs13107325 variant was identified as a missense variant in SLC39A8 and was the top hit with genome-wide significance for sporadic miscarriage (P=1.6e-10). This gene encodes the primary transporter for toxic cation cadmium, which is associated with tobacco exposure.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The rs756996932 variant was associated with TENM3, which is connected to syndromic microphthalmia characterized by developmental delay. It showed significant association (P=3.1e-08, OR=0.40) for recurrent miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The SNP rs7041 was identified as a canonical missense variant in the GC gene, explaining approximately 52.6% of the variance in DBP concentration, confirming its significant role in Vitamin D metabolism.
title: Genetic correlates of vitamin D-binding protein and 25 hydroxyvitamin D in neonatal dried blood spots

finding: Like rs7041, the SNP rs4588 was part of the key haplotypes in the GC gene that influenced DBP levels, demonstrating a crucial contribution to the genetic architecture of vitamin D transport.
title: Genetic correlates of vitamin D-binding protein and 25 hydroxyvitamin D in neonatal dried blood spots

finding: The SNP rs705117 was one of the two significant loci established in a previous study, linked to variations in DBP concentration among men.
title: Genetic correlates of vitamin D-binding protein and 25 hydroxyvitamin D in neonatal dried blood spots

finding: This SNP, identified in the GC gene, was associated with 25OHD concentration, underscoring its relevance in vitamin D metabolism.
title: Genetic correlates of vitamin D-binding protein and 25 hydroxyvitamin D in neonatal dried blood spots

finding: The SNP rs72952628 was identified as the only variant with genome-wide significant interaction with vegetarianism (P-int = 4.47e-08). This SNP was associated with increased calcium levels in vegetarians with the heterozygous CT genotype and was located within the MMAA gene, which plays a critical role in vitamin B12 metabolism. This finding highlighted the potential nutritional concern of B12 deficiency among vegetarians.
title: Gene-vegetarianism interactions detected in genome-wide analyses across 30 serum biomarkers

finding: For SNP rs7697189, Deep-PheWAS replicated findings demonstrating an increased effect on FEV1 in males compared to females, validating previous research about gender-specific genetic effects on lung function.
title: Deep-PheWAS: a pipeline for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs356182 was strongly associated with Parkinson's disease (PD), suggesting that it may play a significant role in the risk of developing this condition.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: Variants of rs2870004 were associated with both Parkinson's disease (PD) and idiopathic REM Sleep Behavior Disorder (iRBD), indicating its relevance to multiple synucleinopathies.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs7681440 was linked with Dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB), highlighting its potential as a genetic risk factor for this specific form of dementia.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: An association was found between rs7680557 and DLB, further contributing to the understanding of genetic factors involved in this disease.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: Associated with age-dependent effects in lung function, with findings indicating different impact between children and adults.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The missense variant in LRBA demonstrated pleiotropic associations with lower FVC and FEV1 and various other traits in a PheWAS.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: An association was found with SNP rs7659024, located around 4kb downstream of the FGG gene, which codes for a gamma chain of the fibrinogen protein, a key component of blood clots. This SNP was previously known to be associated with deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and was linked to an increased risk of Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension (CTEPH).
title: CTEPH has shared and distinct genetic associations with pulmonary embolism in a genome-wide association study

finding: The minor allele (T) of variant rs28584831 was associated with a reduction in <italic>SHROOM3</italic> expression in both kidney compartments, indicating its role in influencing kidney function but did not show a significant association with kidney phenotypes.
title: Spatial Multi-Omics Connect SHROOM3 and COL18A1 in Chronic Kidney Disease

finding: The variant rs1495509 corresponded to a previously described association with the gene KCNIP4, confirming its role in ACEI-induced cough pathology.
title: Genome-wide association study of ACE inhibitor-induced cough implicates neuropeptides and shows genetic overlap with chronic dry cough

finding: Located on chromosome 4, the SNP rs6844176 was connected to the non-SU externalizing factor as part of the identified genomic risk loci. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic factors that could lead to increased liability for PSU apart from SU.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: The SNP rs17028973, also on chromosome 4, emerged as a significant lead SNP within the context of non-SU externalizing traits. Its correlation with PSU further emphasized the role of externalizing traits in genetic susceptibility to polysubstance use.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: A significant association was found between the SNP rs907715 in the IL-21 gene and Graves' disease susceptibility. The G allele increased susceptibility and likelihood of relapse after treatment cessation.
title: Outcome of Graves’ Disease and Associated Genetic Predisposition: A Systematic Review of Literature

finding: The rs4307025 variant displayed significant differences in alternative allele frequency, with 73.0% in East Asians versus 28.0% in Europeans, within the context of NIHF.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: Found to be more commonly observed in the East Asian population, indicating its potential relevance to heart failure risk as per GWAS findings.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs13151645 was associated with a 26% lower risk of preterm birth (PTB) per additional risk allele, corresponding with a relationship to gestational age (GA) showing a 0.6 week increase in GA per additional risk allele. It mapped to the non-coding RNA LINC01182.
title: Genetic association study of Preterm birth and Gestational age in a population-based case-control study in Peru

finding: The SNP rs10516487 was found to destabilize the BANK1 protein, which interfered with its interaction in innate immune signaling pathways, implicating its role in SLE pathogenesis.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: This intronic variant in SMR3B was associated with pituitary gland volume (females: β = 0.001, SE = 0.02; males: β = -0.09, SE = 0.02), showing a statistically significant difference in effect size between sexes (P = 4.22 × 10⁻⁵).
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: In an intronic region near MND1, this SNP was linked to hypothalamic grey matter volume (females: β = -0.24, SE = 0.04; males: β = 0.01, SE = 0.05). A significant sex difference was found (P = 6.65 × 10⁻⁵).
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: Located upstream of REST, this SNP was associated with hypothalamus volume (β = 0.04, SE = 0.01) and had prior connections with testosterone levels.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs6841581, located within the exon of the EDNRA gene, demonstrated a significant increase in association with heart failure (HF) through MTAG analysis (P<sub>MTAG_HF</sub> = 4.75×10<sup>-18</sup>), compared to the GWAS analysis (P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 1.41×10<sup>-2</sup>). It was also validated with P<sub>MTAG_HF_R</sub> = 8.01×10<sup>-9</sup>.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs370735654 in TET2 was identified as significant for reduced lifespan with a hazard ratio of 7.0 and a p-value of 5.6 x 10^-9, indicating its association with mortality.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: This SNP was identified as a causal variant between the pulmonary BAG and the FEV/FCV feature, with a high posterior probability of 0.99 indicating a shared causal effect.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: The SNP rs6841581, located within the exon of the EDNRA gene, was associated with heart failure and demonstrated an increase in significance from the original GWAS HF analysis (P GWAS = 1.41×10^-2) to the MTAG HF analysis (P MTAG HF = 4.75×10^-18). It was replicated with P MTAG HF_R = 8.01×10^-9.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs12509595, located in the FGF5 gene, was replicated for heart failure with a P MTAG HF_R of 3.34×10^-3.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs2306556, associated with the GUCY1A3 gene, was successfully replicated for heart failure with a P MTAG HF_R of 5.60×10^-3.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: This NAAA variant was associated with N-stearoyltaurine, indicating its metabolic role in taurine synthesis.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This variant in SCD5 was associated with lignoceroylcarnitine levels, linking it to fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs6841581, linked to the EDNRA gene, showed a p-value of 3.52×10^-14 and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.77, indicating a statistically significant association with rIA.
title: Integrative genomics analysis implicates decreased FGD6 expression underlying risk of intracranial aneurysm rupture

finding: The c.544A>C (p.Thr182Pro) mutation, represented by SNP rs751427686, was found in a homozygous state among 14 cases and was implicated in sarcoglycanopathies, indicating a founder mutation.
title: Identification of a shared, common haplotype cosegregating with an SGCB c.544A>C mutation in Indian patients affected with sarcoglycanopathy

finding: This SNP had the strongest association to PD in original studies and is located downstream of SNCA, a gene that encodes a protein central to PD pathogenesis.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: Also located downstream of SNCA, rs5019538 was shown to have eQTL effects on SNCA and was included among significant variants linked to PD risk.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs7688383 was noted as a significant genetic marker associated with the loss of sense of smell and taste, which are characteristic symptoms of COVID-19.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs2231142, a variant of the ABCG2 transporter, was associated with less severe COVID-19 and showed relevance in diabetic patients.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs7675998 was linked to shorter telomere length, supporting the association with an increased risk for coronary heart disease and cardiac structural changes.
title: Leukocyte Telomere Length and Cardiac Structure and Function: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Identified as the top variant in the SNCA locus with a significant association in both male (P=3.47E-44, beta=0.256) and female (P=1.41E-25, beta=0.219) PD cases.
title: Investigation of Autosomal Genetic Sex Differences in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs45510091 was implicated in low dose cytokine treatments aimed at reversing anxious symptoms. It was also positioned within genic regions and had prior evidence linking it to posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms.
title: Comorbid-phenome prediction and phenotype risk scores enhance gene discovery for generalized anxiety disorder and posttraumatic stress disorder

finding: This SNP, associated with the LEF1 locus, was characterized as a novel risk variant with a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP > 0.99), suggesting the significant role of CD4+ T-regulatory (T-reg) cells in RA biology.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: Located within the TNIP2 gene, this missense variant (A313V) was strongly correlated with the lead variant rs4690029 and predicted to impact TNIP2 protein function, implicating it in RA pathogenesis.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This lead variant at the TNIP2 locus was assessed for significant contributions to RA risk through its interaction with other inflammatory pathways in immune regulation.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: In the context of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD), patients with the rs11569017-TT genotype showed low plasma levels of EGF when compared to healthy controls. This finding suggested that genotype variations in the EGF gene could be associated with differences in EGF levels and potentially serve as a biomarker for depression.
title: Epidermal Growth Factor in the Brain: A Promising Biomarker for Depression

finding: Cognitive alterations in patients with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) were associated with the SNP rs2250724 of the EGF gene. This indicates that variations at this locus may influence cognitive aspects related to depression.
title: Epidermal Growth Factor in the Brain: A Promising Biomarker for Depression

finding: The SNP rs58251292, which is near the gene ADGRL3 implicated in ADHD, was associated with the cortical thickness of common regions like the left pars opercularis, with a p-value of 2.61×10^−9.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: This SNP was identified in linkage disequilibrium with rs9996981, showing significant associations in internalizing-specific regions, particularly with implications in anxiety and depression.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: SNP rs9996981 was associated with the cortical thickness in internalizing-specific regions. This region is related to genes involved in anxiety and depression.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The lead SNP rs2129977 from previous studies was noted to be associated with AF and was found in close linkage disequilibrium with rs2634073. In this GWAS, SNPs at the PITX2 locus, including rs2129977, were associated with increased LAmax and LAmin, suggesting that the PITX2 locus may influence LA volume prior to the onset of AF.
title: Deep Learning of Left Atrial Structure and Function Provides Link to Atrial Fibrillation Risk

finding: SNP rs2634073 was in high linkage disequilibrium with the AF lead SNP rs2129977 and was also associated with BSA-indexed LAmax and LAmin measurements. The findings suggested an increase in LA volume associated with the AF risk allele at the PITX2 locus, further supporting the hypothesis of its role in LA remodeling before AF occurs.
title: Deep Learning of Left Atrial Structure and Function Provides Link to Atrial Fibrillation Risk

finding: The SNP rs356182, located in the SNCA locus on chromosome 4, was confirmed as a genome-wide significant finding in both the LARGE-PD and 23andMe replication cohorts. It demonstrated strong evidence of playing a significant role in Parkinson's disease (PD) etiology among Latino populations, consistent with previous findings in European-ancestry studies.
title: Characterizing the genetic architecture of Parkinson’s disease in Latinos

finding: The variant rs356225, also within the SNCA locus on chromosome 4, achieved the lowest p-value of 4.22×10−9. It supported the significance of the SNCA locus in PD, corroborating findings from extensive PD genetic literature.
title: Characterizing the genetic architecture of Parkinson’s disease in Latinos

finding: The allele C of LTA variant rs2272596 was marginally associated with increased risk for psoriasis (OR=1.25, pval=3.5e-8). However, its effect was significantly modulated by the rs2229094 allele, showcasing antagonistic epistasis where the risk decreased with the presence of the common allele (OR=0.79) but greatly increased in the presence of the minor allele (OR=4.82 for double homozygotes).
title: Atlas of epistasis

finding: The SNP rs34311866 had been previously identified as functionally relevant to PD risk. This finding was consistent with the analysis performed in the study, affirming its significance in understanding PD.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis in Parkinson’s disease

finding: This missense variant in the TLR1 gene significantly affected IL-6 production in response to S.pneumoniae stimulation in PBMCs, underlining its role as a genetic regulator of cytokine responses in the context of T1D.
title: Genetic and environmental effects on the immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: This variant was also a lead SNP identified in the HF GWAS, demonstrating a significant association that adds to the understanding of genetic risk factors for heart failure.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This variant was linked with heart failure risk through its association with alcohol consumption, highlighting environmental interactions in HF pathology.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP was found to be related to smoking behavior, indicating its potential role as a lifestyle factor in heart failure risk.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This variant was identified as migraine without aura (MO)-specific with a high probability (>95%) indicating a close association with this subtype.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: The SNP rs6822892, found in PDGFC, exhibited a significant association with GFATadjBMI (P = 8.0 x 10^-13), identifying PDGFC as a candidate causal gene for insulin resistance.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs17042102 showed significant association with the AF-related subtype, and this association persisted even after correction for multiple testing, highlighting the significance of chromosome 4 in AF-related heart failure.
title: Identifying subtypes of heart failure with machine learning: external, prognostic and genetic validation in three electronic health record sources with 320,863 individuals

finding: The variant rs11097861 showed colocalized genetic influences with insomnia traits and functional connectivity among the triple networks of psychopathology.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Rs4417974 had strong colocalization with insomnia-related traits concerning functional neuroimaging results.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: At the left/right accumbens area, rs6855246 was associated with unique genetic effects on sleep processes.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs13135092 variant demonstrated genetic interactions with functional aspects related to sleep durations.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The association of rs13109404 was detected in the context of sleep-derived genetic correlations.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: rs7681750 was found to show positive associations in the GRaD cohort, but was not considered informative after adjusting for demographic features in the ALSPAC cohort.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: It was confirmed as pleiotropic with general cognitive ability, showing significant associations in the context of cognitive traits.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The presence of the UGT2B10 genotype rs2942857 was found to significantly improve the model fit in the population pharmacokinetics analysis, indicating a relationship between this SNP and drug clearance, although the effect was not strong enough to influence clinical dosing.
title: Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Dexmedetomidine in Children using Real-World-Data Obtained from Electronic Health Records and Remnant Clinic Samples

finding: Similar to rs2942857, the UGT2B10 genotype variant rs112561475 demonstrated significant effects on the pharmacokinetics of dexmedetomidine, contributing positively to the model fit in understanding dosage requirements.
title: Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Dexmedetomidine in Children using Real-World-Data Obtained from Electronic Health Records and Remnant Clinic Samples

finding: The genotype data for UGT2B10 variant rs61750900 was included in the analysis, contributing to the overall understanding of genetic influences on dexmedetomidine clearance, although the direct clinical implications were minimal.
title: Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Dexmedetomidine in Children using Real-World-Data Obtained from Electronic Health Records and Remnant Clinic Samples

finding: The SNP rs1229984, located at the ADH1B locus, was identified as the top association in Europeans (EUR) with a p-value of 3.12×10−101. This variant, previously linked to alcohol dependence, supported strong genetic correlations with problematic alcohol use traits.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs2066702, also located at the ADH1B locus, emerged as the top association in Africans (AFR) with a p-value of 6.30×10−17. Like its counterpart in EUR, this SNP was associated with alcohol dependence, highlighting its significance across populations.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs13107325, related to the SLC39A8 gene, was identified with a genome-wide significant p-value of 6.78×10−15. It was previously associated with alcohol consumption and was confirmed in this study, indicating its role in MaxAlc.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The variant rs75967634 in the ADH1B gene was one of the identified variants associated with PAU. This finding suggests a genetic predisposition mediated by alcohol dehydrogenase activity.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The variant rs1229984 in the ADH1B gene was associated with both alcohol use disorder and problematic alcohol use across multiple ancestries, confirming its role as a significant genetic variant influencing AUD.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The variant rs13107325 in the SLC39A8 gene was associated with PAU and has previously been linked to other substance uses, indicating its broader influence on substance-related diseases.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The missense variant rs2066702 in the ADH1B gene was identified as associated with AUD within the African ancestry analysis framework, highlighting its relevance in different populations.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The rs10032906 variant was significant in the East Asian population, bringing more insights into the genetic architecture influencing PAU.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs34955650 on chromosome 4q28.2 was identified as intergenic to C4orf33 and LINC02466 with a genome-wide significant association (p=2.41×10^{-8}), indicating its relevance to CAP susceptibility.
title: A genome-wide association study of adults with community-acquired pneumonia

finding: The SNP rs1481012 from the ABCG2 locus was among the previously identified SNPs in the CCGC and confirmed to be associated with habitual coffee consumption, indicating it's been studied previously.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs112764911, associated with the SORCS2 locus, was identified for the first time as being linked to caffeine consumption, marking a novel finding.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs13107325 at the SLC39A8 locus was newly associated with caffeine consumption, showcasing its role in this genetic feature.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs13135092 was associated with OUD with a GWS p-value of 3.60×10⁻¹⁰, presenting relevance to SLC39A8 and suggesting a role in genetic susceptibility to OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The study found that the SACC cohort exhibited a higher frequency of the rs1229984 allele among mothers of unexposed control children compared to mothers of children with fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD). This allele is associated with more efficient alcohol metabolism, suggesting that genetic factors may influence fetal vulnerability to alcohol effects in this genetically admixed population.
title: Genetic admixture predictors of fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD) in the South African Cape Coloured population

finding: The SNP rs7659024 was associated with the <italic>FGG</italic> gene, which codes for the gamma chain of fibrinogen, an essential component of blood clots. This variant was highlighted as being significant, especially in relation to deep vein thrombosis (DVT), indicating its relevance in coagulation processes linked to CTEPH.
title: CTEPH has shared and distinct genetic associations with pulmonary embolism in a genome-wide association study

finding: The rs192018195 variant was identified as interacting with STST in relation to TG levels, and demonstrated a notable association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: This SNP was confirmed as associated with overall lung cancer and replicated in various studies, highlighting its importance in lung cancer genetics.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: This SNP was used as a proxy for rs75675343 and confirmed associations with overall lung cancer, adding to the genetic landscape of lung cancer.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: This SNP served as a proxy for a known association at rs4435699 and was confirmed in external validation studies.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: This SNP was confirmed as part of a significant association with lung cancer, utilizing highly correlated imputation techniques.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs111283315, located within the RELL1 gene, showed a significant association with ADHD symptoms and was tentatively implicated in general cognitive function. This finding was considered a positive original finding due to its consistent correlation with the brain network #4 associated with ADHD.
title: Genetic background of grey matter brain networks related to attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The variant rs356182 in the SNCA locus was confirmed as associated with PD in the Swedish cohort, reported at a low p-value of 5.64E-08, although it did not reach genome-wide significance.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Similar to rs356182, the variant rs356203 from the SNCA locus exhibited an association with PD (beta = -0.36, p = 1.27E-07) in the Swedish cohort, confirming its established link to the disease.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: Variant rs356220 was also observed in the SNCA locus and showed an association with PD (beta = 0.36, p = 1.39E-07) in the conducted GWAS.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The variant rs356219 was found to be associated with PD within the SNCA locus (beta = -0.36, p = 2.32E-07) in this cohort, reaffirming its known association with the disease.
title: Novel Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The well-known functional variant rs1229984 in the ADH1B gene was confirmed to be significantly associated with alcohol use disorder (AUD). In the single-variant association analysis, it exhibited a strong association in the EUR population with a P-value of 2.84×10^-29, establishing its relevance in AUD risk.
title: Multi-ancestry Whole-exome Sequencing Study of Alcohol Use Disorder in Two Cohorts

finding: The rs7683365 SNP, related to the MNS blood group system, was found to be distinct between the Orang Asli and cosmopolitan Malaysians, characterized by a P-value of 0.0030.
title: Genomic map of blood group alleles in Malaysian indigenous Orang Asli population from whole genome sequences

finding: The study discussed the association of SNCA rs356219 polymorphism with Parkinson's Disease (PD) and Mn-Induced Parkinsonism (MnIP). Specifically, it highlighted the interaction between metal exposure and this SNP, indicating that the polymorphism might serve as a biomarker for susceptibility to the neurotoxic effects of manganese exposure, thereby contributing to cognitive and motor dysfunction in affected individuals.
title: Metabolomic and Lipidomic Analysis of Manganese-Associated Parkinsonism: a Case-Control Study in Brescia, Italy

finding: The rs233806/BANK1 variant demonstrated associations with blood pressure, HDL-C, and BMI, highlighting its potential significance in the context of HF risk factors.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The variation rs72952628 was significantly associated with calcium levels through a gene-vegetarianism interaction, reaching genome-wide significance with a p-value of 4.47×10<sup>-8</sup>. This SNP, located in the intron of C4orf51 and in linkage disequilibrium with variants in the MMAA gene, indicated that vegetarianism was associated with a decrease in serum calcium in homozygotes of the major allele and an increase in heterozygotes. Additionally, it influenced the expression of the MMAA gene, a key player in vitamin B<sub>12</sub> metabolism, which is crucial for vegetarians due to the risk of B<sub>12</sub> deficiency.
title: Gene-vegetarianism interactions in calcium, testosterone, and eGFR identified in genome-wide analysis across 30 biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs117130410 was identified as a novel index variant associated with bipolar disorder specifically in the East Asian (EAS) cohort. It exhibited a frequency of 16% in BD cases and 9% in controls within this group, while being monomorphic in non-Asian populations.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: The intergenic variant rs28870381 in the UGT8 locus was associated with PG(32:1), suggesting its involvement in sphingolipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The SNP rs114239532 was associated with the language phenotype F4, showing a nominally significant linear association with a p-value of 0.0022 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.018. This finding related specifically to the gene NDST4 and contributed to the genetic burden linked to language capabilities.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Illuminates the Developmental Signatures of Human Language Ability

finding: The SNP rs62317200 exhibited a nominally significant linear association with the language phenotype F4, with a p-value of 0.033 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.023. This SNP was also associated with the NDST4 gene, indicating its role in the genetic underpinnings of language.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Illuminates the Developmental Signatures of Human Language Ability

finding: The SNP rs13107325, a missense variant in SLC39A8, was confirmed as a causal variant for schizophrenia (SCZ) and is implicated in regulating dendritic spine density.
title: Genome-wide fine-mapping improves identification of causal variants

finding: The SNP rs13107325 showed significant association with a p-value of 3.66×10^-41 in relation to the 'Hemochromatosis Brain' phenotype. It was previously noted to have opposing effects on Parkinson's Disease (PD) and schizophrenia.
title: Polygenic architecture of a novel MRI endophenotype: the “hemochromatosis brain”

finding: The SNP rs365843, tagging VEGFC, was associated with lower myocardial native T1 times (P = 3.19×10−9), indicating lower myocardial interstitial fibrosis and linking VEGFC to cardiac repair processes.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs55754224 in CAMK2D was associated with increased T1 time (P = 1.44×10−9) and has been previously linked to atrial fibrillation, illustrating its role in cardiac electrical and structural remodeling.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs1229984 was associated with the latent factor 'Problems' related to alcohol use behaviors (AUBs) with a significant finding of P = 5.19 × 10^-35. This SNP is located in the ADH1B gene region on chromosome 4, indicating a strong connection to alcohol consumption issues in the sample studied.
title: Genetic Heterogeneity Across Dimensions of Alcohol Use Behaviors

finding: The SNP rs7688383 was significantly associated with the loss of smell or taste phenotype in individuals who tested positive for SARS-CoV-2. Located in the vicinity of the UGT2A1 and UGT2A2 genes, the association exhibited an odds ratio of 1.115 and a p-value of 4×10^-15. The presence of the T risk allele contributed to a higher likelihood of anosmia, particularly noted in a trans-ethnic meta-analysis involving a large cohort across varying ancestries. Findings indicated a consistent effect size across populations, with higher prevalence of the symptom reported among women and younger respondents.
title: The UGT2A1/UGT2A2 locus is associated with COVID-19-related anosmia

finding: The variant rs6827604 in the ATP10D locus was associated with increased levels of plasma glucosylceramide (GlcCer), demonstrating a strong effect with a beta of 0.41 and a p-value of 1.076e-08. This finding indicated that ATP10D was a stronger regulator of GlcCer levels compared to variants in the GBA1 locus associated with Parkinson's disease (PD). However, upon further investigation in PD GWAS summary statistics, rs6827604 did not show an association with PD risk after Bonferroni correction, suggesting that while it influences GlcCer levels, the relationship is not directly linked to PD pathogenesis.
title: Plasma glucosylceramide levels are regulated by ATP10D and are not involved in Parkinson’s disease pathogenesis

finding: In the GWAS for alcohol consumption, the top hit was an intergenic variant mapped to the alcohol metabolism gene ADH1B, revealing a strong association with alcohol consumption traits by demonstrating a p-value of 5.20×10^-165.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: During the AUD GWAS meta-analysis, the common ADH1B variant rs1229984 emerged as the top hit with a p-value of 5.99×10^-107, supporting findings from previous studies regarding alcohol use disorder.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs13107325 was linked to endophenotype T2:67, which connected it to volumes in thalamic and nucleus accumbens structures. This SNP had earlier associations with multiple traits including schizophrenia and thalamic volume, demonstrating a significant connection with neuroimaging measurement and brain volume traits in GWAS.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: The rs1484144 SNP located in the NAA11 gene was found to be most strongly associated with several disorders, including GTS, attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), autism spectrum disorder (ASD), major depression, schizophrenia, and bipolar disorder. This positive finding emphasizes the SNP's role in the genetic basis of these psychiatric conditions.
title: An oligogenic risk-model for Gilles de la Tourette syndrome based on whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs148405652 showed a strong association with estimated mid-trimester cervical length, mapping to the TMPRSS11D gene, which plays a role in cervical remodeling through various cellular processes.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Cervical Length is Shared with Spontaneous Preterm Birth Risk

finding: The frequency of rs1155563 was significantly associated with vitamin D transport, indicating its influence on COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Variant rs191137443, found upstream of the PCDH10 gene, was associated with Raynaud's syndrome, which might connect it to pathways influencing cellular adhesion and communication in vascular tissues.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The study reported a pathogenic p.A53T mutation in the SNCA gene corresponding to the SNP rs104893877. This mutation was assessed in the context of its significantly higher penetrance compared to GBA1 and LRRK2 mutations, indicating its strong association with Parkinson's disease as part of the non-genetic and genetic profiles for this condition.
title: Changes in the cerebrospinal fluid proteome precede and stratify the course of Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The rs2708699 variant was associated with decreased levels of etiocholanolone and showed increased expression of the UGT2B17 gene in the context of hormone regulation. This finding emphasized the genetic influence on steroid hormone levels across genders.
title: Steroid hormone levels vary with sex, aging, lifestyle, and genetics

finding: The rs976002 variant was associated with increased etiocholanolone levels and was linked to decreased expression of UGT2B17. This highlighted how specific genetic variants could impact steroid hormone levels significantly.
title: Steroid hormone levels vary with sex, aging, lifestyle, and genetics

finding: The rs13107325 variant in the SLC39A8 gene was positively associated with diseases of the esophagus and musculoskeletal conditions, indicating a functional role of manganese in these disorders.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: SNP rs13107325 showed a pronounced positive mean Z-score, indicating a consistent direction of effect across cerebellar features. It was also highlighted as one of the lead SNPs that emerged from univariate analysis of total cerebellar volume in other GWASs.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in recent human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The SNP rs28862935 in the BTC gene showed significant association with pSSNS (p = 1.08 × 10^-9). This finding was noted as novel, adding to the understanding of the genetic basis of the disease.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: An intronic variant in SMR3B, associated with pituitary gland volume, displayed a positive association in females (β = 0.001) and a negative association in males (β = -0.09), indicating significant sexual dimorphism.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: Associated with hypothalamic grey matter volume, this intronic variant near MND1 resulted in a significant negative effect in females (β = -0.24) and a positive effect in males (β = 0.01), demonstrating a notable sex difference.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: This missense variant in SLC39A8 was strongly associated with the volume of brain structures including the ventral striatum, indicating wider genetic implications beyond neuroendocrine structures.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: An upstream variant of REST, this SNP was positively associated with hypothalamus volume (β = 0.04) and has prior links to testosterone regulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The missense variant rs13107325 located within Solute Carrier Family 39 Member 8 (SLC39A8) encoded ZIP8, a transporter involved in immune function. This SNP was shared across the whole amygdala and six nuclei volumes, having been previously linked to addictive behaviors, intelligence, schizophrenia, blood pressure, and cardiovascular death, all of which relate to altered amygdala volumes.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Amygdala Nuclei

finding: The SNP rs13131500 was noted to have global effects, impacting multiple nuclei volumes, including the accessory basal and anterior amygdaloid nuclei, pointing towards its significant role in the genetic architecture of amygdala structures.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Amygdala Nuclei

finding: The SNP rs16890979, a missense variant located in the SLC2A9 locus, was identified in multiple genome-wide association studies (GWAS) related to serum urate (sU) levels. Its inclusion in the analysis demonstrated a positive finding regarding the genetic basis of hyperuricemia.
title: Local genetic covariance between serum urate and kidney function obtained from local Bayesian regressions

finding: This SNP was found to be one of the seven common SNPs associated with both waist circumference (WC), hip circumference (HC), and body mass index (BMI) against polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS). Its causal relationship with PCOS underscored the relevance of central obesity.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: A genome-wide significant association was found for Huntington's disease at rs115335747 in the HTT gene (p=2.2e-8, MAF=0.0434, OR=6.024), which tagged a risk haplotype common in European cases.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The rs66887589 variant was identified as the putative causal variant in the context of colocalization analysis. It was associated with a genetic proxy for sildenafil use, which showed an increase of 0.21 children fathered, demonstrating a positive association with fertility.
title: The association of genetically proxied sildenafil with fertility, sexual activity, and wellbeing: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The splice region variant rs34712979:G>A in NPNT was found to be significantly associated with hospitalization (OR = 0.94, P = 3.8 × 10^-8) and to enhance lung function.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: This SNP contributed to the narrowest bounds computed in MoBa, when assumed jointly valid with rs9841829, leading to bounds of (-0.07, 0.73), indicating its potential relevance in the MR analysis.
title: Bounding the average causal effect in Mendelian randomization studies with multiple proposed instruments: An application to prenatal alcohol exposure and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder

finding: The rs186873296 polymorphism in FREM3 (Dantu blood group) was significantly associated with plasma PfHRP2 concentrations, achieving statistical significance (p=0.002), despite no significant associations with parasite density.
title: The impact of malaria-protective red blood cell polymorphisms on parasite biomass in children with severe Plasmodium falciparum malaria

finding: The SNP rs13118183, which is an intronic variant of the MARCHF1 gene, was also identified to interact closely with EDS. Similar to rs281851, the presence of the A allele for rs13118183 led to an increase in AHI for individuals with EDS, underscoring the potential role of this SNP in exacerbating OSA symptoms related to sleep disorders.
title: Gene-Excessive Sleepiness Interactions Suggest Treatment Targets for Obstructive Sleep Apnea Subtype

finding: The rs189093213 SNP was found to significantly increase the risk of developing LiD, being located in the LINC02353 locus. It had a reported HR of 3.06 (p = 2.81 × 10^-9), suggesting a strong association with time to LiD onset.
title: Genetic meta-analysis of levodopa induced dyskinesia in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs3774959 was identified as a UC-related variant acting as a cis-eQTL for the gene NFKB1, showing a highly significant p-value of 6.2 x 10^-41 in eQTLGen and 6.3 x 10^-05 in GTEx in whole blood. This finding suggested that rs3774959 might regulate the expression of NFKB1, which is known to play a crucial role in immune and inflammatory responses, and has been implicated in ulcerative colitis (UC). In addition, among the 106 target genes associated with NFKB1, six genes (CD74, CD83, IL1B, IL2RA, PTPN6, FOXP3) were identified as downstream targets affected by NFKB1, with an adjusted enrichment p-value of 7.5 x 10^-03. This indicates that rs3774959 potentially influences UC-status by modulating the expression levels of these downstream target genes through its cis-regulatory effect on NFKB1.
title: Aggregative trans-eQTL analysis detects trait-specific target gene sets in whole blood

finding: SNP rs1229984 was prominently associated with alcohol use phenotypes and was related to the alcohol dehydrogenase 1B gene (ADH1B). It was not associated with cigarette or cannabis use phenotypes.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: SNP rs1154433 was associated with alcohol use and was identified as an intron variant located on the ADH1B gene, suggesting its importance in alcohol metabolism.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs283412 was associated with alcohol use phenotypes and is an intron variant located on the ADH1C gene, highlighting its role in addiction.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The study detailed the relationship between the SNP rs13143439 and the efficacy of antibiotic prophylaxis in multiple myeloma patients. The findings indicated that this SNP was associated with variations in response to granulocyte-colony stimulating factor support during autologous stem cell transplantation, suggesting potential implications for personalized treatment strategies in oncological care.
title: Risk factor modelling of antimicrobial resistance in cancer patients: A systematic review

finding: The variant rs230493 in the NFKB1 locus was associated with poorer PANSS negative scores, suggesting its influence on treatment response in patients.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Similar to rs230493, rs230504 in the NFKB1 gene was associated with worse PANSS negative scores, underlining its impact on treatment outcomes.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The rs3774959 variant in NFKB1 was associated with poorer treatment outcomes both in negative and total PANSS scores, indicating its pharmacogenomic relevance.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The noncoding variant rs230493 was associated with poorer PANSS negative scores in South African patients with schizophrenia, confirming its impact on treatment response.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Similar to rs230493, rs230504 was associated with negative symptoms, suggesting its role in the treatment response variability.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The rs3774959 variant was linked with poorer PANSS negative and total scores, reaffirming its negative association with treatment responses.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs3774959 was identified as a 'cis'-eQTL of the transcription factor NFKB1, with a p-value of 6.2 × 10^-41 in eQTLGen and 6.3 × 10^-05 in GTEx for whole blood. This variant was linked to ulcerative colitis (UC), and it was highlighted that mutations in the promoter region of NFKB1 are strongly associated with UC. Furthermore, among the 106 target genes associated with the first gene component, six genes (CD74, CD83, IL1B, IL2RA, PTPN6, FOXP3) were confirmed as targets of NFKB1, with an adjusted enrichment p-value of 7.5 × 10^-03. This context indicates that rs3774959 may influence UC status by modulating the expression levels of these target genes through its regulatory impact on NFKB1.
title: Novel Aggregative trans-eQTL Association Analysis of Known Genetic Variants Detect Trait-specific Target Gene-sets

finding: The SNP rs6842426, associated with SEL1L3, was identified as significantly related to low T1D PRS, indicating a potential genetic susceptibility factor for type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs4833044 tagged TBC1D1/LINC01258 and was significantly associated with low T1D PRS, pointing to its relevance in the genetics of type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs9790756, linked to LINC02432/IL15, was associated with low T1D PRS, marking it as a significant genetic locus in the susceptibility to type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The variant rs35944082 was linked to RBPJ through T-cell- and fibroblast-specific SCENT enhancer-gene maps in tissues from arithritis, specifically inflamed synovium. Despite having low PIPs, this single variant established a connection to the RBPJ gene located 235kb away, which is critical for NOTCH signaling involved in rheumatoid arthritis. Physical contact data from promoter-capture Hi-C also supported this variant-gene link.
title: Tissue-specific enhancer-gene maps from multimodal single-cell data identify causal disease alleles

finding: The allele rs1229984 was found to have a higher frequency among mothers of control children who were unexposed to alcohol compared to mothers of children affected by fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD). This SNP is associated with the gene ADH1B, which is linked to more efficient alcohol metabolism. The study highlighted the implication of this SNP in the context of altered fetal vulnerability to prenatal alcohol exposure, particularly in the South African Cape Coloured (SACC) population where FASD prevalence is exceptionally high.
title: Genetic admixture predictors of fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD) in the South African Cape Coloured population

finding: The SNP rs356182 was identified as a lead SNP in the SNCA region. It achieved a genome-wide significant signal (p-value = 4.11E-11) in a South Asian cohort. This finding corroborated previous studies that highlighted its association with Parkinson's Disease (PD) in various populations, extending its relevance to early-onset forms of PD and confirming its role in the regulation of SNCA gene expression.
title: The genetic drivers of juvenile, young, and early-onset Parkinson’s Disease in India

finding: The rs6854508 variant near IRF2 was also associated in the analyses, indicating its potential role in the immune response against Covid-19.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: In a previous study involving 260 children, carriers of the T allele of CYP2A6 rs835309 had significantly lower concentrations of dexmedetomidine (TT + TG vs. GG, p-value = .025). This was an important finding indicating a potential pharmacogenetic effect on dexmedetomidine clearance.
title: Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Dexmedetomidine in Children using Real World Data from Electronic Health Records and Remnant Specimens

finding: The SNP rs17669915 was associated with the LEF1 gene, indicating a weak but notable association with rheumatoid arthritis, as per the findings from GWAS analyses.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: The rs62333164 SNP was part of the NEK1 locus where common and rare variants converged. It was conditionally independent from the top SNP included in the GWAS, with eQTL and mQTL analyses suggesting risk mediation.
