title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: This SNP was linked to the GALNTL6 gene and was within an eQTL interval that indicated its impact on GALNTL6 expression in T cells. Additionally, Hi-C interactions confirmed its linkage to the GALNTL6 promoter, reinforcing its role in modifying glycosylation processes relevant to muscular function.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The rs558129 SNP was identified in a GWAS comparing endurance athletes to sedentary controls, revealing significant associations with muscular performance traits. Specifically, it indicated a predisposition toward either endurance or strength training based on allele frequency.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The rs279858 SNP was associated with anxiety-related phenotypes, including reduced risk-taking behavior, increased nervous feelings, and reduced number of lifetime sexual partners. These traits could indicate behavioral inhibition or anxiety, which were previously linked to a higher risk for Alcohol Use Disorders (AUD). The association suggested potential pathways linking rs279858 to AUD and indicated its significance in influencing alcohol-related behaviors.
title: Is anxiety a pathway to Alcohol Use Disorders? A phenome-wide association study of the GABRA2 coding variant rs279858

finding: The SNP rs12641856 located at the 4q34.3 locus was significantly associated with more positive changes in ΔNIHSS, primarily driven by the Korean cohort.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The SNP rs138495951, an intergenic variant associated with the alcohol metabolism gene ADH1B, was the top hit in the alcohol consumption GWAS with a p-value of 5.20×10^-165, replicating previous findings for alcohol-related traits.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs1229984, a common variant in the ADH1B gene, emerged as the top hit in the AUD GWAS meta-analysis, with a highly significant p-value of 5.99×10^-107, corroborating prior studies on alcohol use disorder.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: The research indicated that the allele C and genotype CC at the rs4045481 locus in the RNF212 gene were significantly more frequent in patients with azoospermia compared to controls. Additionally, it was reported that the homozygous CC genotype might diminish pre-mRNA activity by eliminating binding motifs for SRSF5, which could lead to lowered RNF212 expression and negatively affect spermatogenesis, heightening azoospermia risk. Despite the association of increased RNF212 expression with heightened risk of dorsopathies, the specific mechanisms behind this correlation needed further investigation.
title: Genome-wide Mendelian Randomization Identifies Potential Drug Targets for Dorsopathies

finding: The rs7674221 SNP at the RCL1 locus was identified as a new genome-wide significant locus in FTLD-TDP B, further contributing to the understanding of genetic risk in FTLD-TDP.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: This common variant located near <italic>HS3ST1</italic> was associated with AAO, suggesting a connection between heparin sulfate pathways and dementia progression.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: Similarly, rs144334834 was part of the SNPs analyzed that revealed a causal association between Graves' disease and Type 2 diabetes. This SNP's involvement in the MR analysis pointed towards an elevated risk of T2D among affected individuals.
title: The causal relationship between Graves’ disease and type 2 diabetes: Evidence from Bidirectional Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs145745951 in the MUC7 gene was identified as associated with cleft lip and/or palate (CL/P). It was shown that MUC7, which is normally upregulated, was significantly downregulated in CL/P patients. This SNP was analyzed through variant analysis and reported due to its differential expression in CL/P individuals compared to healthy controls.
title: Mucin-7 as a Potential Candidate Risk Allele for Cleft Lip and/or Palate

finding: This SNP was linked to heart failure in the context of multiple studies, indicating a strong genetic influence on HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: Associated with heart failure and indicated a connection to alcohol consumption, stressing the interaction between genetics and lifestyle.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: Tied to smoking behavior, this SNP emphasized lifestyle impacts on heart failure risk, underlining behavioral phenotypes in HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP was found to have a strong association with Parkinson’s disease (PD), contributing significantly to genetic variability among patients.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The rs2870004 SNP was associated with both Parkinson’s disease (PD) and idiopathic REM Sleep Behavior Disorder (iRBD), indicating its role in the risk for these conditions.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: This SNP showed a strong association with Dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB), highlighting its relevance as a risk factor for this neurodegenerative disorder.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: Strongly associated with Dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB), this SNP was recognized as a significant risk determinant for the condition.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The rs2231142 variant in the ABCG2 gene demonstrated a significantly higher allele frequency in Kalingas, which was associated with increased rosuvastatin accumulation in systemic circulation, impacting drug management for dyslipidemia and coronary heart disease.
title: Endogamy and high prevalence of deleterious mutations in India: evidence from strong founder events

finding: The G allele of rs117130410 was associated with an increased risk of bipolar disorder (OR = 1.31, P = 3.69×10^-8) in the East Asian ancestry meta-analysis. This SNP was novel and had a minor allele frequency of 16% in BD cases and 9% in controls among East Asians, being monomorphic in non-Asian populations. The nearest protein-coding genes were TET2 and CXXC4.
title: Genetic diversity enhances gene discovery for bipolar disorder

finding: This variant near the PPARGC1A gene was associated with T2D, possessing an odds ratio of 3.0 (95% CI: 2.1-4.5, p = 1.79 x 10^-8). Its location in a muscle-specific enhancer suggests significant involvement in energy metabolism regulation.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: This novel lead SNP within HTT was linked with educational attainment and cognitive ability, making it relevant to reading ability.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: This SNP was associated with fractures (beta=-0.06, p-value=7.4×10^-12), showing a strong proxy relationship with certain traits related to the IDUA gene.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: This SNP was linked to several phenotypes including waist-to-hip ratio and inflammatory diseases (beta=-0.017, p-value<7.6×10^-21), indicating its relevance in IDUA-related pathways.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: rs3796622 was associated with type 1 diabetes risk (beta=-0.07, p-value<1.7×10^-7), further emphasizing its role in metabolic pathways.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs1229984, a missense variant in the ADH1B gene, was associated with alcohol phenotypes. This association highlighted its role in the genetic underpinnings of alcohol use and involved significant genetic effects on behavioral disinhibition and SUDs.
title: Advancing Gene Discovery for Substance Use Disorders Using Additional Traits Related to Behavioral Disinhibition

finding: The SNP rs13135092, an intronic variant located in the SLC39A8 gene, was associated with alcohol use disorders (AUD). Its identification as a significant Q_SNP locus indicated its relevance for substance-specific genetic influences.
title: Advancing Gene Discovery for Substance Use Disorders Using Additional Traits Related to Behavioral Disinhibition

finding: The SNP rs34712979 was identified as a lead cis-pQTL for nephronectin (NPNT). A one standard deviation increase in NPNT associated with severe COVID-19, illustrating its significant role in mediating the effects of obesity on COVID-19 severity, with an odds ratio of 1.71 (95% CI: 1.45–2.02, P = 1.63 × 10^-10). This SNP was also linked to lung-related traits and was found to create a cryptic splice acceptor site that could affect NPNT levels.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization implicates nephronectin as an actionable mediator of the effect of obesity on COVID-19 severity

finding: The variant rs12331618 was associated with pulmonary heart disease and demonstrated significant effects on the expression of ADK in various tissues.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The variant rs3733402 in the KLKB1 gene exhibited perfect linkage with rs12331618 and was linked to cTnI regulation.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The SNP rs17042098 was identified as an index variant for the PITX2 locus, but details of its specific findings were not highlighted as being novel or further characterized in this study.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: The SNP rs13107325 on chromosome 4 was significantly associated with the LBS of the left cerebellum white matter, exhibiting the strongest signal in this study (p=2.15E-74). This SNP affected the metal transporter SLC39A8 and was recognized as a risk factor for schizophrenia, also implicating its involvement in inflammation-related diseases, blood pressure regulation, and various brain imaging phenotypes.
title: Beyond Volume: Unraveling the Genetics of Human Brain Geometry

finding: An association was found between this low-frequency variant near FAT1 and increased time to glucose trough during glipizide response, indicating diminished efficacy with a p-value of 9.8x10^-9.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The rs34712979 variant was identified as a significant association with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and lung function, creating a novel splice acceptor site that resulted in the inclusion of a three-nucleotide sequence coding for a serine in the nephronectin protein. This variant was shown to modulate COPD risk and was highly likely to be a shared causal variant in the genetic association signals for COPD and lung spirometry measures, with a posterior probability of 94%.
title: Characterization of a COPD-Associated NPNT Functional Splicing Genetic Variant in Human Lung Tissue via Long-Read Sequencing

finding: Served as a proxy for a SNP absent in the birthweight GWAS and maintained relevance in the study despite direct association not being determined.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: rs6050 was shown to be in high linkage (r2=0.98) with the 28 bp insertion from rs148317511, and the linkage pattern suggested its association with venous thromboembolism, providing context for the interaction between SVs and nearby GWAS SNPs in affecting gene functions.
title: The Great Genotyper: A Graph-Based Method for Population Genotyping of Small and Structural Variants

finding: This SNP was linked with rs6050 and associated with a peak impact on gamma fibrinogen. The analysis indicated that rs7681423 maintained some linkage (r2=76) with the 28 bp insertion, facilitating the study of gene expression implications, especially concerning total fibrinogen levels.
title: The Great Genotyper: A Graph-Based Method for Population Genotyping of Small and Structural Variants

finding: The SNP rs2070011-A was reported to be part of a unique haplotype (r2=96) with the insertion from rs148317511. This allele was associated with higher expression of the fibrinogen gene, providing insights into the regulation of the gene in relation to structural variants.
title: The Great Genotyper: A Graph-Based Method for Population Genotyping of Small and Structural Variants

finding: Linked to cortical thickness in the left pars opercularis with a p-value of 2.61×10−9, the gene ADGRL3 (formerly LPHN3) near this SNP was strongly associated with ADHD.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: This SNP was identified in the right banks of the STS and was linked through linkage disequilibrium with rs9996981 (p=9.94×10−20), which is related to the gene FGF2 implicated in anxiety and depression.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: It was in linkage disequilibrium with rs531970391 and involved in gene FGF2, which has been implicated in anxiety and depression.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The variant rs356182 in the SNCA locus was confirmed in the GWAS as one of the previously reported risk loci for PD, with a beta of -0.38, SE of 0.07, and p-value of 5.64E-08.
title: Insights on Genetic and Environmental Factors in Parkinson’s Disease from a regional Swedish Case-Control Cohort

finding: The rs233806 variant was found associated with blood pressure, HDL-C, and BMI, underlining its involvement in heart failure risk factor landscape.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs28666788 showed significant associations with alcohol consumption and indicated reductions in FEV1 per unit increases in PM10 exposure.
title: Genome-wide gene-air pollution interaction analysis of lung function in 300,000 individuals

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant coding missense variant linked with NAFLD disease risk.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The TT genotype of rs12504628 (T>C) in the HHIP gene reduced the risk of severe bronchial asthma (BA) with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.221, while the C allele was more frequent in severe cases (77%) versus non-severe cases (52%). Additionally, it increased the risk of combined atopic dermatitis with BA 2.8 times.
title: Association of Polymorphic Variants of HHIP, ADRB2 and IL-33 Genes with Clinical Manifestations of Bronchial Asthma in Children

finding: The study reported that the SNP rs13143439 was associated with antibiotic prophylaxis in multiple myeloma patients undergoing autologous stem cell transplantation. This association highlighted the importance of genetic factors in influencing the risk of infections and mortality in cancer patients, particularly in the context of antimicrobial resistance.
title: Clinical outcomes of antimicrobial resistance in cancer patients: A systematic review of multivariable models

finding: For rs6841352, there was significant evidence of differing effects by sex, where males had an effect approximately 2.27 times larger than females (95% CI: 1.38 - 3.17). This finding supports the notion of sex-specific genetic risk factors in the context of DLB.
title: Identification of a sex-specific genetic signature in dementia with Lewy bodies: a meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs10008032 was identified under positive selection and was associated with opposing effects on hay fever and breast cancer, indicating its pleiotropic conflict.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The SNP rs5743618 was associated with decreased risk of asthma and hay fever, while also linked to increased risk of breast cancer, demonstrating a genetic trade-off in immune-related contexts.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The rs62313082 variant associated with urinary ethanolamine and functioned as a kidney eQTL for ETNPPL gene, supporting its potential role in kidney functions.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The SNP rs13123023 was associated with familial risk and heritability of hematologic malignancies, specifically within the context of the Nordic Twin Study of Cancer. This finding suggested a genetic contribution to pediatric and adolescent leukemia, linking it to the larger population patterns observed in twin studies.
title: First-born twin has a higher risk of acute leukemia in a population-based assessment of cancer in twins in California, and lower than anticipated rate of twin concordance

finding: The SNP rs4859682 at SHROOM3 was associated with serum magnesium levels, with a P-value of 5.33×10^-5, supporting findings from Meyer et al.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses in an individual population study help characterize kidney function genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs13146355 at SHROOM3 demonstrated a relationship with eGFRcrea levels, where the association with lower magnesium levels was found to correspond with higher eGFRcrea levels, indicating partial mediation of the effect of magnesium on eGFRcrea.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses in an individual population study help characterize kidney function genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs148433063 in pseudogene RP11-340A13.2 was genome-wide significant (p=4.36×10^-9) in the MVP meta-analysis.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs192764155 in RP11-506N2.1 showed suggestive significance in the analysis.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The rs780744847 variant (c.1180C>T/p.R394*) was found only in severe Covid-19 patients and not in non-severe patients. This variant was associated with TLR3 deficiency, which may increase the incidences of viral infections and impair type I interferon production during SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Rare Variants in Inborn Errors of Immunity Genes Associated with Covid-19 Severity

finding: The SNP rs2869462 was identified as a key variant regulating levels of CXCL10 protein following Chlamydia trachomatis infection. This SNP showed colocalization with a risk locus for inflammatory bowel disease, exhibiting a posterior probability of 0.90 that both traits share the same causal variant. The findings indicated a strong correlation between genetic variants linked to CXCL9 blood levels and CXCL10 protein levels.
title: An atlas connecting shared genetic architecture of human diseases and molecular phenotypes provides insight into COVID-19 susceptibility

finding: The missense SNP rs1229984 in ADH1B, an enzyme involved in ethanol metabolism, reflected modifications in the risk for non-alcoholic steatohepatitis and liver fibrosis.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs3756059 was identified as a risk variant for rapid eye movement (REM) sleep behavior disorder (RBD) in the genome-wide association study (GWAS). It was associated with increased expression of the gene SNCA-AS1 in multiple brain regions, including the frontal cortex, anterior cingulate cortex, cerebellum, and spinal cord, all with statistical significance after correction for multiple comparisons.
title: Genome-wide association study of REM sleep behavior disorder identifies novel loci with distinct polygenic and brain expression effects

finding: The SNP rs7697073 was associated with RBD in the current GWAS and linked to increased expression of SCARB2 in cortical regions, though these associations were nominal and lacked significance after multiple testing correction. This SNP highlighted the differential gene expression patterns pertinent to RBD.
title: Genome-wide association study of REM sleep behavior disorder identifies novel loci with distinct polygenic and brain expression effects

finding: The SNP rs4148157 was associated with gout, showing a major allele frequency (MAF) of 0.073 in the European ancestry (1KG-EUR) and 0.25 in the East-Asian ancestry (1KG-EAS). The phenotypic variance explained by this SNP was significantly higher in East-Asian populations (8.3%) compared to European populations (3.0%). This indicated that the SNP played a crucial role in predicting gout risk, particularly in populations with predominant EAS ancestry.
title: Global biobank analyses provide lessons for computing polygenic risk scores across diverse cohorts

finding: The SNP rs73876031, found within the FRG1 gene, was reported as a novel association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: Linked to INTS12|NPNT, this variant was also noted for its association with improved pulmonary function metrics, contributing positively to COVID-19 pathology understanding.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: SNP rs13107325 showed pronounced positive mean z-scores, indicating a consistent direction of effect across several cerebellar features. It was noted to have emerged in previous GWAS studies on total cerebellar volume.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The SNP rs13107325, located in the gene SLC39A8, was associated with basal ganglia volumes and previously linked to schizophrenia (SCZ) and Parkinson's disease (PD). Its combined annotation-dependent depletion (CADD) score was 23.1, indicating deleterious protein effects. SLC39A8 is a transmembrane protein involved in cation transport, particularly manganese, which is crucial for dopaminergic neuronal function.
title: Unveiling the Genetic Landscape of Basal Ganglia: Implications for Common Brain Disorders

finding: The SNP rs1825819 was identified as a novel locus for neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio (NLR) with a beta of -0.05 and a p-value of 2.00 x 10^-9. This was notable as there were no known previous phenotype associations or functions identified for this specific SNP.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study of neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio and polygenic risk score development to explore causal association with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The variant rs79762542 reached study-wide significance and was associated with a higher HbA1c in individuals with a greater proportion of calories from carbohydrate compared to fat, specifically among minor allele carriers. This finding was replicated in the UK Biobank cohort and highlighted the variant's potential role in gene-diet interactions affecting glycemic phenotypes.
title: Investigating gene-diet interactions impacting the association between macronutrient intake and glycemic traits

finding: The SNP rs116607983 on chromosome 4 was found to be associated with MSA with a P-value of 4.0 × 10^-6 and an odds ratio (OR) of 2.93 (95% CI = 1.86-4.63). It is situated in a region devoid of protein-coding genes, suggesting further investigation could clarify its role in MSA risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of autopsy-confirmed Multiple System Atrophy identifies common variants near ZIC1 and ZIC4

finding: The study revealed that the Dantu genotypes inferred from the rs186873296 FREM3 allele provided high-level protection against early, non-clinical Plasmodium falciparum malaria infections in vivo, showing 0% parasitaemia among Dantu heterozygotes and homozygotes compared to 22.5% in non-Dantu subjects.
title: Controlled Human Malaria Infection reveals that the Dantu blood group variant provides high level protection against uncomplicated malaria

finding: This was reported as a new variant in the known locus of HGFAC, with a linkage disequilibrium value (r2) of 0.35 with the previously reported GWAS SNP rs2073505, thus implicating the gene directly in disease risk for the first time.
title: Sequencing of over 100,000 individuals identifies multiple genes and rare variants associated with Crohns disease susceptibility

finding: The rs115822934 SNP in NPY5R was replicated in the PAD meta-analysis with a P-value of 3.21e-04, implying its association with amyloid pathology and potentially panic disorders.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: This locus associated with T2D was newly reported, indicating novel genetic influences on the disease.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs28839214 near RP11-361D14.2 was positively correlated to FVC (P=1.91×10^-13, β=0.0197). No prior associations were reported for this SNP.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The rs62316278 variant was identified as the lead SNP associated with alternative inclusion of exon 4 of the BTC gene. The C allele was linked to increased exon 4 inclusion, and this colocalized with findings from COPD GWAS, indicating potential relevance to COPD risk. The inclusion of exon 4 corresponded to a higher proportion of the primary BTC isoform, suggesting that reduced exon inclusion might be protective against COPD.
title: Overlap between COPD genetic association results and transcriptional quantitative trait loci

finding: The study reported that obese participants carrying the minor G allele of the CLOCK gene rs4580704 variant had their lunch significantly later than those carrying the major allele. This finding highlighted the impact of this genetic polymorphism on meal timing.
title: Circadian meal timing is heritable and associated with insulin sensitivity

finding: This variant was significantly associated with incident CVD with an HR of 1.89 (95% CI 1.52 – 2.35), P = 9.9×10^-9. It was present at low frequency and resided near the HS3ST1 gene.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: Although primarily a part of the credible set for the HS3ST1 locus, this variant was included as significant in the analysis, representing potential regulatory effects on HS3ST1.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: This variant was found within the credible set for the HS3ST1 locus and is likely influencing HS3ST1 expression based on its annotations.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The SNP rs28406288 was noted among the novel loci identified in the study and had a CADD score above 20, predicting pathogenic potential.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs227293 was located in the MANBA gene on chromosome 4 and was found to be associated with both ADHD and ASD. This gene is related to beta-mannosidosis, which exhibits a wide spectrum of neurological phenotypes, linking it to the shared etiology of the two disorders.
title: Identification of shared and differentiating genetic risk for autism spectrum disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and case subgroups

finding: This SNP was associated with externalizing behavior traits, particularly showing phenotypic associations with chronotype, schizophrenia, and social support. It was among the four novel SNPs found in the study and was located on chromosome 4.
title: A Multivariate Genome-Wide Association Study Reveals Neural Correlates and Common Biological Mechanisms of Psychopathology Spectra

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the novel SNPs associated with externalizing behaviors. Like rs1961547, it showed phenotypic associations with chronotype, schizophrenia, and social support, and was also located on chromosome 4.
title: A Multivariate Genome-Wide Association Study Reveals Neural Correlates and Common Biological Mechanisms of Psychopathology Spectra

finding: This SNP, another novel finding on chromosome 4, was linked with externalizing traits and demonstrated phenotypic associations with chronotype, schizophrenia, and social support.
title: A Multivariate Genome-Wide Association Study Reveals Neural Correlates and Common Biological Mechanisms of Psychopathology Spectra

finding: This SNP was identified on chromosome 4 as a novel association linked to internalizing behavior and was particularly strong with MDD, showing phenotypic ties to neuroticism and depression.
title: A Multivariate Genome-Wide Association Study Reveals Neural Correlates and Common Biological Mechanisms of Psychopathology Spectra

finding: The rs16998073 variant at the FGF5 locus achieved genome-wide significance across all phenotypes studied, replicating previous findings on its association with preeclampsia.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The variant rs1458038 was established as being in high linkage disequilibrium with rs16998073 and also demonstrated significant associations with preeclampsia, confirming prior results.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: In the genome-wide association study (GWAS) that investigated the genetic components of pain treatment response (PTR) in nociceptive musculoskeletal pain (NMP), rs549224715 was identified as a genome-wide significant association (P = 3.92 × 10<sup>−8</sup>). This SNP was located in an intergenic region on chromosome 4 and was associated with processes linked to pain response, although its precise link to PTR remained unclear. The nearest gene to this SNP was CWH43, which is associated with Seckel Syndrome, while TXK, a gene involved in regulating the adaptive immune response, was also linked to this SNP through expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) analyses.
title: Genome-wide association study of nociceptive musculoskeletal pain treatment response in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1442060, an intron variant in GABRA2, was associated with significant findings regarding gene expression patterns. It was observed that GABRA2 was upregulated early in life and downregulated later for both major and minor allele homozygotes, while expression remained stable over time for heterozygotes. This gene's expression dynamics were relevant to depression risk across the lifespan.
title: Sensitive period-regulating genetic pathways and exposure to adversity shape risk for depression

finding: The rs10005233 SNP in the SNCA locus was associated with an increased risk for probable REM sleep behavior disorder (PD+RBD) compared to PD-RBD with an odds ratio of 1.21 and a p-value of 1.81e-15. This SNP was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with other known variants.
title: Genome-wide association study of REM sleep behavior disorder in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs5019538 SNP in the SNCA locus was associated with a decreased risk for PD+RBD, with an odds ratio of 0.85 and a p-value of 2.46E-10. This finding was consistent with its independent effects identified in GWAS studies.
title: Genome-wide association study of REM sleep behavior disorder in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs356182 SNP in the SNCA locus was also associated with a decreased risk for PD+RBD, showing an odds ratio of 0.89 and a p-value of 0.0001. This finding strengthens the link between SNP variants in SNCA and the risk of PD+RBD.
title: Genome-wide association study of REM sleep behavior disorder in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7668531, located between the MMRN1 and SNCA genes, also increased the odds of developing dementia with an odds ratio of 1.39 (95% CI = 1.267 - 1.525, P = 3.25E-12). This SNP was closely linked to rs7680557, which was previously associated with dementia.
title: Investigation of the genetic aetiology of Lewy body diseases with and without dementia

finding: The SNP was involved in identifying novel associations through Peds-Phecodes. A total of 348 new associations were detected, including 97 for the new phecode 465.3 'Acute upper respiratory infection', highlighting the enhanced ability of Peds-Phecodes to uncover novel genotype-phenotype relationships.
title: Developing and Evaluating Pediatric Phecodes (Peds-Phecodes) for High-Throughput Phenotyping Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs13107325 exhibited pronounced positive mean Z-scores, indicating a consistent direction of effect across cerebellar features and emerged in univariate analyses concerning total cerebellar volume.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The SNP rs1229984 in the gene ADH1B was associated with alcohol-related mutational signatures SBS16, DBS4, and ID11 in a study involving 265 independent samples. This association suggested a significant role of this variant genotype in influencing mutational patterns associated with alcohol consumption.
title: The Complexity of Tobacco Smoke-Induced Mutagenesis in Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs1573496 in the gene ADH7 was also linked to the alcohol-related mutational signatures SBS16, DBS4, and ID11. Similar to rs1229984, this finding indicated that the variant genotype of rs1573496 had an impact on the mutational landscape due to alcohol exposure in the same cohort of 265 samples.
title: The Complexity of Tobacco Smoke-Induced Mutagenesis in Head and Neck Cancer

finding: Found upstream of the *PCDH10* gene, this SNP was genome-wide significant and adds further complexity to the genetic landscape of Raynaud's syndrome, suggesting functional connections through cadherin family proteins.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The AGA locus (lead SNP rs12645096) was identified with aspartic acid levels. This SNP was shown to encode aspartylglucosaminidase and was significantly associated with increased levels of Asp.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: At the GC locus (lead SNP rs1352846), a known association with 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3 was identified.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SULT1B1-SULT1E1 locus (lead SNP rs1220712) was newly associated with estrone levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The KLKB1 locus (lead SNP rs4253255) highlighted perturbations in amino acid pathways.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs13102479 was reported in studies exploring risk factors for COVID-19 in cancer patients. Specifically, it was associated with an elevated risk of severe COVID-19 outcomes in cancer patients, particularly those with hematologic malignancies and lung cancer, suggesting a genetic predisposition that might influence severity. This finding illustrates the importance of genetic factors in evaluating risks for individuals with specific cancer types, enhancing understanding of how genetic variations can interact with environmental factors such as viral infections.
title: COVID-19 outcomes by cancer status, type, treatment, and vaccination

finding: The SNP rs13143573 was discussed in the context of vaccine safety among cancer patients, showing that despite the presence of this SNP, vaccinations significantly reduced the risk of severe COVID-19 outcomes. However, individuals carrying this SNP still exhibited a higher risk of breakthrough infections and severe disease post-vaccination. This highlights the relevance of examining SNPs like rs13143573 when assessing patient management and treatment strategies, particularly in the oncology setting.
title: COVID-19 outcomes by cancer status, type, treatment, and vaccination

finding: The SNP rs3756059 at the SNCA locus was associated with rapid eye movement (REM) sleep behavior disorder (RBD) in the GWAS, indicating an increased expression of SNCA-AS1 in multiple cortical regions including the frontal cortex, anterior cingulate cortex, cerebellum, and spinal cord. This association was statistically significant after correction for multiple comparisons.
title: Genome-wide association study of REM sleep behavior disorder identifies novel loci with distinct polygenic and brain expression effects

finding: The SNP rs7697073 at the SCARB2 locus was found associated with RBD in the current GWAS, showing a significant association with increased expression of SCARB2 in the cortex, although these associations were nominal and not significant after multiple testing correction.
title: Genome-wide association study of REM sleep behavior disorder identifies novel loci with distinct polygenic and brain expression effects

finding: The SNP rs138178446 also maintained significance under the conservative Bonferroni-corrected threshold, indicating its relevance to heart failure.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs450373 was identified as a cis-pQTL for CXCL5.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: This SNP was associated with KLB, vital for the signaling of the trans-affected protein FGF19.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs13107325 was identified as the most significant shared locus for systolic and diastolic blood pressure, which was jointly associated with medulla oblongata volume. It is located within the SLC39A8 gene, known to encode a cellular metal ion transporter. The major allele of SLC39A8 was found to be highly pleiotropic, corresponding with increased systolic and diastolic blood pressure and essential for normal heart development.
title: Large-scale brainstem neuroimaging and genetic analyses provide new insights into the neuronal mechanisms of hypertension

finding: The rs116625313 variant within the PRKG2;RASGEF1B locus was noted for its low-frequency association specifically in females, indicating notable sex-specific differences in POAG susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: RS4699714 was found to have a slight negative association with IQ in children, consistent with findings from Lewis et al. 2012.
title: Prenatal alcohol consumption and child IQ and cognition: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1229984 was identified as a missense variant in the ADH1B gene, which influences alcohol processing in the liver. It exhibited a strong vQTL effect (p = 1.71×10^-13) on ALT, a biomarker of liver stress, although it did not have a main effect in the meta-analysis. The most significant GEI involved self-reported alcohol intake frequency (p = 1.9×10^-12), indicating that major allele carriers were more susceptible to increases in ALT levels with higher alcohol consumption.
title: Variance-quantitative trait loci enable systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions for cardiometabolic serum biomarkers

finding: A rare causal variant in MTTP, c.1691T>C p.I564T (rs745447480), was identified in a four-generation family associated with progressive non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) leading to severe conditions like cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma. This finding related specifically to the dysfunctional secretion of lipoprotein ApoB and subsequent metabolic disturbances.
title: Identification and functional characterisation of a rare MTTP variant underlying hereditary non-alcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: This SNP was identified as associating with the FLL type IIa phenotype, located upstream of the PPARGC1A gene, linking it to lipid regulation and potential energy metabolism pathways.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: The lead variant for FAM13A, this SNP was uniquely associated with the type IIb phenotype, also increasing the risk for type IV, implicating adipocyte differentiation in lipid phenotype regulation.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: The rs11933540 SNP was found in the RBPJ locus and was localized in fibroblast-like synoviocytes (FLS) specific enhancers. This indicated that the putative causal SNPs in the RBPJ locus might specifically affect the function of FLS in rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
title: Functional genomics atlas of synovial fibroblasts defining rheumatoid arthritis heritability

finding: The rs874040 SNP was highlighted as a candidate causal SNP in the RBPJ locus affecting its expression in FLS, showing a joint-specific effect wherein FLS homozygous for the risk allele exhibited lower RBPJ expression, indicating a link to the pathogenesis of RA.
title: Functional genomics atlas of synovial fibroblasts defining rheumatoid arthritis heritability

finding: SLC2A9 variant rs13129697-T showed positive association with circulating urate concentrations without broader metabolic influences, thus highlighting a specific role in urate transport.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: ADH1B variant rs1229984-T was found to significantly influence urate production dependent on alcohol consumption and showed a connection to gout risk.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: Associated with FVC (P=1.91×10^-13, β=0.0197), this SNP was newly identified in the analysis.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs6822844 was confirmed to be associated with multiple autoimmune diseases, providing evidence that it is a general susceptibility locus that may also influence the risk of type 1 diabetes in offspring.
title: Effect of parental autoimmune diseases on type 1 diabetes in offspring can be partially explained by HLA and non-HLA polymorphisms: a nationwide registry and biobank-based study in 7.2M Finns

finding: For the SNP rs35213808, situated between FSTL5 and MIR4454, a significant association with early-onset gout was detected with a meta-analysis P value of 4.02 × 10^-8 and an odds ratio of 1.49.
title: Novel genetic loci in adolescent-onset gout derived from whole genome sequencing of a Chinese cohort

finding: The lead variant rs34867104 showed a strong association with lower odds of having VMS (OR=0.78, P=1.7x10^-20), indicating that this variant played a significant role in genetic susceptibility to VMS.
title: Genomic insights into the mechanism of NK3R antagonists for treatment of menopausal vasomotor symptoms

finding: Identified as one of the novel SNPs that showed a positive genetic correlation between obesity (BMI) and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs17042081 was recognized as the most highly activated variant in the GLN-model for individuals classified as not having AF. This variant is located in close proximity to the PITX2 gene on chromosome 4q25, a region extensively associated with AF. It is noteworthy for its strong association with AF observed in diverse populations.
title: An assessment of the value of deep neural networks in genetic risk prediction for surgically relevant outcomes

finding: In the linear model, rs17042171 was found to be the variant most associated with AF. Like rs17042081, it is located near 4q25 and its alternative allele has a notable worldwide prevalence. The findings indicated a complex selection pressure concerning this risk allele.
title: An assessment of the value of deep neural networks in genetic risk prediction for surgically relevant outcomes

finding: SNP rs2904297 found in the CLNK gene presented a p-value of 1.20×10^-10 in stage 2, reflecting its potential link to Alzheimer’s disease risk.
The NOCT:rs13116075-G variant showcased a modifying effect, being protective in African ancestry while increasing risk in African Admixed ancestry when associated with APOE ε4.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs13109980, associated with the gene MAML3, was related to lifetime smoking, indicating a genetic link to smoking behaviors that could influence the development of COPD.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs2865375 was significantly associated with endometrial cancer and was noted in correlation with markers for FGT polyps, marking its importance.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The SNP rs1979974 located on ZNF827 demonstrated a unique association with the diameter about 13mm distal to the sinotubular junction, contributing to the prediction of thoracic aortic aneurysm and related to telomere synthesis and cell viability.
title: Using Machine Learning to Elucidate the Spatial and Genetic Complexity of the Ascending Aorta

finding: Identified as a new genome-wide significant locus at 4q35.1-<italic>ENPP6</italic>, this variant highlighted novel contributions to overall CH susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs67982721 was associated with lung cancer development, showing a very strong significant genetic signal among Asians, but a weak signal among Europeans and Africans. It was highlighted as a common variant associated with ZFP42, which is involved in predictive methylation models for lung cancer.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The HPF1 variant rs183834244 on 4q33 was associated with squamous cell carcinoma risk, interacting with DNA repair mechanisms.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP near LINC02382 and LINC01612 was linked with squamous cell carcinoma risk.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The intergenic variant rs144058808 between LINC02510 and PCDH18 was significantly associated with squamous cell carcinoma risk.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Identified as associated with squamous cell carcinoma development, being located near genes of relevance.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs28862935 in the betacellulin (BTC) gene was also identified as significantly associated with pSSNS, with a p-value of 1.08 × 10−9. This association was part of the novel findings of the study.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs356182 located in the SNCA region showed a strong association with Parkinson's disease (PD) risk, highlighting the significance of this variant in PD pathogenesis.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs2870004 was associated with both Parkinson's disease (PD) and idiopathic REM Sleep Behavior Disorder (iRBD), indicating its relevance in multiple synucleinopathies.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs7681440 exhibited an association with Dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB), contributing to the understanding of genetic predisposition in this specific type of dementia.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs7680557 was identified as associated with DLB, further supporting the role of genetic variants in the pathogenesis of this disorder.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The lead variant rs16998073 located near FGF5 was replicated in this study, reinforcing previous findings and reaching genome-wide significance across multiple phenotypes.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: This missense variant was associated with gout in the ABCG2 gene specifically in the African population, representing an independent signal from another known variant, rs2231142.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: Previously identified SNP associated with hyperuricemia and susceptibility to gout, it was part of a distinct gout signal found in the East Asian (EAS) and EUR populations.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP was associated with loci that colocalised with signals in previous HOA GWAS, suggesting its involvement in cartilage regulation linked to HOA.
title: Hip joint space width is causally related to hip osteoarthritis risk via distinct protective and susceptibility mechanisms: findings from a genome-wide association study meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs6855309 on chromosome 4q28 was a lead SNP that approached genome-wide significance in the LCL vs. RCL analysis (p-value = 8.4 × 10^-8). It was located 400 kb downstream of the FAT4 gene and indicated that the minor allele increased the risk for LCL over RCL (OR = 2.21). However, no significant association was observed in LCLP vs. RCLP comparisons.
title: FAT4 Identified as a Potential Modifier of Orofacial Cleft Laterality

finding: The SNP rs3857067 was positively associated with QTc duration, indicating that it could be an influencing factor in QTc interval prolongation. This SNP was mapped to the genes HMGB3P15/ARAP2, which are involved in cardiovascular risk.
title: Genetic QT Score and Sleep Apnea as Predictors of Sudden Cardiac Death in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs230493 SNP in NFKB1 was linked to higher PANSS negative symptoms scores, underlining its relevance in understanding treatment response dynamics.
title: Pharmacogenomic Diversity in Psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Similar to rs230493, the rs230504 variant in NFKB1 was associated with adverse symptoms in treatment, highlighting its importance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Pharmacogenomic Diversity in Psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Associations were found between rs3774959 in NFKB1 and higher PANSS total scores, pointing to its role in schizophrenia symptomatology during treatment.
title: Pharmacogenomic Diversity in Psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs6599388 was identified as fine-mapped for the genes GAK and TMEM175, both of which were linked to multiple diseases, specifically Parkinson's Disease (PD) and Lewy Body Dementia (LBD). Importantly, the expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) effects for this SNP were found to exhibit opposing effects in the context of LBD, indicating different regulatory mechanisms at play in this region.
title: Human brain single nucleus cell type enrichments in neurodegenerative diseases

finding: In the study, it was found that T-carriers of the <italic>TMEM175</italic> rs34311866 exhibited higher gray matter (GM) to functional (Fun) node coupling, white matter (WM) to Fun node coupling, and GM to WM node coupling compared to CC carriers. This difference was statistically significant with a p-value less than 0.0001. Furthermore, these T-carriers demonstrated milder motor and non-motor symptoms, indicating a potential connection between this SNP's influence on node coupling and the clinical manifestations of Parkinson's disease (PD). The findings highlighted the role of this SNP in shaping structural-functional coupling in PD patients, particularly its association with disease severity.
title: Altered structural-functional coupling in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs5743618 SNP located within the TLR1-TLR6-TLR10 gene cluster on chromosome 4 was found to have genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.8e-13. Despite its significant association with IMR, the study reported null results for this locus when assessing the year-to-year trends and differences in allele frequencies in relation to counties with varying IMR, indicating that its role may not have been as pronounced as that of the LCT locus.
title: GWAS on Birth Year Infant Mortality Rates Provides New Evidence of Recent Natural Selection

finding: The NOCT:rs13116075-G variant showed interactive effects with APOE ε4, demonstrating increased frequency in African and African Admixed ancestries, while adversely impacting risk in African Admixed ancestry.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The rs13107325 variant was implicated in a genetic correlation between schizophrenia and metabolic syndrome (MetS). It mapped to the SLC39A8 gene, which is known to modulate the activity of miRNA hsa-miR-374b-5p. This gene's variant was linked to altered brain manganese levels and various neuropsychiatric conditions, including developmental and cardio-metabolic diseases.
title: Local patterns of genetic sharing challenge the boundaries between neuropsychiatric and insulin resistance-related conditions

finding: The rs10939663 variant was identified as a novel locus associated with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) levels in the Middle Eastern population. This finding stemmed from a multi-ancestry meta-analysis that incorporated data from the Qatar Biobank cohort. The corrected p-value for significance was 1.25×10^-8, indicating a strong association with LDL-C levels.
title: Identification of a Novel SLC2A9 Gene Association with LDL-C levels and Evaluation of Polygenic Scores in a Multi-Ancestry Genome Wide Association Study

finding: rs1229984 in the ADH1B gene was confirmed to be linked to slow alcohol metabolism, reinforcing its role in the pathway of alcohol consumption and highlighting its significance as a known locus related to drinking behavior.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: Identified as an interaction variant on chromosome 4q23, rs1813977 showed a significant association with drinking status, contributing to the understanding of the interactive effects on alcohol metabolism related to the rs671 variant.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: This SNP demonstrated a significant association with drinking status among heterozygotes, indicating its role in modulating alcohol consumption in conjunction with rs671.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: Having shown significant association in alcohol intake among heterozygotes, rs10005290 is part of the loci examined for interactions with the variant rs671, thus providing further evidence of genetic determinants of alcohol consumption.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: The SNP rs1229984, located in the ADH1B gene associated with alcohol metabolism, showed the strongest association with genetically predicted alcohol consumption and telomere length. It was reported that a 1 standard deviation increase in genetically predicted log-transformed alcohol drinks weekly correlated with a -0.07 standard deviation effect on telomere length (95% CI: -0.14 to -0.01). Excluding this SNP from the analyses rendered the MR estimate insignificant, indicating its crucial role in linking alcohol consumption to telomere length.
title: Alcohol consumption and telomere length: observational and Mendelian randomization approaches

finding: The SNP rs356182 at the SNCA locus was identified as the lead variant in European-ancestry meta-analyses. It was shown to significantly associate with Parkinson's disease (PD) risk in both the LARGE-PD cohort and a Hispanic/Latino cohort from 23andMe, establishing its relevance across populations. The study noted robust associations in LARGE-PD, with nominal p-values for haplotypes including hap6, hap9, and hap11 leading to conclusions on the causal nature of rs356182.
title: Polygenic risk prediction and SNCA haplotype analysis in a Latino Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: rs3775947 was the lead SNP at locus chr4:9,743,616-10,243,616, showing an extremely strong trait association with -log10(p-value) values exceeding 1000, suggesting that this locus may exhibit multiple independent associations.
title: Locus-specific stratification and prioritization unveil high risk genes underlying hyperuricemia

finding: At locus chr4:9,743,616-10,243,616, rs4447862, identified as a high-risk variant in addition to the lead SNP, demonstrated notable accessibility and a significant association with uric acid levels.
title: Locus-specific stratification and prioritization unveil high risk genes underlying hyperuricemia

finding: The SNP rs34811474 was found to be a missense SNP located in the exon of the gene ANAPC4. This SNP had a posterior inclusion probability greater than 0.95, making it a credible candidate for contributing to the genetic understanding of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) risk.
title: Discovery of 95 PTSD loci provides insight into genetic architecture and neurobiology of trauma and stress-related disorders

finding: The CFI variant rs10033900 was associated with progression to advanced AMD, particularly with the type 1 dysfunctional variants linked to low serum factor I levels.
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The rs356181 polymorphism was associated with cortical thinning in early Parkinson's disease, suggesting a modification effect on brain structure related to cognitive outcomes.
title: Machine learning-based prediction of cognitive outcomes in de novo Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs3910105 SNP was linked to dopamine transporter availability in healthy subjects, indicating its relevance in neurotransmitter regulation which could impact cognitive function.
title: Machine learning-based prediction of cognitive outcomes in de novo Parkinson’s disease

finding: The study identified rs58612183 located within an intron of the gene STX18 on chromosome 4 as being associated with HCV infection, demonstrating a genome-wide significant association (P=3.9×10−10) when comparing HCV cases to population-based UK Biobank controls. Although this SNP yielded a reduced odds ratio (OR=1.22) and was not significant in separate GWAS involving well-characterized controls, it was found to be associated with HCV clearance in exploratory analyses (P=8.55×10−4, OR=1.47) excluding individuals with hemophilia.
title: Pathogen exposure misclassification can bias association signals in GWAS of infectious diseases when using population-based common controls

finding: At the 4q34.3 locus, this SNP had a discovery p-value of 1.98×10^-6 and OR=2.07, located within a gene desert.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: This SNP at 4p16.2 had 6.91×10^-7 in the meta-analysis and is located 1.32 Mb from EVC.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The SNP rs145745951 in the gene MUC7 was reported as differentially expressed, with MUC7 being significantly downregulated in cleft lip and/or palate (CL/P) patients. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic causes of CL/P.
title: Mucin-7 as a Potential Candidate Risk Allele for Cleft Lip and/or Palate

finding: The rs35518360 gene variant upstream of SLC39A8 exhibited strong associations with the internal capsule microstructures, indirectly connecting it to dyslexia through its broader implications in mental health and educational outcomes.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The missense variant rs13107325 in SLC39A8 is in linkage disequilibrium with rs35518360 and suggests that it might affect microstructural properties relevant to dyslexia, highlighting the complexity of genetic influences on brain structure.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The SNP rs34811474, related to the gene ANAPC4, exhibited a shared causal variant probability of 1 with both obesity and physical activity, indicating a significant link with PTSD.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs72872727 in the GRID2 gene was associated with increased risk of IR, with the T allele showing a significant effect (OR = 11.14; 95% CI: 2.42-51.26; p < 0.0001), demonstrating dominant inheritance.
title: Unveiling Genetic Associations: Investigating CLDN16, GRID2, NRG3, and CACNG4 Gene Polymorphisms with Insulin Resistance Risk Among Normal BMI Individuals in the Indian Population

finding: The SNP rs10021975 was recognized as a novel finding linked to CBC setpoints, aiding in the interpretation of heritability in hematologic traits.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The variant rs113429955 was associated with UC, identified with a P-value of 5.51×10−6 and an odds ratio of 1.81. This was a novel finding that had not been previously described.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This variant was linked to BMI in the BBJ population despite low significance in others.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: SNP rs13107325 showed pronounced positive mean Z-scores, indicating a consistent positive effect across various cerebellar features, and it emerged in the univariate analysis of total cerebellar volume.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in human evolution and psychopathology

finding: Identified as a lead SNP in the EUR meta-analysis, this variant in ADH1B showed significant association with PAU, contributing to the overall understanding of the genetics underlying substance use disorders.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: This ADH1B missense variant was both consistently associated with AUD across multiple ancestries and identified as a lead SNP in the EUR meta-analysis, reinforcing its role in alcohol use behavior and related traits.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: This SNP in SLC39A8 was among the newly identified variants linked to PAU in the cross-ancestry meta-analysis, highlighting its potential involvement in the genetics of substance use.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: This ADH1B missense variant was noted in the AFR meta-analysis as part of significant findings pertaining to AUD.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: Part of the nominally significant variants in the EAS analysis, this SNP remained a focused candidate for further investigation in relation to PAU.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with preeclampsia in the offspring and linked to the placental gene S100P, which promotes trophoblast proliferation, crucial for normal pregnancy.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: SNP rs1874237 demonstrated genome-wide significance for diastolic blood pressure in mothers and was located near NKX6-1, which has implications in preeclampsia pathology.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: This SNP indicated a strong association with proteinuria in offspring and was found to be prevalent in Peruvian populations, suggesting a population-specific risk factor in preeclampsia.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The SNP <italic>ADH1B</italic> rs1229984 was analyzed in relation to alcohol metabolism rates and its influence on dementia risk. It was noted as a significant outlier in the study, highlighting its potential role in the causal relationship between alcohol consumption and dementia. This finding underscored the complexity of how genetic predisposition to alcohol use can influence dementia risk, particularly when factoring in behavioral patterns related to alcohol use.
title: Alcohol use and risk of dementia in diverse populations

finding: It overlapped an astrocytic enhancer near CD38, shedding light on genetic contributions to Parkinson's disease (PD).
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: This SNP was similarly positioned at an astrocytic enhancer near CD38, adding to the genetic landscape associated with Parkinson's disease.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs1543178 was associated with IGFBP7 protein levels in a multi-ancestry meta-analysis across Indian, Malay, and Chinese populations, with a significant p-value of 1.48 x 10^-6, suggesting its involvement in type 2 diabetes (T2D) pathology.
title: Circulating proteomic profiles are associated with the onset of type 2 diabetes in a multi-ethnic Asian population – a longitudinal study

finding: The variant rs3733402, located in <italic>KLKB1</italic>, was associated with a substantial number of metabolites and showed significant associations with various cardiovascular traits.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This variant was significantly associated with Low-density lipoprotein receptor class A domain-containing protein 4 (LDLRAD4) and high-sensitivity cardiac troponin I concentration.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The missense variant rs13107325 at the SLC39A8 locus was identified as a causal variant for schizophrenia (SCZ). Its function was linked to the regulation of dendritic spine density, highlighting its significance in the context of SCZ-related traits.
title: Genome-wide fine-mapping improves identification of causal variants

finding: The SNP rs13107535 was associated with the BTC gene and showed a main effect beta of -0.41. The interaction effect was dampened in inflamed skin, suggesting complex regulatory dynamics in psoriasis pathology.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The sQTL rs34712979:A>G was associated with increased risks for severe COVID-19 outcomes such as critical illness (OR 1.18) and hospitalization (OR 1.10), highlighting its role in exacerbating disease severity. This SNP was identified as influencing splicing at a region potentially regulating these outcomes.
title: Alternative splicing in the lung influences COVID-19 severity and respiratory diseases

finding: Found to be significantly associated with OUD (p=3.60×10^-10), this SNP maps to the SLC39A8 gene and adds to the understanding of genetic influences on OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs1479918 was analyzed for matching DAP with EAP leading to associations with 29 e-genes, indicating its involvement in the broader IBD risk locus landscape.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: Identified as a cis-eQTL for CXCL5, it was associated with inflammatory pathways and elevated expression in ulcerative colitis.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: Prioritized KLB as the mediator for FGF19, highlighting its involvement in fibroblast growth factor pathways.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: SNP rs118190473 at the ANXA3 locus was linked to HDL cholesterol levels, with a p-value of 4.49 × 10^-8 in KoGES and a p-value of 7.0 × 10^-6 in BBJ.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: The SNP rs2200733 demonstrated a novel association with an A-ECG parameter of atrial activity and was linked with an increased risk of ischemic stroke, as indicated by concurrent literature. Nonetheless, it did not align with left atrial dimensions. A patient with a higher AF GRS (4) exhibited a TIA, suggesting the SNP's relevance in stroke risk assessment.
title: Screening for Cardiac Disease with Genetic risk scoring, Advanced ECG, Echocardiography, Protein Biomarkers and Metabolomics

finding: The SNP rs10518336 was identified as an instrumental variant for PDE5A expression in blood. A 1-SD increase in PDE5A expression linked to this SNP was significantly associated with increased risks of coronary heart disease (CHD) and myocardial infarction (MI), showing OR of 1.22 (95% CI=1.06-1.40) for CHD and OR of 1.27 (95% CI=1.09-1.48) for MI.
title: Combination of QTL and GWAS to uncover the role of phosphodiesterases in ischemic heart disease

finding: The SNP rs761018157 was identified as a novel variant associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) and is found in the PHOX2B gene, which is highly expressed in the nervous system. This gene had previously been linked to obesity hypoventilation syndrome in a small study and was also associated with bone mineral density.
title: Population-Specific Polygenic Risk Scores Developed for the Han Chinese

finding: The rs356182 variant at the SNCA locus was among the top PAR signals identified for Parkinson's disease (PD) in European, African/Admixed, and Latino populations.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: This SNP was novel to the analyses and demonstrated potential functional impact due to its deleteriousness, with a CADD score of 23.7, suggesting it may play an important role in the genetics of mood disorders.
title: Genetic overlap between mood instability and alcohol-related phenotypes suggests shared biological underpinnings

finding: The rs34712979 variant was identified as a functional variant influencing lung function and COPD risk by altering splicing in nephronectin (NPNT). Specifically, the A allele of rs34712979 created an alternative splice acceptor site, resulting in the inclusion of a 3-nucleotide exon extension and coding for a serine residue. This variant demonstrated a high posterior probability (94-100%) of being the causal variant for associations with COPD and lung function, confirming its role in modulating disease risk.
title: Characterization of a COPD-Associated NPNT Functional Splicing Genetic Variant in Human Lung Tissue via Long-Read Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs34811474 was noted as potentially deleterious and related to pain intensity, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in chronic pain.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The SNP rs71597204 was identified as having moderate linkage disequilibrium with credible pain gene loci, emphasizing its significance in pain intensity research.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The rs13122994 SNP was associated with functional homologous recombination deficiency (HRD) testing and was able to predict clinical outcomes for HGSC patients treated with platinum-based chemotherapy and PARP inhibitors. This context was established through research that calibrated the RAD51-FFPE test, which emphasized the importance of detecting RAD51 levels.
title: Functional homologous recombination assay on FFPE specimens of advanced high-grade serous ovarian cancer predicts clinical outcomes

finding: The rs233806/BANK1 variant was linked to blood pressure, HDL-C, and BMI, underscoring its relevance as a heart failure risk factor.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify drug targets for heart failure

finding: This SNP was associated with the DMT1 gene, which is highly expressed in the gut and related to microcytic anemia with iron overload. It was significant in this GWAS with a p-value of 3.66×10⁻⁴¹ and previously linked to Parkinson's disease (PD).
title: Hemochromatosis Neural Archetype Reveals Iron Disruption in Motor Circuits

finding: The SNP rs10009409, linked to the COX18 gene, was found to significantly mediate response to NADT in conjunction with CMB 216, highlighting its role in the treatment efficacy for prostate cancer patients (total effect p < 0.05; average causal mediation effects p < 0.05). Its independent prognostic value was affirmed in the analysis of the TCGA-PRAD cohort.
title: AI-Powered cellular morphometric biomarkers discovered in needle biopsy of prostatic cancer predict neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy response and prognosis: an international multicenter retrospective study

finding: The top variant at the locus corresponding to rs13123494 exhibited a pattern of interactions that significantly impacted the relationship between fish oil supplementation and the risk of all-cause dementia and vascular dementia, demonstrating stronger effect sizes compared to APOE ε4.
title: Gene-diet interaction analysis in UK Biobank identified genetic loci that modify the association between fish oil supplementation and the incidence of dementia

finding: The SNP rs2282679 was validated for its association with vitamin D levels. Findings from PRISM indicated three direct effects from this SNP, aligning with previous studies that involved gene GC and its role in white blood cells and neutrophil accumulation, establishing its relevance in immune function.
title: Inferring genetic variant causal network by leveraging pleiotropy

finding: rs2298850 was also connected to gene GC and validated for its role in vitamin D levels, similar to rs2282679. This SNP was found to have three direct effects in the context highlighted by PRISM, supporting the understanding of its physiological importance related to vitamin D and immune response.
title: Inferring genetic variant causal network by leveraging pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs7678559, associated with PCDH7, was identified as a novel variant related to sVEGFR2 levels. The findings suggested that elevated levels of sVEGFR2, as predicted by this SNP, were associated with decreased risk for MP, reflected in an OR of 0.86.
title: Genetic Evidence for Soluble VEGFR2 as a Protective Factor Against Macular Pucker
