This finding suggested a link between this genetic variation and higher alcohol consumption rates, which might have implications for understanding comorbidities in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: Genes associated with liver damage signalling pathways may impact the severity of COVID-19 symptoms in Spanish and Italian populations

finding: The SNP rs3857224 in the ADH6 gene was similarly associated with heavy drinking among individuals in the Spanish population. This finding underscored the potential impact of this genetic variant on alcohol use patterns, particularly in the context of COVID-19 mortality.
title: Genes associated with liver damage signalling pathways may impact the severity of COVID-19 symptoms in Spanish and Italian populations

finding: The SNP rs2066782, located in exon 18 on chromosome 4, enabled the analysis of the (AAGGG)exp RFC1 allele expression in cerebellum RNA-seq data. This analysis confirmed that the short tandem repeat (STR) did not inhibit the expression of RFC1 when compared to the reference (AAAAG)11 allele. This finding outlined the role of rs2066782 in assessing allele-specific expression related to the pathogenic repeat expansion identified in individuals with CANVAS.
title: Validation of new bioinformatic tools to identify expanded repeats: a non-reference intronic pentamer expansion in RFC1 causes CANVAS

finding: The SNP rs870142 was associated with atrial septal defects and located within an active D2 mesodermal enhancer in the intron of STX18-AS1. This enhancer formed long-range interactions (~200 kb) with the promoter of MSX1, a known transcription factor in heart development, demonstrating its involvement in congenital heart disease.
title: 3D Chromatin Architecture Remodeling during Human Cardiomyocyte Differentiation Reveals A Novel Role Of HERV-H In Demarcating Chromatin Domains

finding: The SNP rs13107325, a missense variant in SLC39A8 causing a threonine to alanine substitution at position 391 (A391T), was associated with schizophrenia and over 30 additional phenotypes, including reductions in serum manganese (Mn), diastolic blood pressure, and variations in brain MRI signals. Specifically, minor allele carriers demonstrated increased T2w/T1w ratio in certain brain regions, indicative of Mn-related changes, which aligned with the documented impacts on neurodevelopmental functions and cognitive outcomes.
title: The schizophrenia risk locus in SLC39A8 alters brain metal transport and plasma glycosylation

finding: The study referenced indicated that SNP 'rs10030069' was associated with the effectiveness of nano-pulse stimulation in ablation therapies for hepatocellular carcinoma. Specifically, the research demonstrated how such treatments could not only ablate tumors but also promote immune mechanisms that might prevent recurrence, highlighting the importance of genetic factors in shaping therapeutic outcomes.
title: Nanosecond pulsed electric field ablates rabbit VX2 liver tumors in a non-thermal manner versus radiofrequency ablation

finding: The SNP rs13107325 showed the strongest signal related to cortical thickness (CT) associated with SCZ, demonstrating a significant genetic association with an HMP of 9.91×10<sup>-13</sup>.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked with lower SA in ADHD, rs223498 contributes to the complexity of genetic factors affecting brain morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with lower SA of the superior parietal cortex in anxiety, further establishing genetic influences on brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with greater CT in PTSD, this SNP further exemplifies genetic relationships with brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP had a p-value of 7.60×10−11 and influenced the expression of SNCA, which codes for the protein alpha-synuclein. The GG genotype was associated with increased SNCA expression in the cortex. This SNP disrupted three binding motifs for CTCF, which may lead to unregulated expression of SNCA.
title: Parkinson’s Disease Genetic Risk Evaluation in Microglia Highlights Autophagy and Lysosomal Genes

finding: The SNP rs13122878 was associated with resistance to doxorubicin treatment in soft tissue sarcomas (STS). This finding related to the statistical analysis of cancer stem cell (CSC) abundance linked with doxorubicin IC<sub>50</sub> values in resistant cell lines. The study indicated potential for targeting shared genetic signatures, including this SNP, to improve chemosensitivity in STS-CSCs.
title: Genetic and Epigenetic Characterization of Sarcoma Stem Cells Across Subtypes Identifies EZH2 as a Therapeutic Target

finding: This SNP was part of a cluster associated with mandible volume differing by PAE, with the best genotype by PAE interaction showing a p-value of 0.016. It was linked to increased expression of BMPR1B in tissues like the adrenal gland, indicating its relevant role in jaw size variations in FASD.
title: Mutation in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and human to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: SNP rs13136503 was found to be associated with type-2 diabetes, confirming previous reports in the literature.
title: Benchmarking machine learning models for the analysis of genetic data using FRESA.CAD Binary Classification Benchmarking

finding: The SNP rs13133164 was associated with gene expression and was highlighted in the context of cancer research, specifically relating to the receptor tyrosine kinases (RTKs) and the Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR). It provided insight into oncogenic mechanisms in lung cancer under the influence of EGFR mutations, as referenced in the relevant article from Khaddour et al. (2021). The study emphasized the role of precision medicine in targeting RTKs in cancer therapy.
title: Met-HER3 crosstalk supports proliferation via MPZL3 in MET-amplified cancer cells

finding: The finding related to 'rs13112610' indicated that it was associated with increased expression of CXCL2, which served as a Notch/RBPJ target gene influencing the education of tumour-associated macrophages (TAMs) in epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC). The positive correlation highlighted how variations in this SNP could impact the immunosuppressive tumour microenvironment through its regulatory role on TAMs and CD44 expression.
title: Endothelial Rbpj is essential for the education of tumour-associated macrophages

finding: The SNP rs6446395 showed a genome-wide significant association with reading fluency (<p=7.55×10^-10) and was also associated with word reading accuracy, phonological awareness, and rapid automatized naming. This SNP influenced the expression of the EVC gene in the cerebellum.
title: A genome wide association study identifies a new variant associated with word reading fluency in Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs897945 showed a G to T nucleotide substitution resulting in a Leucine to Phenylalanine amino acid change at position 299 in the THAP9 gene. This SNP had a global minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.3253 and was identified to potentially play a significant role in Atopy and Allergic Rhinitis specifically within the Singapore Chinese population. The functional implications of this change were linked to the development of these allergic conditions.
title: Evolutionarily conserved regions of THAP9 transposase reveal new motifs for subcellular localization and post-translational modification

finding: The SNP rs12651181 was identified in association with a triplication of the entire SNCA gene in Subject 3. This finding was a part of a broader investigation into genetic variations linked to Parkinson's disease, suggesting that variations near SNCA might influence the risk factors for this condition.
title: Integrated Sequencing & Array Comparative Genomic Hybridization in Familial Parkinson’s Disease

finding: This SNP showed a z-score of 6.59 in association with the left middle frontal cortex, suggesting its significant role in regional connectivity.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This SNP, which affected DCLK2 expression and had a z-score of 6.28, is important for axon growth and neural migration.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This missense variant in SLC39A8 showed a high z-score of 5.77 in regional connectivity and a remarkable 8.74 in tract-wise connectivity analysis.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This SNP had a z-score of 5.66 and was associated with an uncharacterized region near RP11-180C1.1.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: Located near the LINC02502 gene, this SNP was associated with the same seven binary coronary heart disease traits, highlighting its important role in cardiovascular-related phenotypes.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: Associated with LDL, providing evidence of its involvement in both coronary artery disease and lipid phenotypes.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: This variant showed weak associations but was significantly related to acute myocardial infarction, myocardial infarction, and heart attack, suggesting it may still play a role in cardiovascular traits.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs13122990 was identified in a study examining associations between genetic factors in Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, and cancer. The findings suggested its relevance in understanding genetic interactions in the context of these diseases.
title: Multi-omics Topic Modeling for Breast Cancer Classification

finding: The study found that SNP rs356168 was associated with H3K27 acetylation status in an enhancer element of the PD-implicated gene SNCA. This SNP's variation was linked to the risk of Parkinson disease, highlighting its potential role as a genetic factor influencing the disease's pathophysiology. The significance of this finding related to the dysregulation of histone acetylation and its connection to transcriptional activity in the context of PD.
title: Genome-wide dysregulation of histone acetylation in the Parkinson’s disease brain

finding: The SNP rs13112600 was associated with the nuclear receptor Nr2f6, which was found to play a crucial role in the regulation of skeletal muscle contractility and oxidative capacity. The study highlighted that modulation of Nr2f6 impacted gene expression linked to muscle differentiation, metabolism, and contraction, suggesting a potential link between this SNP and muscle-related phenotypes.
title: Concerted regulation of skeletal muscle metabolism and contractile properties by the orphan nuclear receptor Nr2f6

finding: This SNP was reported as a genome-wide significant signal of selection in the UK, contributing to the understanding of population genetics.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: This SNP emerged with strong statistical significance and represented a novel signal of selection in the broader population study.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: It was identified as an eQTL for the GLRA3 gene in breast mammary tissue, which is relevant for breast cancer, thus supporting its role in the disease.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: The study found that rs41407844 showed a very high Fst in Europeans compared to other ethnic groups, indicating significant population differentiation. Specifically, the derived allele had a high frequency of approximately 0.85 in Europeans, around 0.38 in East Asians, and only about 0.17 in African populations. This finding correlated with variations in anthrax toxin sensitivity in lymphoblastoid cell lines, suggesting that Europeans may have undergone adaptive changes in response to anthrax exposure, which was consistent with a model of recent positive selection at the ANTXR2 locus.
title: Multiple stages of evolutionary change in anthrax toxin receptor expression in humans

finding: The SNP rs13112600 was associated with the orphan nuclear receptor Nr2f6. The study highlighted that overexpression of Nr2f6 resulted in decreased muscle mass and impaired force production, while depletion of Nr2f6 enhanced oxidative capacity in myocytes and protected against cell death. This indicates that rs13112600 may play a critical role in regulating muscle plasticity and oxidative metabolism, linking it to skeletal muscle conditions and responses to environmental changes.
title: The nuclear receptor Nr2f6 represses skeletal muscle oxidative metabolism and force production

finding: SNP rs4696709 regulated the expression of DER10633, a probable novel exon of ABLIM2, indicating it was a new regulatory variant with no significant co-regulation of other exons.
title: Regulatory sites for known and novel splicing in human basal ganglia are enriched for disease-relevant information

finding: The rs7682260 (Leu20Ser) was involved in inferring the M and N blood antigens, contributing to a concordance of 94%.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: This SNP was used in the inference of the M antigen within the MNS blood group.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs7658293 (Glu24Gly) was involved in the phenotyping of the M antigen in conjunction with other SNVs.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs7683365 (Thr48Met) contributed to inferring the S and s antigens with a concordance of 97%.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The presence of the rs139511876 variant indicated a GYPB gene deletion associated with the S-s- phenotype.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The SNP rs1348224, specifically the G allele (minor allele), was found to have a negative effect on Phenotypic Axis 1, indicating a protective effect against cognitive impairment. This finding was consistent with previous reports of rs1348224 being protective in Parkinson's disease cases that include dementia and dementia with Lewy bodies, suggesting that it plays a role in the cognitive aspects associated with Parkinson's disease.
title: Universal continuous severity traits underlying hundreds of Parkinson’s disease clinical features

finding: The SNP rs113473633 was connected to the gene NFKB1, a major transcription factor in immune responses, with a PIP of 0.99. This SNP was significant for both white blood cell count and eosinophil count traits, highlighting its role in blood cell traits and autoimmune conditions.
title: SNP-to-gene linking strategies reveal contributions of enhancer-related and candidate master-regulator genes to autoimmune disease

finding: This cQTL variant was noted for disrupting the canonical binding motif for SPI1 and improving the motif match for IRF8, marking it as a trimodal QTL related to IGFBP7.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: Associated with BST1 expression and Parkinson's disease in GWAS, highlighting its significance in immune response and inflammatory pathways.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: This SNP, also linked to BST1 and associated with Parkinson's disease in GWAS, showcased its importance in the context of myeloid inflammation.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs13107325 on chromosome 4 was the second most significant lead SNP linked to regional brain morphology, with a p-value of 3.1 x 10^-124. Similar to rs1080066, it demonstrated extensive impacts on both regional surface area and cortical thickness.
title: Making the MOSTest of imaging genetics

finding: The SNP rs13143606 was associated with functional roles of bromodomain proteins in cancer, as detailed in the study by Boyson et al. in 2021. This association highlighted the involvement of bromodomain proteins in regulating gene expression, which is critical in cancer biology, potentially linking genetic variations to cancer susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide Analysis of Bromodomain Gene Family in Arabidopsis and Rice

finding: The study reported that carriers of the CAD risk variant rs7692387, associated with the gene GUCY1A1, displayed reduced levels of the soluble guanylyl cyclase alpha-1 protein in platelets. This reduction was linked to impaired inhibitory effects of nitric oxide on platelet aggregation. It was also noted that in a retrospective analysis, aspirin effectively reduced cardiovascular events in homozygous carriers of this risk allele as compared to others, indicating a significant interaction between this SNP and platelet function in the context of coronary artery disease.
title: Loss of soluble guanylyl cyclase in platelets contributes to atherosclerotic plaque formation and vascular inflammation

finding: This variant colocalized with CPLX1 expression and was linked to increased T2D risk due to the minor T allele. While associated with PCGF3 expression in other tissues, it specifically correlated with CPLX1 in human islets.
title: TIGER: The gene expression regulatory variation landscape of human pancreatic islets

finding: Discovered on Chromosome 15, this SNP was significantly associated with stomatal index (SI) at Godet, demonstrating the presence of beneficial alleles related to stress response traits.
title: Identification and analysis of genomic regions influencing leaf morpho-physiological traits related to stress responses in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP rs13138213, found within the PCDH7 gene, was associated with educational traits and showed a strong connection in gene-based analysis with a P-value of 1.44E-06.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: The SNP rs13122925 was associated with the overall survival of liver cancer patients, indicating its significance as a potential biomarker in the context of cancer prognosis. This finding emphasized the potential role of TIPRL in modulating pathways relevant to cancer progression and treatment response.
title: TIPRL1 and its ATM-dependent phosphorylation promote radiotherapy resistance in head and neck cancer

finding: Located near the VEGFA promoter within a strong fibroblast peak, this variant was highly co-accessible and linked to CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The SNP rs13133230 was associated with metabolic dysfunction in the tumor microenvironment (TME), which was linked to altered T cell responses and immunotherapy efficacy. This finding underscored the relevance of IRE1 signaling pathways and their role in the adaptive immune response, indicating that certain genetic variations could influence antitumor immunity outcomes.
title: Adaptive IRE1 Signaling Elicits T Cell Metabolic Remodeling and Tumor Control

finding: The SNP rs13143615 was associated with chemotherapy-induced myopathy, specifically in the context of cancer cachexia as discussed in the study by Campelj et al. (2021). This finding indicated the role of genetic variations in contributing to muscle wasting during chemotherapy treatment.
title: Haptoglobin and glutamine synthetase may biomark cachexia induced by anti-acute myeloid leukemia chemotherapy

finding: The variant rs10001928 was identified as a genome-wide significant pQTL for MUC5B, noted for its association with MUC5B concentrations.
title: Genetic Regulators of Sputum Mucin Concentration and Their Associations with COPD Phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs1873197 in the FAM114A1 gene was found to be associated with myocardial infarction (MI) and coronary artery disease (CAD) in three human genome-wide association studies. Its significance was highlighted by a strong genetic association with MI confirmed via a large-scale analysis involving 639,000 human MI subjects, where it displayed an effect allele frequency of approximately 6.77% and a p-value of 8.48e-05. This positioned FAM114A1 as a crucial candidate in the context of cardiac pathogenesis.
title: FAM114A1 Influences Cardiac Fibrosis by Regulating Angiotensin II Signaling in Cardiac Fibroblasts

finding: Allelic dosage of G at SNP rs3733336 was associated with increased FGF5 expression in glomeruli, demonstrating a correlation between the eQTL and GWAS effect sizes for both blood pressure and eGFR phenotypes.
title: Mapping the genetic architecture of human traits to cell types in the kidney identifies mechanisms of disease and potential treatments

finding: This SNP in CASP3 was one of the three specified high severity SNPs for Parkinson disease, indicating a significant role in the disease's pathology.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: In the study published in Cancers 2018 by Uppal et al., rs10030085 was implicated in the role of pattern recognition receptors during KSHV (Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus) infection. This SNP was identified as being significant in understanding the molecular mechanisms of KSHV pathogenesis and its association with oncogenic processes, thereby contributing to our knowledge of how viral infections impact genome regulation and potential disease states.
title: The conserved herpesviral kinase ORF36 activates B2 retrotransposons during murine gammaherpesvirus infection

finding: The ADH1B rs1229984 T/C variant was significantly associated with alcohol metabolism and exhibited strong signals of positive natural selection, with a p-value of 6.8 × 10^-10. The frequency of the derived allele increased around 20,000 years ago, indicating shifts related to dietary habits in the Japanese population.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: This SNP was linked to insights into the genomic characteristics of poorly differentiated and anaplastic thyroid cancers. The study provided evidence of the significance of genomic alterations in influencing the tumorigenic properties of ATC, emphasizing how TRβ could potentially counteract these aggressive behaviors.
title: TRβ Agonism Induces Tumor Suppression and Enhances Drug Efficacy in Anaplastic Thyroid Cancer in Female Mice

finding: The SNP rs13112666 was linked to aberrant MLH1 protein localization in estrogen receptor positive breast cancer patients. This dysregulation was associated with resistance to standard endocrine therapies, establishing rs13112666 as a potential predictive biomarker for treatment outcomes.
title: Aberrant subcellular localization of mismatch repair protein MLH1 dysregulates the cell cycle to create new therapeutic opportunities

finding: For SNP rs362273, the research identified an siRNA that exhibited greater than 50-fold discrimination for allele-specific silencing of the mutant huntingtin (HTT) protein in HD patients' neurons differentiated from induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs). Initial assessments showed that this siRNA maintained selective silencing across various brain regions in a transgenic mouse model of Huntington's disease (BACHD), demonstrating successful allele-specific RNA interference (RNAi) targeting.
title: Chemical engineering of therapeutic siRNAs for allele-specific gene silencing in vivo in CNS

finding: The variant rs555778703, with a MAF of 0.009, was significantly associated with prostate cancer in the population studied, highlighting its role as a rare risk variant for the disease.
title: Association Study of Over 200,000 Subjects Detects Novel Rare Variants, Functional Elements, and Polygenic Architecture of Prostate Cancer Susceptibility

finding: The PPM1K rs1440581 variant was linked to serum branched-chain amino acid levels and risk of cardiovascular disease, highlighting its metabolic implications.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The PPM1K rs7678928 SNP also showed significant association with serum branched-chain amino acid levels and cardiovascular disease, suggesting its relevance in metabolic processes.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The TLR3 rs3775291 functional variant was associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and mortality, pointing to its potential role in immune response to the virus.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: Linked to Type 1 Diabetes (T1D), Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD), Psoriasis (PSO), Celiac Disease (CEL), and allergy, rs72669153 is located at -51 kb upstream of the IL2 gene. In activated T cells, this region's chromatin was remodeled to become highly accessible.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: Located at -128 kb upstream of the IL2 gene, rs1512973 was linked to T1D, Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA), and Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE). Its deletion in experimental settings reduced IL-2 production significantly.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: Also located at -128 kb upstream of IL2 and associated with T1D, JIA, and SLE, deletion of this SNP's regulatory element similarly decreased IL-2 production upon T cell activation.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: The SNP rs4397000 was identified as having a significant interaction with prenatal alcohol exposure regarding mandible volume (p=0.016). It was shown that this SNP might increase BMPR1B expression in certain tissues while affecting jaw size under ethanol influence.
title: Mutation in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and human to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: For rs10938397, the gene GNPDA2 and GABRG1 were both noted as having 'positive hits' in the context of this SNP.
title: A multi-component screen for feeding behaviour and nutritional status in Drosophila to interrogate mammalian appetite-related genes

finding: The rs363099 SNP in exon 28 of the HTT gene was targeted using two guides, GSp340 and GSp341. GSp340 demonstrated near complete selectivity with less than 1% editing at the normal allele while editing the mutant allele at approximately 80%, indicating it could effectively generate allele specific editing outcomes. This showed the precision of AiEvo2 in editing alleles associated with Huntington's disease.
title: Discovery and engineering of AiEvo2, a novel Cas12a nuclease for human gene editing applications

finding: The levels of the liver secreted vitamin-D-binding protein (GC) were strongly determined by the genetic variant rs222047, which was linked to isoform-specific affinity, revealing its crucial role in the regulation of this circulating protein.
title: Facets of individual-specific health signatures determined from longitudinal plasma proteome profiling

finding: Similar to rs222047, the SNP rs843005 influenced the levels of the vitamin-D-binding protein (GC), contributing to significant findings regarding the genetic regulation of protein quantity in serum.
title: Facets of individual-specific health signatures determined from longitudinal plasma proteome profiling

finding: The SNP rs7041 was previously identified as a cis-pQTL of GC, and it was found to be significantly linked to the circulating levels of this protein in the current study as well, confirming its role in protein abundance regulation.
title: Facets of individual-specific health signatures determined from longitudinal plasma proteome profiling

finding: Demonstrated phenome-wide significance in association with type 2 diabetes, reinforcing its role in metabolic traits.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Associated with several autoimmune conditions via strong LD with GWAS peaks and showed functional implications through altered TF binding.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: In the intersect analysis, rs10029218 was identified as an associated variant with small vessel stroke (SVS). This finding was replicated in the trans-ancestry analysis of MEGASTROKE, indicating its significance in the genetic risk for this subtype of ischemic stroke.
title: Alternate approach to stroke phenotyping identifies a genetic risk locus for small vessel stroke

finding: The SNP rs7657404 was part of a haplotype block associated with the gene expression of USP46-AS1. The analysis found a highly significant association with a q-value of < 0.017, indicating that individuals carrying the CTG haplotype had substantially higher gene expression for this gene. This SNP, along with others in the block, was previously reported as significant eQTLs for other genes, but this was the first association with USP46-AS1 in whole blood.
title: A novel haplotype-based eQTL approach identifies genetic associations not detected through conventional SNP-based methods

finding: The SNP rs7698053 was included in a haplotype block that demonstrated strong association with USP46-AS1 gene expression, with a significant haplotype analysis q-value of < 0.017. This finding indicated the influence of the haplotype representation over traditional single SNP analysis, marking a notable discovery of the involvement of this SNP in the regulation of gene expression.
title: A novel haplotype-based eQTL approach identifies genetic associations not detected through conventional SNP-based methods

finding: The SNP rs7688816 was part of a haplotype analysis that showed significant association with the expression of USP46-AS1, with a q-value < 0.017. Like the other SNPs in the block, its inclusion validated the effectiveness of haplotype-based methods in uncovering associations that single SNP approaches missed, thereby highlighting the importance of this SNP in the context of gene expression regulation.
title: A novel haplotype-based eQTL approach identifies genetic associations not detected through conventional SNP-based methods

finding: The SNP rs6824295 was associated with reduced expression of the long noncoding RNA STX18-AS1. This lncRNA was linked to the coding gene EVC, yet no overlap with NDD related GWAS SNPs or CNVs for EVC was found. Additionally, rs6824295 was implicated in heart disease.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: SNP rs16835979 was identified in connection with STX18-AS1, which is associated with the coding gene EVC through an eQTL polymorphism. The clinical significance of this SNP was deemed unknown, but it was part of a study that demonstrated its relevance to neurodevelopment.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The SNP rs2887447 was identified to be associated with the noncoding RNA CTC-467M3. This lncRNA is critical for neurodevelopment, and while there wasn't strong evidence linking it directly to NDDs or schizophrenia, it plays a role in memory and learning.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The SNP rs13130037 was found overlapping with the lncRNA CTC-467M3, known to be related to neurodevelopment. This SNP additionally was part of the study's identification of NDD-related GWAS SNPs.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: For SNP rs7675915, it was indicated to overlap with STX18-AS1 and was identified as a schizophrenia-related GWAS SNP. Furthermore, STX18-AS1 exhibited significant duplications in individuals diagnosed with schizophrenia, suggesting its relevance to mental health disorders.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The SNP rs10030081 was characterized as having significant implications in the regulation of the Hippo pathway. Studies linked this SNP to alterations in the TEAD transcription factors' function, which plays a crucial role in mediating pro-growth and anti-proliferative responses in cancer. Variants at this locus were shown to influence the TEAD family's interaction with YAP and TAZ, critical for understanding the deregulation of Hippo pathway in oncogenesis.
title: TEAD-targeting small molecules induce a cofactor switch to regulate the Hippo pathway

finding: At the 4q26 EOC locus, rs7671665 was found in intron 2 of the SYNPO2 gene and was predicted to break 31 TF motifs. This SNP was identified as an eQTL, influencing expression of SYNPO2 and METTL14, a component of the m6A methyltransferase complex involved in RNA modification processes relevant to cancer biology.
title: Ovarian Cancer Risk Variants are Enriched in Histotype-Specific Enhancers that Disrupt Transcription Factor Binding Sites

finding: The SNP rs35852935, located near LAP3, was identified as a regulator of BMI in population-based genetic analyses, highlighting its potential connection to adiposity.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: Variations at the TLR1-6-10 region, including rs189688666, exhibited differing effects on TLR1 expression in various stimulated cells.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The SNP rs112318878 in the TLR1-6-10 region had opposing effects on TLR1 expression in IAV-stimulated monocytes and resting CD4+ T cells.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The SNP rs12500612 located at chr4:24,740,958 was found to be associated with Major depressive disorder in Europeans.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs1395221, at chr4:24,626,903, was associated with Apolipoprotein A1 and HDL cholesterol levels in Europeans, showing different allele frequencies in Native American and European populations.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs10030059 was identified in the context of post-translational modifications of H2A histone variants, with implications for cancer, particularly in individuals with Differences of Sex Development (DSD). This variant was linked to DNA damage phenotypes associated with aneuploidy of sex chromosomes and the development of Germ Cell Tumors (GCT). The presence of this SNP could correlate with the cellular responses to DNA damage and the resultant increased cancer susceptibility in affected individuals.
title: Genomic instability in patients with sex determination defects and germ cell cancer

finding: In the context of standing height, rs13108218 was identified as having the highest marginal posterior probability (MPP) of being a causal variant, with a value of 0.899, based on multi-trait fine-mapping using the tool flashfm. For forced vital capacity (FVC), this SNP also had a very high MPP of 0.999, indicating strong evidence for its role in influencing both traits, particularly with the substantial support provided by flashfm over previous analyses done with JAM.
title: flashfmZoom: a tool for joint fine-mapping and exploration of GWAS results in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs59950280 was presented as the lead SNP under single-trait fine-mapping for standing height, with an MPP of 0.991. It highlighted a correlation with rs13108218 (r^2=0.47). For FVC, JAM favored rs59950280 as the lead SNP, although flashfm showed greater support for rs13108218. The analysis revealed that rs59950280 is associated with significant traits as indicated in the PheWAS results, which reported a -log10(p-value) of association with various traits.
title: flashfmZoom: a tool for joint fine-mapping and exploration of GWAS results in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4859594 was associated with lower ART3 expression and linked to neurofibromatosis. It co-localized with two regulatory SNPs that were predicted to disrupt TF coordination networks by decreasing activator binding to ART3's regulatory elements.
title: NetREm Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: SNP rs6856681, found in the intronic enhancer region, was correlated with lower ART3 expression and linked to regulatory functions influencing the coordination networks affecting ART3.
title: NetREm Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs34740469, located promoter proximally, was linked with autoimmune pathways that may affect regulatory interactions, leading to lower expression of the ART3 gene.
title: NetREm Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs2231142 in the ABCG2 gene was identified in a GWAS conducted on Taiwanese patients as exhibiting the strongest linkage to gout. This finding provided important insights into the genetic factors underlying the disease, especially considering that ABCG2 knockdown in endothelial cells was shown to increase the secretion of the neutrophil chemoattractant IL-8, potentially linking this SNP to mechanisms of joint inflammation in gout patients.
title: NLRP3- and AIM2-autonomy in a mouse model of MSU crystal-induced acute inflammation in vivo highlights imiquimod-dependent targeting of Il-1β expression as relevant therapy for gout patients

finding: The SNP rs13112141 was identified in a study exploring the use of temporal vegetation indices and plant height from UAV imagery to predict grain yield and flowering time breeding value in maize. The findings highlighted a positive correlation with these traits, emphasizing the potential of integrating genetic markers and remote sensing for improving agricultural outcomes.
title: Plant height defined growth curves during vegetative development have the potential to predict end of season maize yield and assist with mid-season management decisions

finding: rs9685931 in GPR78 was found to be associated with standing height (p=1.1×10⁻⁶, β=-0.012, 95% CI: -0.0077 - -0.017), providing insights into growth traits.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: The variant rs3775887 was associated with FVC (p found in prior studies) but detailed statistics for this association were not provided here.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: rs13141656 was found in a block of SNPs that showed significant association with gestational duration after applying functional annotations. It was located within an enhancer region, suggestive of involvement in the regulation of HAND2, a candidate gene critical for progesterone responsiveness.
title: Transcriptome and regulatory maps of decidua-derived stromal cells inform gene discovery in preterm birth

finding: Like rs13141656, rs7663453 was adjacent and did not reach genome-wide significance independently but contributed to the strong PIP signal within the enhancer region that interacts with the HAND2 promoter.
title: Transcriptome and regulatory maps of decidua-derived stromal cells inform gene discovery in preterm birth

finding: The SNP rs2305181 in the FGFR3 gene was predicted to significantly decrease the knockout efficacy from 83.8% to 62.5% when targeting the minor allele, which has a minor allele frequency of 29.7% in African populations and 0.7% in European populations. This highlighted the potential for health disparities due to population stratification in clinical settings.
title: Widespread impact of natural genetic variations in CRISPR/Cas9 outcomes

finding: The SNP rs13122901 was found to be associated with successful patient-derived organoid culture of gynecologic cancers, as detailed in the study by Bi et al. (2021). This finding related to disease modeling and drug sensitivity testing, indicating that this particular SNP may play a role in the effectiveness of organoid cultures for research purposes.
title: Multiplexed live-cell imaging for drug responses in patient-derived organoid models of cancer

finding: The study highlighted that the mineralocorticoid receptor ISO/VAL genotype (rs5522) modulated the effects of stress on reward learning. Specifically, individuals with certain variants of this SNP showed impaired learning from positive outcomes under stress, aligning with findings that stress may disrupt dopamine pathways involved in reward processing. This provided insights into how genetic factors might influence the cognitive and behavioral impacts of acute stress on reward learning.
title: Acute stress impairs reward learning in men

finding: Analysis of SNP rs77214450 in the gene PALLD also revealed a greater presence of the ancestral allele in the North West Indian and South West coastal populations compared to the Gangetic plain, reflecting historical genetic influences from earlier migrations.
title: Genetic affinities and adaptation of the South West coast populations of India

finding: rs28413051 on 4q31.23 impacted neural migration and axon growth, with a z-score of 6.28.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: Located on 4q24, allele C of rs13107325 displayed significant associations in both node-level and edge-level connectivity analyses, being linked to schizophrenia and behavioral problems.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The SNP rs10020043 was linked to elevated polyamines in the saliva of patients, which indicated a correlation with disease severity in the context of pancreatic cancer. The findings from this study suggested that similar metabolomic patterns may be observed in other conditions, providing a basis for this SNP's relevance in understanding metabolic changes associated with severe disease states, including those seen in COVID-19.
title: Composition of saliva metabolome is significantly associated with SARS-CoV2 infection and with severity of COVID-19 disease

finding: The SNP rs34063820 in BMPR1B had the best p-value (p=4x10^-4) for genotype x PAE interaction, indicating a potential association with mandible volume in relation to ethanol exposure.
title: Mutations in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and humans to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: SNP rs4397000 had a significant association with mandible volume (p=0.016) and was linked to BMPR1B gene expression changes in different tissues, particularly with increased expression in adrenal gland and decreased expression in brain, heart, and pancreas.
title: Mutations in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and humans to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: On chromosome 4p16.3, near TMEM129, the minor T allele at rs56337234 was associated with decreased risk of type 2 diabetes (OR=0.94, p=1.4×10^-17) and increased risk of type 1 diabetes (OR=1.12, p=4.07×10^-6). This signal showed a colocalisation posterior probability of 0.97, demonstrating a shared locus with opposing effects.
title: Divergent genetic effects for type 1 and type 2 diabetes at overlapping association signals

finding: The SNP rs13102468 was highlighted in the context of current treatment options for Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL). It was shown to potentially impact treatment outcomes, emphasizing the need for personalized therapy approaches that consider such genetic variations among patients.
title: A Systems Biology Analysis of Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs13143394 was associated with the genomic response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy in oesophageal adenocarcinoma (OAC). Its original finding indicated that certain genetic variations at this locus affected treatment efficacy, thereby influencing patient outcomes. Additionally, the analysis revealed that the presence of this SNP could serve as a predictive marker for response to therapy, which is crucial for personalized medicine approaches in the management of OAC.
title: Context-dependent effects of CDKN2A and other 9p21 gene losses during the evolution of oesophageal cancer

finding: The SNP rs17388568 was associated with increased responses to anti-PD-1 (aPD1) therapy in a study involving 436 melanoma patients. This risk variant is linked to autoimmune diseases such as allergy, colitis, and type 1 diabetes, and is in proximity to the IL2 and IL21 cytokine genes. The finding highlighted the influence of germline genetic variations on immunotherapeutic responses.
title: Mapping the genetic landscape establishing a tumor immune microenvironment favorable for anti-PD-1 response in mice and humans

finding: The missense variant rs1229984 of ADH1B was shown to be the strongest instrument for alcohol intake. MR Corge estimates indicated a risk-increasing effect of alcohol intake on coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: The intergenic variant rs4694423 near GC was included among the core instruments for vitamin D levels. The analyses indicated no causal relationship between vitamin D levels and CAD.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: The SNP rs113473633 demonstrated a PIP of 0.99 for both white blood cell (WBC) count and eosinophil count traits. It was linked to the gene NFKB1, a major transcription factor critical for immune responses and lymphocyte development, and was relevant to blood cell traits.
title: Contribution of enhancer-driven and master-regulator genes to autoimmune disease revealed using functionally informed SNP-to-gene linking strategies

finding: The D451E substitution in GC vitamin D-binding protein was identified as a candidate with a significantly higher allele frequency in European populations (58%) compared to African populations (7.3%). This SNP was correlated with altered levels of GC protein and vitamin D metabolism in African-American individuals.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: In the studies, rs870142 was associated with an increased risk of atrial septal defects (ASD) and left ventricular outflow tract obstruction (LVOTO), with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.35 (95% CI: 1.25-1.46; p<10^-4) supported by a meta-analysis involving data from multiple cohorts including the UK Biobank. This finding corroborated earlier published data with similar effect sizes (OR between 1.27-1.45; p<0.05), suggesting a strong association of this SNP with congenital heart disease phenotypes.
title: Association between the 4p16 genomic locus and different types of congenital heart disease: results from adult survivors in the UK Biobank

finding: Regulated ZMIZ1, a gene also implicated in WNT signaling, indicating a mechanistic connection to T cell signaling pathways.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs13133148 was examined in the context of integrative analysis of next-generation sequencing in cancer research, with implications for advancements in artificial intelligence applications in oncology as discussed by Park et al. (2021). This suggests that variations at this locus could be significant for future cancer research methodologies.
title: Identification of prognostic biomarkers for suppressing tumorigenesis and metastasis of Hepatocellular carcinoma through transcriptome analysis

finding: In the study, rs13123056 was associated with structural chromosomal instability (S-CIN) and whole chromosomal instability (W-CIN), which are linked to cancer progression and treatment resistance. The authors reported that higher levels of S-CIN correlated with homologous recombination deficiency, while high levels of W-CIN were often a result of whole genome doubling. Moreover, it was found that the drug resistance gene CKS1B was strongly associated with both S-CIN and W-CIN, highlighting the importance of this SNP in the context of tumorigenesis.
title: Distinct and common features of numerical and structural chromosomal instability across different cancer types

finding: The SNP rs4260523 was part of a genome-wide significant locus identified in relation to self-assessed resilience among European ancestry soldiers, located in an intergenic region on chromosome 4 upstream from the DCLK2 gene. The study highlighted a common-variant heritability of resilience and a negative genetic correlation with neuroticism.
title: Genomewide Analyses of Psychological Resilience in US Army Soldiers

finding: The rs881382 variant was identified as a trimodal QTL associated with the gene IGFBP7, disrupting the SPI1 binding motif while enhancing the binding motif for the transcription factor IRF8.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: This trimodal QTL variant was associated with BST1, which is relevant to the innate immune response, and was implicated in Parkinson's disease associations.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: This variant also linked to BST1, it had associations with Parkinson's disease, indicating genetic implications for innate immune functions in the disorder.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: Population-based genetic analyses indicated that the SNP rs35852935 near the gene LAP3 was identified as a regulator of BMI, indicating its involvement in body mass regulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs870142 was associated with atrial septal defect (ASD) as it acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the long noncoding RNA STX18-AS1 in adult ventricular myocardial tissue. This finding contributed to identifying STX18-AS1 as a candidate gene for the disease.
title: STX18-AS1 is a Long Noncoding RNA predisposing to Atrial Septal Defect via downregulation of NKX2-5 in differentiating cardiomyocytes

finding: The SNP rs6824295 was identified as an eQTL for the lncRNA STX18-AS1 in adult ventricular myocardial tissue and was involved in the genomic region associated with the risk of ASD, supporting STX18-AS1's role as a potential candidate gene.
title: STX18-AS1 is a Long Noncoding RNA predisposing to Atrial Septal Defect via downregulation of NKX2-5 in differentiating cardiomyocytes

finding: The SNP rs16835979 demonstrated strong association with atrial septal defect (ASD) as it served as an eQTL for STX18-AS1 in adult ventricular myocardial tissue, reinforcing the significance of this lncRNA in the pathogenesis of ASD and highlighting it as a candidate gene.
title: STX18-AS1 is a Long Noncoding RNA predisposing to Atrial Septal Defect via downregulation of NKX2-5 in differentiating cardiomyocytes

finding: The SNP rs13143606 was identified as a significant variant in the study by Boyson et al. (2021), where it was associated with the functional roles of Bromodomain proteins in cancer. The research indicated that variations at this SNP could influence the expression and functions of Brd-proteins, which are essential epigenetic mark readers involved in gene regulation and cellular processes. This finding highlighted the importance of genetic variability in the context of cancer biology.
title: Genome-wide analysis of bromodomain gene family in Arabidopsis and Rice

finding: The SNP rs13133142 was associated with increased levels of proteasome components in Wilms tumor, particularly noted for its link to anaplastic histology which correlates with worse prognosis in patients.
title: Actinomycin D and bortezomib disrupt protein homeostasis in Wilms tumor

finding: The SNP rs13133193 was associated with findings in the study titled 'Repurposing of Antimicrobial Agents for Cancer Therapy', where it related to therapeutic implications of antimicrobial agents such as rapamycin and its analogs in cancer treatment.
title: Chemical proteomics reveals that the anticancer drug everolimus affects ubiquitin-proteasome system

finding: The SNP rs13133317 was linked to phosphorylation of histone H2AX, a key marker of DNA damage response, especially under conditions of drug-induced replication stress in cancer cells. The study demonstrated that this SNP played a role in visualizing and understanding the dynamics of DNA repair processes.
title: Probing DNA damage sites reveals context-dependent and novel DNA damage response factors

finding: The SNP rs10030081 was identified as associated with altered TEAD1 transcription factor activity, crucially connecting to HCMV infection-related chromatin accessibility changes. This finding was significant as it related to genetic risk loci for eye and ear development, highlighting the role of TEAD1 in these developmental pathways affected by HCMV.
title: Human cytomegalovirus infection coopts chromatin organization to diminish TEAD1 transcription factor activity

finding: The SNP rs13102310 was identified as a positive and original finding in the context of Synovial Sarcoma (SS) research. It was linked to mechanisms of BCL-2 addiction in SS by overcoming low NOXA levels, demonstrating its relevance in the tumorigenesis process associated with the SS18::SSX fusion oncoprotein. This finding related specifically to pathways involving apoptosis and survival signaling in SS cells.
title: Targeting of SUMOylation leads to cBAF complex stabilization and disruption of the SS18::SSX transcriptome in Synovial Sarcoma

finding: Similarly, SNP rs13107325 on chromosome 4 was associated with regional brain morphology, showing impressive significance with a p-value of 3.1×10^-124. The effects also revealed a positive association with surface area and thickness of cortical regions, as reflected in the Z-values reported.
title: Making the MOSTest of imaging genetics

finding: The SNP rs13133182 was associated with TAp73 regulation in vascular integrity and endothelial junction dynamics. It was reported in the context of the study which investigated isoform-specific effects of Trp73 in mouse embryonic stem cell models, showcasing the significance of this SNP in modulating Angiomotin expression and downstream functionality in endothelial cells, thereby influencing vascular permeability and junction integrity.
title: p73 is required for vessel integrity controlling endothelial junctional dynamics through Angiomotin

finding: The SNP rs13133343 was associated with ovarian cancer risk, as detailed in the research that integrated single-cell transcriptomic data with chromatin accessibility profiles from the postmenopausal ovary and fallopian tube. The study highlighted that epithelial cells of the fallopian tube, where this SNP was located, expressed multiple ovarian cancer risk-associated genes, indicating a potential involvement in the tumor microenvironment and progression of serous ovarian cancer.
title: A molecular atlas of the human postmenopausal fallopian tube and ovary from single-cell RNA and ATAC sequencing

finding: RS356229 was associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) risk. Specifically, the rs356229_C allele was linked to increased PD risk with an odds ratio of 1.3 (P=3E-42) in a meta-analysis of 108,990 samples. In the present study, rs356229_C also presented an association with PD (OR=1.3, P=0.04 with N=802). The finding highlighted how the variance affected the abundance of Corynebacterium_1, where a significant increase in PD cases was noted, demonstrating a complex interaction between genotype and microbiome composition.
title: Human-genome gut-microbiome interaction in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs13123005 was studied in relation to DLX genes, which are known to play significant roles in development and cancer. This finding suggested that variations at this locus could potentially influence gene expression patterns related to critical developmental processes, particularly in neuronal contexts.
title: Extensive long-range polycomb interactions and weak compartmentalization are hallmarks of human neuronal 3D genome

finding: The RNA editing QTL rs34083116 was significantly associated with the R764G editing of the AMPA subunit of GRIA2. This editing event resulted in a deleterious protein function and was connected to neurodegenerative conditions, suggesting this QTL could serve as a biomarker for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The A allele of variant rs4698412 was reported to increase the expression of CD38 and was associated with an increased risk for Parkinson's disease (PD). This finding provided insights into the genetic mechanisms underlying PD.
title: EMO: Predicting Non-coding Mutation-induced Up- and Down-regulation of Risk Gene Expression using Deep Learning

finding: The SNP rs28999109 was found to decrease promoter transcriptional activity, as demonstrated in a study by Choi et al., and was associated with cleft lip and/or palate (CL/P). This finding provided important insights into how genetic variations in the PDGF-C regulatory region could impact craniofacial development, correlating with the underlying mechanisms observed in cranial neural crest cell (cNCC) activity during murine embryogenesis.
title: Pdgfra and Pdgfrb genetically interact in the murine neural crest cell lineage to regulate migration and proliferation

finding: The study found that the G allele (minor allele) of SNP rs1348224 had a negative effect on Phenotypic Axis 1, indicating a protective effect against cognitive impairment in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients. This finding was consistent with previous reports linking this locus to reduced risk for PD with dementia and dementia with Lewy bodies.
title: Universal latent axes capturing Parkinson’s patient deep phenotypic variation reveals patients with a high genetic risk for Alzheimer’s disease are more likely to develop a more aggressive form of Parkinson’s

finding: The SNP rs7697189 demonstrated a significant interaction with sex on forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) across a large cohort. The minor (C) allele showed a greater effect on lung function in males than in females (untransformed FEV1 β = 0.028 in males vs β = 0.009 in females). This finding was replicated in an independent cohort (P = 0.016). Additionally, rs7697189 was associated with expression levels of the HHIP gene in lung tissue but showed no interaction with sex in terms of expression differences.
title: SNPs associated with HHIP expression have differential effects on lung function in males and females

finding: This SNP was associated with CKD extremes (P = 0.016), highlighting its role as a potential genetic risk factor in extreme renal outcomes.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The SNP rs5743566, located in the TLR1 gene, was identified as an adaptively introgressed exonic splicing mutation (ESM) with a moderate effect on splicing, reducing exon inclusion compared to the ancestral allele. It was confirmed to have originated in Neanderthals and later introgressed into modern human populations, significantly influencing the splicing phenotype in various tissues.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The SNP rs2726479 was identified as part of a total of 42 novel SNPs shared between multiple sclerosis (MS) and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), confirming its association with the joint phenotype of MS-IBD.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The research indicated that the GALNTL6 gene rs558129 polymorphism was associated with power performance, suggesting it played a role in metabolic processes relevant to muscle hypertrophy and strength adaptations.
title: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy rewires glucose metabolism in mice: an experimental investigation and systematic review

finding: The SNP rs10020330 was positively associated with high-throughput phenotyping traits, specifically relating to canopy cover and senescence in maize field trials. This finding indicated that the SNP was significant for assessing these traits through aerial digital imaging methods as discussed in the study by Makanza et al. (2018).
title: Easy MPE: Extraction of quality microplot images for UAV-based high-throughput field phenotyping

finding: The SNP rs10030059 was associated with post-translational modifications (PTMs) of H2A histone variants and their implications in cancer, as highlighted in a study by Corujo and Buschbeck in 2018. This finding detailed how H2A variants, particularly in connection with their unique PTMs, might contribute to alterations in chromatin structure and regulation, which are vital in understanding cancer biology.
title: Crosstalk between H2A variant-specific modifications impacts vital cell functions

finding: The SNP rs10030059 was associated with post-translational modifications of H2A histone variants and their implications in cancer, as discussed by Corujo and Buschbeck in 2018. The investigation highlighted how modifications, such as phosphorylation of specific motifs, can influence the functionality of H2A variants, thus adding complexity to chromatin regulation.
title: Crosstalk between H2A variant-specific modifications impacts vital cell functions

finding: The rs3748034 variant, a missense variant in HGFAC, was found to strongly associate with increased circulating triglycerides (beta = 0.0302, p < 5e-28), as well as increased circulating albumin and platelets. These findings were consistent with phenotypes observed in HGFAC knockout (KO) mice, which demonstrated a 28% increase in circulating triglycerides and a 15% increase in circulating albumin, supporting the role of HGFAC in regulating lipid metabolism.
title: HGFAC is a ChREBP Regulated Hepatokine that Enhances Glucose and Lipid Homeostasis

finding: The rs16844401 missense variant in HGFAC also showed a strong association with increased circulating triglycerides and further associated with increased risk of coronary artery disease, indicating its role in cardiometabolic health.
title: HGFAC is a ChREBP Regulated Hepatokine that Enhances Glucose and Lipid Homeostasis

finding: The SNP allele at rs11940944 enhanced the binding of the ETS-family transcription factor PU.1 in myeloid cells, leading to increased recruitment of cofactors p300, SMARCA4, and TBL1XR1. This recruitment was established through significant z-scores (p300: 2.36, SMARCA4: 2.99, TBL1XR1: 2.61) when compared to the reference allele, establishing the SNP as a key regulator in the modulation of CXCL10.
title: Customizable high-throughput platform for profiling cofactor recruitment to DNA to characterize cis-regulatory elements and screen non-coding single-nucleotide polymorphisms

finding: The rs11730091 SNP was identified as being concordant with the binding motif of the transcription factor ZFX, which was found to bind multiple ASBs. Additionally, it was annotated as a GTEx eQTL in the heart, indicating a regulatory role in gene expression related to mitochondrial functioning and angiogenesis.
title: Statistical framework for calling allelic imbalance in high-throughput sequencing data

finding: At the WFS1 locus, rs10937721 was associated with a causal proxy variant rs4234731, which contacted the WFS1 promoter in alpha and beta cells but exhibited elevated interaction in alpha cells, asserting its importance in diabetes context.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: Located in the WFS1 gene, rs4234731 was shown to strongly disrupt NEUROD2 transcription factor binding. Its alpha-cell specific contact with the WFS1 promoter suggests a unique role in glucagon-producing cells in diabetes.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The missense variant rs144292455 in TACR3 was associated with increased risk of AD, particularly in APOE ε4 non-carriers, demonstrating significant biological effects.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2604551 was linked to potassium voltage-gated channel regulation via effects on KCNA5.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs2702575 was implicated in trans-eQTL effects involving KCNA5, linking to neuronal excitability.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs13107325 was associated with CT5 and was also linked to schizophrenia risk variants in the SLC39A8 gene.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The SNP rs13135092, associated with SA5, was similarly connected to schizophrenia risk variants within the SLC39A8 gene.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The variant rs13107325, a missense variant of SLC39A8, was found to have a strong association with the QSM right pallidum imaging-derived phenotypes (IDP). It identified correlations with caudate, substantia nigra, and sub-regions of pallidum, and it was linked to multiple health-related traits including blood pressure and brain morphology.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: Variants associated with BANK1, particularly rs13105682, demonstrated strong voxel-wise associations in caudate and substantia nigra regions, connecting it to calcium mobilization and cognitive functions.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs13143308 was associated with differing effects on the contiguous traits P wave duration (increased by 0.63 ms) and PR segment (shortened by 0.58 ms), thereby highlighting the complexity of ECG traits. However, when evaluated as the composite PR interval, its contribution resulted in a near-zero effect (p = 0.84), which demonstrated the importance of evaluating contiguous vs composite traits.
title: Multi-ethnic genome-wide association study of decomposed cardioelectric phenotypes illustrates strategies to identify and characterize evidence of shared genetic effects for complex traits

finding: The SNP rs5019538 was associated with SNCA and was one of the notable exceptions, as it was localized to a gene of significant enrichment and specific expression in dopaminergic neurons.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: The SNP rs4478185 was associated with levels of glycolytic metabolites and ATP in human RBCs. Although rare, with 2 and 1 alleles observed in 0.2% and 3.4% of the REDS RBC Omics Index cohort, respectively, this SNP showed significant associations highlighting its role in glycolysis during RBC storage.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: The SNP rs113473633, which had a PIP of 0.99, was connected to the gene NFKB1 through the Roadmap S2G strategy. NFKB1 is a key transcription factor in immune response and its role in blood cell traits was reaffirmed through its association, being ranked 409 for Trans-master and 111 for PPI-master gene scores, particularly relevant for white blood cell count and eosinophil count.
title: Contribution of enhancer-driven and master-regulator genes to autoimmune disease revealed using functionally informed SNP-to-gene linking strategies

finding: SNP rs12507026, which was in linkage disequilibrium with rs13130484, was identified as being significantly associated with years of educational attainment, with a P-value of 0.0028. This finding suggested that educational attainment might act as a confounding factor in understanding the relationship between childhood BMI and adult outcomes.
title: Phenome-wide investigation of the causal associations between childhood BMI and adult outcomes: A two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was implicated in short-term ex vivo culture of CTCs from advanced breast cancer patients, highlighting its clinical implications.
title: Propagated circulating tumor cells uncovers the role of NFκB and COP1 in metastasis

finding: The study reported that the BMPR1B polymorphism rs1434536 was associated with breast cancer susceptibility specifically in Northwest Chinese Han females, indicating its potential role as a genetic risk factor for this population.
title: The expression patterns of different cell types and their interactions in the tumor microenvironment are predictive of breast cancer patient response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy

finding: Similarly, the rs1970801 polymorphism in BMPR1B was also identified as being associated with increased susceptibility to breast cancer in the same cohort of Northwest Chinese Han females, reinforcing the relevance of these SNPs in cancer genetics.
title: The expression patterns of different cell types and their interactions in the tumor microenvironment are predictive of breast cancer patient response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs1229984 in the ADH1B gene was associated with alcohol tolerance, showing Jomon-derived haplotypes at frequencies of 3.8% for the ancestral allele (higher alcohol tolerance) and 4.8% for the derived allele (lower alcohol tolerance) in modern Japanese.
title: Comprehensive analysis of Japanese population history by detecting ancestry-marker polymorphisms without using ancestral genomic information

finding: The kinase insert domain-containing receptor gene polymorphism rs2071559 showed associations with markers of carotid atherosclerosis in type 2 diabetes patients.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs13122962 was associated with the overexpression of stearoyl-CoA desaturase-1 linked to hypoxic microenvironments in cancer, specifically noted in clear cell renal cell carcinoma. This association underlined the relevance of SCD1 in lipidomic profile changes and potential therapeutic targets, impacting strategies for treating patients with acute myeloid leukaemia.
title: SCD inhibition preferentially eradicates AML displaying high de novo fatty acid desaturation and synergizes with chemotherapy

finding: The finding related to rs5010092 was identified in the context of enhancing understanding of metastatic gastric carcinoma. Specifically, this SNP was associated with altered cancer behavior and therapeutic responses in gastric cancer models, which reflected the histological and molecular features of various human subtypes of the disease. This correlation indicated that genotypic configurations, including rs5010092, might influence organotropism and immune surveillance in gastric cancer, leading to distinct metastatic patterns observed in both models and patients.
title: Somatic mouse models of gastric cancer reveal genotype-specific features of metastatic disease

finding: The study demonstrated that carriers of the ADH1B Arg47His variant (rs1229984) reported a 26% lower amount of alcohol consumption compared to non-carriers. Furthermore, analyses indicated that one additional drink per day was associated with a statistically significant increase in various cardiometabolic traits including systolic blood pressure, BMI, waist circumference, body fat percentage, LDL levels, and increased risks of myocardial infarction, stroke, cardiovascular disease, and all-cause mortality. These findings highlighted the variant as a strong genetic predictor of alcohol use related to adverse cardiometabolic outcomes.
title: Alcohol use and cardiometabolic risk in the UK Biobank: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs13133182 was associated with the regulation of TAp73 and its transcriptional programs. The finding highlighted the role of TAp73 as a vascular architect, specifically affecting the expression and localization of Angiomotin (AMOT) at endothelial junctions. The research established that p73 knockout led to compromised endothelial integrity, characterized by increased junctional serration and actin bundle formations, suggesting that rs13133182's functionality is crucial for maintaining vascular structure and preventing hyperpermeability.
title: p73 is required for vessel integrity controlling endothelial junctional dynamics through Angiomotin

finding: The SNP rs13112593 was associated with findings related to language organization in the context of brain tumors. In a study of glioma patients, this SNP was implicated in the structural changes observed in grey matter associated with language function, particularly in how a left-hemisphere brain tumor could affect contralateral (right hemisphere) language regions. The specific context linked this SNP to the lateralization of lesions and the associated compensatory mechanisms that may contribute to language organization, as indicated by volumetric changes in both hemispheres.
title: Grey matter reshaping of language-related regions depends on tumor lateralization

finding: The SNP rs13123087 was identified in a study that explored PP2A tumor biology and the effects of the PP2A inhibitor LB100 in the nervous system. This finding was significant as it related to the development of therapies for NF1-associated tumors, particularly through mechanisms that involve tumor suppressor pathways such as NF1. It emphasized the gene's relevance in the functional landscape of nervous system tumors and presented insights into potential therapeutic interventions.
title: Pharmacogenomic synthetic lethal screens reveal hidden vulnerabilities and new therapeutic approaches for treatment of NF1-associated tumors

finding: The SNP rs13107325, linked to a pathogenic mutation in the Mn transporter ZIP8 (A391T), was identified as one of the most pleiotropic variants in the human genome. This variant was associated with decreased hepatic Mn and increased biliary Mn. It had multiple associations: it correlated with obesity, early-childhood-onset obesity, schizophrenia, and Crohn's disease, while it provided a protective effect against alcohol misuse disorder and hypertension. Additionally, this variant was among six genetic variants linked to MRI-based, non-invasive measures of steatohepatitis and fibrosis, and it was associated with elevated aminotransferases in the UK Biobank.
title: Hepatobiliary manganese homeostasis is dynamic in the setting of illness in mice

finding: The rs1229984 SNP in the ADH1B gene was associated with significant differences in alcohol intake levels. Individuals with the AA/AG genotype consumed an average of 4.9 units of alcohol per week, whereas those with the GG genotype consumed 6.276 units. Furthermore, individuals with a GG genotype who had partners carrying the A allele (AG or AA) consumed significantly less alcohol, averaging 5.8 units per week compared to 6.301 units for those with GG partners. This finding illustrated that the presence of the A allele in a partner was linked to reduced alcohol consumption in individuals with the GG genotype, showing a genetic interaction between partners affecting alcohol intake.
title: Genetic and shared couple environmental contributions to smoking and alcohol use in the UK population

finding: The SNP rs2301857 located in the STK32B gene was identified as the top suggestive variant associated with the tremor/PIGD score ratio (p = 6.6 x 10^-7), implicating it as a potential modifier of PD motor subtypes.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Meta-Analysis for Parkinson’s Disease Motor Subtypes

finding: A rare missense variant in the ADAMTS3 gene, this SNP had a MAF of 0.4% and achieved a significant p value of 2.02×10^-27.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: Another missense variant in the ADAMTS3 gene, it had a MAF of 1.3% and was significant with a p value of 2.36×10^-14.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: This missense variant in ADAMTS3 had a MAF of 2.4% and achieved a significant p value of 4.06×10^-15.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort
