finding: This intron variant in ADAMTS3 had a MAF of 7.8% and was associated with ALM variation (p=9.51×10^-11).
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: Another intronic variant in the ADAMTS3 gene, it had a MAF of 5.5% and a significant p value of 3.24×10^-23.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: This intergenic variant was located near ADAMTS3, with a MAF of 6% and a very significant p value of 1.16×10^-83.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: This SNP was associated with loss of TMPRSS2 and T2E gene fusion, showing an OR of 0.60 and 0.59 respectively, with BH FDR values at 0.095 and 0.027.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: This SNP was demonstrated to associate with ERG status, replicating with an OR of 1.94 and BH FDR equal to 0.011.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: The SNP rs17023134 showed a significant association with the reproductive subtype of PCOS (P_meta=9.71×10^-9) with an OR of 3.02 (95% CI, 2.06-4.42). It was found within an intronic region of the UNC5C gene.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs10516957 was associated with the reproductive subtype of PCOS at genome-wide significance (P_meta=1.46×10^-8) with an OR of 2.42 (95% CI, 1.66-3.52). It was located in an intronic region of the BMPR1B gene.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The rs7041 (A) allele was associated with lower DBP levels and decreased total 25(OH)D levels among blacks. It exhibited the highest frequencies in African populations, particularly among the Finnish population. The allele was consequently linked with higher total 25(OH)D levels in blacks, although it was suggested that genetic factors had minor influence on total 25(OH)D levels in this demographic.
title: Allele frequency distribution of SNPs associated with levels of Vitamin D-binding protein and 25-hydroxyvitamin D

finding: The rs4588 (T) allele was associated with increased vitamin D-binding protein levels and decreased total 25(OH)D levels among whites. This allele showed the lowest frequency in African populations, with the highest frequencies observed in South Asian and Ashkenazi Jewish populations. It also exhibited a trend of decreasing allele frequency from west to east and from north to south across Eurasian populations.
title: Allele frequency distribution of SNPs associated with levels of Vitamin D-binding protein and 25-hydroxyvitamin D

finding: The SNP rs190663174 was associated with a maternal effect on offspring birth weight, with a statistical significance of P=6×10−4 as determined by GWAS. This association highlighted the relevance of the SNP in the context of gene regulation affecting gestation length and outcomes related to pregnancy.
title: Evolutionary transcriptomics implicates HAND2 in the origins of implantation and regulation of gestation length

finding: The SNP rs2231142, located in the ABCG2 gene, was associated with higher serum uric acid levels and the prevalence of gout. This finding correlates with existing literature from the PAGE Study which highlighted its significant role in gout among diverse populations, suggesting a genetic predisposition to elevated uric acid levels that can lead to gout in affected individuals.
title: Health Conditions Associated with Overweight in Climacteric Women

finding: The reQTL for RPS26 presented stronger interaction effects in monocytes post-perturbation in the IAV experiment, delineating its cell-type-specific regulatory role.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs13140079 was identified as the lead variant for a body mass index GWAS locus, colocalizing with an EDev-unique PPC caQTL singleton (ppc_atac_peak_197599). This variant was located 27 kb upstream of KIT, which encodes a tyrosine kinase receptor involved in c-KIT signaling. The findings suggested that the regulatory element ppc_atac_peak_197599 may disrupt c-KIT signaling during early pancreas development, potentially influencing metabolism and body mass index later in life.
title: Multi-omic QTL mapping in early developmental tissues reveals phenotypic and temporal complexity of regulatory variants underlying GWAS loci

finding: The SNP rs4478185 was identified as the most significant CD38 SNP associated with glycolytic and pentose phosphate pathway metabolites in the REDS RBC Omics Index cohort. It showed positive associations with ATP levels and glycolytic metabolites, corroborating findings from murine studies indicating its involvement in regulating glycolysis.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Red Blood Cell Glycolysis

finding: The SNP rs13122950 was associated with clinical outcomes in patients receiving immune checkpoint blockade for advanced non-small cell lung cancer. Specifically, this finding was characterized by an analysis of the circulating T cell receptor repertoire, which provided prognostic insights into response rates following PD-1 blockade. The study demonstrated that particular TCR clones correlated with favorable clinical responses, thereby underscoring the potential significance of this SNP in predicting treatment efficacy.
title: Deep sequencing of the T cell Receptor reveals common and reproducible CD8+ signatures of response to checkpoint immunotherapy

finding: The analysis of rs16890979 revealed significant associations with urate levels. The GWAS found differences in urate variation between individuals with two C alleles compared to those with two T alleles, indicating a biological relevance in the context of urate biosynthesis and transport pathways.
title: GWAS of three molecular traits highlights core genes and pathways alongside a highly polygenic background

finding: The SNP rs71616586 was noted to have an extremely protective effect, with an OR of 0.00201 per 10mmHg lower SBP (95% CI: 5.22e-6 to 0.78; p=0.04). This finding was likely significant in contributing to the protective association observed for potassium-sparing diuretics and aldosterone antagonists.
title: Repurposing antihypertensive drugs for the prevention of Alzheimer’s disease: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The analysis of SNP rs10020199 revealed its application in estimating foliar traits through airborne imaging spectroscopy. It was crucial in differentiating the physiological responses of tropical forests, suggesting its utility in broader ecological and agricultural monitoring.
title: Scalable early detection of grapevine virus infection with airborne imaging spectroscopy

finding: rs13143517 was associated with the modulation of the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway in breast cancer, as described in the research by Li et al. (2021). This SNP contributed to the understanding of genetic factors influencing the efficacy of targeting the PI3K pathway for therapeutic interventions in cancer treatment.
title: Allosteric activation or inhibition of PI3Kγ mediated through conformational changes in the p110γ helical domain

finding: The rs1229984 genetic variant was detected in an early-stage non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) individual, leading to a single amino acid variant (SAAV) that changed histidine to arginine. This finding highlighted the significance of the variant in relation to lung cancer and exemplified the ability of the personalized proteogenomic approach to identify variants that are not present in standard peptide sequence databases.
title: Peptide-centric analyses of human plasma enable increased resolution of biological insights into non-small cell lung cancer relative to protein-centric analysis

finding: The missense variant rs144292455 in TACR3 was found to increase the risk of AD with a hazard ratio of 5.53. The minor allele carriers were predominantly affected, which indicates its role in AD pathology.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs3113195 located in the UCP1 gene was positively associated with non-shivering thermogenesis (NST), which was crucial for the Jomon people in cold environments, suggesting an adaptation mechanism for thermal regulation during the Last Glacial Maximum.
title: Cold adaptation in Upper Paleolithic hunter-gatherers of eastern Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs12502572 within the UCP1 gene also played a role in promoting NST, and its positive association supported the survival strategy of Jomon people in cold climates.
title: Cold adaptation in Upper Paleolithic hunter-gatherers of eastern Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs1800592 in the UCP1 gene was identified as a contributor to NST, indicating that its presence in the Jomon lineage was beneficial for thermal adaptation during colder periods.
title: Cold adaptation in Upper Paleolithic hunter-gatherers of eastern Eurasia

finding: Similar to other SNPs in the UCP1 gene, rs4956451 was positively associated with NST, underscoring its significance in the cold acclimatization of the Jomon hunter-gatherers.
title: Cold adaptation in Upper Paleolithic hunter-gatherers of eastern Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs13107325, corresponding to a missense mutation (A391T) in the manganese transporter SLC39A8, was strongly associated with schizophrenia. This variant was found to be present in approximately 8% of the general population, with higher prevalence in European lineages. In mouse models homozygous for A391T, changes in protein glycosylation, particularly in the N-linked glycosylation pathway, were observed, linking the variant to biochemical changes in the brain. The A391T mutation resulted in reduced serum manganese levels and increased odds of schizophrenia in heterozygous carriers, suggesting a mechanism by which this SNP contributes to the pathology of schizophrenia and other neuropsychiatric phenotypes.
title: The schizophrenia-associated variant in SLC39A8 alters N-glycosylation in the mouse brain

finding: This SNP was identified as a shared allele-specific chromatin accessibility variant (ASCAV) between melanoma samples, showcasing the accuracy of the ASCAV pipeline. The specific allele change was G>T/C, which was noted as a multiallelic site.
title: Prioritization of enhancer mutations by combining allele-specific chromatin accessibility with deep learning

finding: This SNP was identified within the cohort of notable exceptions where the most proximal gene was significantly enriched and specifically expressed in dopamine neurons, suggesting a potential role in the pathways relevant to Parkinson's disease pathology.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: Similar to rs356182, this SNP was also found to reside in a locus where its proximal gene showed specific and enriched expression in dopamine neurons, indicating its relevance to understanding genetic contributions to Parkinson's disease.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: This SNP was found in a context where its proximal gene was significantly enriched and specifically expressed, supporting its potential role in influencing Parkinson's disease risk.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: The SNP rs13123031 was identified in a study that focused on the challenges and opportunities for the statistical analysis of multiplex immunofluorescence data. It was mentioned in the context of analyzing spatial and phenotypic heterogeneity in biological tissues, particularly in relation to the spatial relationships of macrophage phenotypes with tumor cells and blood vessels.
title: Quantification of spatial and phenotypic heterogeneity in an agent-based model of tumour-macrophage interactions

finding: The SNP rs11726136 was implicated as the most significantly associated polymorphism affecting the expression of the lncRNA gene LOC339975. This finding was consistent across studies, underscoring the genetic influence on lncRNA expression related to alcohol dependence.
title: Assessing the role of long-noncoding RNA in nucleus accumbens in subjects with alcohol dependence

finding: The SNP rs13112536 was identified as a significant marker in the context of colorectal cancers, particularly in the association with BRAF V600E mutations. The study revealed that fascin1, a protein linked to these cancers, plays a crucial role in cell adhesion remodeling and is implicated in driving oncogenic signaling linked to tumor growth.
title: In BRAFV600E-mutated colorectal cancer cells, fascin1 restructures adherens junctions to drive Wnt activation

finding: The AFF1 rs340630 SNP showed an association with systemic lupus erythematosus in a Chinese population, suggesting a genetic influence on autoimmune conditions.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was linked to total drinks of alcohol per month, showing a significance of P=3.8×10^-248 and indicates a strong association with alcohol consumption.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: rs13126505 demonstrated pleiotropic associations with schizophrenia and was identified as an mQTL (β = 0.49, P = 4.03×10^-16) and eQTL (β = -0.27, P = 3.54×10^-10) for SLC39A8. It was also found to associate with schizophrenia through SLC39A8 DNAm and expression.
title: Cross-disorder analysis of schizophrenia and 19 immune diseases reveals genetic correlation

finding: The SNP rs6823809 was an intronic variant of the NPNT protein coding gene on chromosome 4 and was associated with FEV1 in the asthmatic subgroup, showing a top association with a statistical significance of p = 3.6 × 10−10. It was noted that this locus was 365 kb from rs10516541, which had been previously associated with FVC.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: The SNP rs34712979 was identified as a splice acceptor variant of the NPNT protein coding gene on chromosome 4. It was among the top associations in the overall analysis with lung function, showing a remarkable statistical significance of p = 6.0 × 10−60.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: The SNP rs6537293 was inside the LOC105377462 non-coding RNA on chromosome 4, with significant association to the FEV1/FVC ratio (p = 1.7 × 10−23) in the asthmatic subgroup. This position was noted for its prior associations with lung-related traits.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: The SNP rs6829956, an intronic variant of the LOC105377462 non-coding RNA on chromosome 4, was significantly related to lnPEF (p = 2.2 × 10−13) in the asthmatic subgroup and was associated with the FEV1/FVC ratio in prior research.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: The SNP rs13118083 was noted as an intronic variant of the LOC105377462 non-coding RNA on chromosome 4, which was also reported to have associations with the FEV1/FVC ratio.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: The SNP rs1229984, located in the ADH1B gene, was significantly associated with alcoholism (P=6.45×10⁻¹⁰). This finding was original as it related specifically to the genetic underpinnings of alcohol dependence.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies common genetic risk factors for alcohol, heroin and methamphetamine dependence

finding: The SNP rs1159918 was specifically associated only with alcoholism (P=1.03×10⁻¹²), validating its linkage to alcohol dependence among the tested genetic markers.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies common genetic risk factors for alcohol, heroin and methamphetamine dependence

finding: The SNP rs13107325, a non-synonymous SNP in the gene SLC39A8, was fine-mapped for multiple traits including balding, BMI, diastolic blood pressure, forced vital capacity, height, red blood cell count, total cholesterol, and waist-hip ratio (adjusted for BMI). This gene is associated with congenital disorders of glycosylation.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: The SNP rs1229984, a non-synonymous SNP in the gene ADH1B, was fine-mapped for various traits such as BMI, LDL, mean corpuscular hemoglobin, mean platelet volume, systolic blood pressure, total cholesterol, and Vitamin D. ADH1B is known to be associated with alcohol dependence.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: The SNP rs3733402 (Ser143Asn in KLKB1) was found to be associated with obesity in the subjects, which was concordant with the clinical diagnoses reported. This amino acid change was linked to Prekallikrein deficiency.
title: Complete genome sequence and analysis of nine Egyptian females with clinical information from different geographic regions in Egypt

finding: The SNP rs989902 was associated with an increased risk of sporadic colorectal cancer. It is located in the PTPN13 gene which plays a critical role in cellular growth and apoptosis regulation, linking it to cancer-related research.
title: Powerful statistical method to detect disease associated genes using publicly available GWAS summary data

finding: The rs9884482 variant was associated with fasting insulin (FI) and expression of TET2, a gene involved in DNA demethylation, thus highlighting the pathway through which it may affect glycaemic traits.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The rs1358594 variant was identified to be an eQTL for the CXCL1 gene primarily influencing its expression during the later time points of Poly (I:C) stimulated cells. The alternative allele (T) was associated with higher expression levels of CXCL1 compared to the reference allele (G). This eQTL signal was observed to be beyond 100Kb downstream of the gene's transcription start site, indicating its regulatory influence specifically upon cell stimulation.
title: Mapping interindividual dynamics of innate immune response at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs13123056 was associated with structural chromosomal instability (S-CIN), which indicated a potential role in tumourigenesis and treatment resistance. This association was emphasized in the context of the drug resistance gene CKS1B, which was reported as being strongly linked to both W-CIN and S-CIN.
title: Distinct and common features of numerical and structural chromosomal instability across different cancer types

finding: SNP rs3822259 showed effects on the binding of two transcription factors' motifs in HELA cells, indicating its involvement in gene regulation processes within the studied context.
title: RSAT Var-tools: an accessible and flexible framework to predict the impact of regulatory variants on transcription factor binding

finding: The SNP rs13112045 was identified in the context of remote sensing applications for monitoring fractional snow cover, showcasing its relevance in ecological studies related to snow conditions in grassland. This finding emphasized the utility of the SNP in understanding how micrometeorological conditions could affect biodiversity and seasonal weather patterns.
title: Deep learning to extract the meteorological by-catch of wildlife cameras

finding: The SNP rs2858038 was linked to the gene GRK4, which was among the differentially spliced genes identified in the study. This gene's splicing was associated with alcohol use disorder (AUD) and was enriched for splicing TWAS associations related to problematic alcohol use. Additionally, rs2858038 was demonstrated to be in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with SNPs associated with an increased number of cigarettes smoked per day.
title: Genome- and Transcriptome-wide Splicing Associations with Problematic Alcohol Use and Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: The SNP rs2960306 was identified as being in linkage disequilibrium with the lead sQTL for the gene GRK4 (rs2858038). It was associated with the number of cigarettes smoked per day, indicating a shared genetic basis for substance use traits among different disorders.
title: Genome- and Transcriptome-wide Splicing Associations with Problematic Alcohol Use and Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: The SNP rs5860287 in GRID2 was significantly associated with the symmetry/ordering dimension of OC traits, with a p-value of 3.2x10^-8. This variant was part of the central nervous system (CNS) gene set and highlighted the role of GRID2 in this specific OC trait dimension.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pediatric Obsessive-Compulsive Traits: Shared Genetic Risk between Traits and Disorder

finding: The G allele of variant rs34811474 was associated with increased risk of osteoarthritis, an age-related degenerative disease, linking reproductive advantages to detrimental health effects.
title: Evidence for the role of selection for reproductively advantageous alleles in human aging

finding: SNP rs1495714 in the NAT2 gene was implicated in skin fluorescence and advanced Glycation End products (AGEs), contributing to associations with self-reported facial aging.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs3736265 variant in the PPARGC1A gene was associated with a decreased risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus, which is relevant given its implications for metabolic health in populations at risk for diabetes and gestational diabetes.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs17388568 was originally identified as associated with an increased risk of ulcerative colitis and type 1 diabetes. Furthermore, it was found to correlate with an enhanced response to anti-PD-1 therapy in metastatic melanoma patients. This risk variant is located in a genomic region that contains the genes IL2 and IL21, which are key cytokines involved in regulating CD4+ T cells and T follicular helper (Tfh) cell responses.
title: The Lag3 and PD-1 pathways govern TCR signal duration and migration of CD4+ T cells

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with PSCI, where the 'C' allele was linked to increased risk (OR = 2.502) and lower BMSE scores. It was also correlated with attention deficiency in cognitive assessments.
title: Genetic Variations and Altered Blood mRNA Level of Circadian Genes and BDNF as Risk Factors of Post-Stroke Cognitive Impairment among Eastern Indians

finding: The rs13128814 variant was identified as the most likely causative variant for spontaneous coronary artery dissection (SCAD), coronary artery disease (CAD), systolic blood pressure (SBP), and ascending aorta diameter. Its risk allele (A) was linked to increased transcriptional activity and facilitated the binding of NF-1 transcription factors, particularly NFIA, which led to higher expression levels of the ZNF827 gene in vascular tissues.
title: ZNF827 pleiotropic cardiovascular risk locus involves regulation by Nuclear factor-1

finding: The SNP rs1507928 was previously identified as the lead variant associated with SCAD in earlier studies, supporting its relevance in understanding the genetic predisposition to this condition.
title: ZNF827 pleiotropic cardiovascular risk locus involves regulation by Nuclear factor-1

finding: The lead SNP for coronary artery disease (CAD) was found to be rs10006310, identified through GWAS with significant association (P = 3×10^-9), indicating its potential role in cardiovascular disorders.
title: ZNF827 pleiotropic cardiovascular risk locus involves regulation by Nuclear factor-1

finding: The lead SNP for systolic blood pressure (SBP) was identified as rs4835266 with a strong association (P = 8×10^-17), signifying its contribution to blood pressure regulation in the context of cardiovascular health.
title: ZNF827 pleiotropic cardiovascular risk locus involves regulation by Nuclear factor-1

finding: The lead SNP for ascending aorta diameter (AAdia) was identified as rs11100902 with a significant association (P = 6×10^-9), highlighting its relevance in cardiovascular phenotypes.
title: ZNF827 pleiotropic cardiovascular risk locus involves regulation by Nuclear factor-1

finding: Located near the LINC02502 gene on 4q27, rs13134800 displayed significant associations with coronary-related binary traits.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: In the TRMT10A gene (4q23), rs10026790 showed significant association with LDL regarding both coronary artery disease and lipid phenotypes.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: This SNP, near the FGFBP1 gene (4p15.32), showed associations with acute myocardial infarction and related heart conditions.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The FGF5 polymorphism rs16998073 was found to significantly increase the risk of preeclampsia in the Chinese Han population. This suggested a potential involvement of FGF5 in the pathophysiology of preeclampsia.
title: Fibroblast Growth Factor 5 (FGF5) and Its Missense Mutant FGF5-H174 Underlying Trichomegaly: A Molecular Dynamics Simulation Investigation

finding: The missense mutation in the gene SLC39A8, known as ZIP8 A391T (rs13107325), was found to significantly impact N-glycosylation, contributing to the pathogenesis of Crohn's disease. The variant exhibited a genotype-dependent effect where individuals with this mutation showed an increase in truncated N-glycans in intestinal biopsies, suggesting a perturbed glycophenotype. Additionally, ZIP8 A391T was associated with a range of complex diseases and ranked among the top 10 pleiotropic variants in the human genome.
title: Aberrant N-glycosylation is a therapeutic target in carriers of a common and highly pleiotropic mutation in the manganese transporter ZIP8

finding: The SNP rs13112748 was associated with altered signaling mechanisms involving EGFR in cancer, contributing to acquired resistance in various oncogenic pathways. The study emphasized its relevance in understanding drug resistance mechanisms in cancers, particularly in relation to therapeutic response outcomes when targeting EGFR.
title: MDR1 Drug Efflux Pump Promotes Intrinsic and Acquired Resistance to PROTACs in Cancer Cells

finding: The 5'-region variant rs10005233 was associated with isolated/idiopathic REM sleep behavior disorder (iRBD) with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.43 (p = 1.1E-08). This association was replicated in probable RBD (pRBD) patients, indicating a strong link to the risk of developing iRBD.
title: Fine-mapping of SNCA in REM sleep behavior disorder and overt synucleinopathies

finding: The 5'-UTR variant rs2583986 was associated with faster conversion to overt synucleinopathies according to Kaplan-Meier survival analysis, highlighting a potential role in disease progression.
title: Fine-mapping of SNCA in REM sleep behavior disorder and overt synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs72669153 was linked to several autoimmune diseases including T1D, IBD, PSO, CEL, and was located in a conserved non-coding sequence (CNS) positioned 51 kb upstream of the IL2 gene. It was shown to contribute to the remodeling of cRE activity in CD4+ T cells during activation.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: The SNP rs1512973 was linked to T1D, JIA, and SLE, and located 128 kb upstream of the IL2 gene. It was identified as a risk variant affecting enhancer activity related to IL2 expression, contributing to immunological processes influenced by T cell activation.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: The SNP rs12504008, associated with T1D, JIA, and SLE, was also found 128 kb upstream of the IL2 gene. It was experimentally verified that this SNP influences enhancer activity impacting IL2 transcription during CD4+ T cell activation.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: The rs2231142-A allele in ABCG2 was linked to increased serum uric acid levels in obese individuals, reflecting its role in metabolic syndrome.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs13107325 in the SLC39A8 gene, resulting in the A391T substitution in the ZIP8 metal ion transporter, was associated with Crohn's disease. This finding was significant as it linked the Thr allele carriage to altered microbiome composition in both Crohn's disease patients and healthy controls, indicating a possible mechanism by which genetic risk for inflammatory bowel disease could modify the gut microbiome.
title: The ZIP8 A391T Crohn’s disease-linked risk variant induces colonic metal ion dyshomeostasis, microbiome compositional shifts, and inflammation

finding: Similar to rs6224, the SNP rs13107325 demonstrated a significant association with schizophrenia. The direction of effect for alleles linked to both left-handedness and schizophrenia was consistent, suggesting it may play a role in both traits.
title: RSGenome-wide association study identifies 49 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: The SNP rs279858 was previously associated with disrupted structural connectome in reward circuits among heroin abusers, as reported by Sun et al. (2018). This finding suggested a linkage between GABRA2 variants and the alterations in neural connectivity in individuals with opioid use disorder, implying its relevance to the neurobiological mechanisms underlying addiction.
title: Circadian rhythm disruptions associated with opioid use disorder in the synaptic proteomes of the human dorsolateral prefrontal cortex and nucleus accumbens

finding: This ADHD-associated SNP was shown to influence neurodevelopmental impacts via YY1 binding site disruption, mediating stress responses and demonstrating genotype-dependent effects.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: In 2019, it was reported that the SNP rs6551665 in the ADGRL3 gene was identified as a common vulnerability factor associated with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). This finding highlighted the significance of ADGRL3 in externalizing disorders and suggested its genetic implications in behavioral phenotypes, aligning with previous observations of behavioral impacts in loss-of-function models for this gene.
title: adgrl3.1-deficient zebrafish show noradrenaline-mediated externalizing behaviors, and altered expression of externalizing disorder-candidate genes, suggesting functional targets for treatment

finding: The SNP rs13122851 was found to be relevant in the coordinated effect of VEGFC in conjunction with oleic acid, participating in tumor lymphangiogenesis. This research indicated a direct link between specific nutrients and the biochemical pathways that facilitate tumor progression.
title: Phenotype-specific melanoma uptake of fatty acid from human adipocytes activates AXL and CAV1-dependent β-catenin nuclear accumulation

finding: The SNP rs5743618 was identified in a region of chromosome 4 associated with several toll-like-receptor genes, including TLR1 and TLR10, which are related to innate immunity. It represented one of the strongest GWAS hits for hay-fever in European populations, showing significantly weaker effects on asthma risk. The protective allele against hay-fever was more prevalent in southern England, reflecting historical geographic differentiation possibly due to past natural selection.
title: Leveraging fine-scale population structure reveals conservation in genetic effect sizes between human populations across a range of human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs62333164 was found to be in moderate linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the structural variant PD_DEL_chr4_14749, which is a 0.42kb intragenic deletion located 35kb downstream of the gene NEK1.
title: Genome-wide analysis of Structural Variants in Parkinson’s Disease using Short-Read Sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs17388568 was associated with an increased risk of ulcerative colitis and type 1 diabetes, and it correlated with an enhanced response to anti-PD-1 therapy in metastatic melanoma patients. This SNP was situated in a genomic region containing genes IL2 and IL21, which are crucial for regulating CD4+ T cell and T follicular helper (Tfh) cell responses. The findings suggested important implications for understanding Tfh cell manipulation and its potential risks in the context of immunotherapy targeting PD-1.
title: Lag3 and PD-L1 govern T cell receptor signal duration in adaptively tolerised CD4+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs2272697 was found to disrupt ETS-family binding motifs and was in high LD with multiple GWAS peaks, relating to autoimmune and neurodegenerative disorders.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs7665090 was linked with multiple sclerosis. It displayed a disruption in transcription factor binding motifs, suggesting its involvement in the pathophysiology of related diseases.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs5026472 was found in strong LD with multiple GWAS peaks, confirming its potential regulatory importance in disease pathways.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs1054037 demonstrated strong correlations with autoimmune disorders, suggesting its critical role in regulatory transcriptional changes.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: SNP rs28522755 (chr4: 31143818 A/G) was identified as a risk variant for ADHD and co-localized with a consistent edQTL linked to an A-to-G editing site in the 3'UTR of PCDH7. This finding emphasized the importance of RNA editing variations in shaping the expression and function of the PCDH7 gene, which is critical for axonal guidance and neuronal signaling.
title: Expansion of RNA sequence diversity and RNA editing rates throughout human cortical development

finding: The variant rs13145415 (chr4:30823157 T/G) was linked to schizophrenia and co-localized with a postnatal predominant edQTL affecting the same 3'UTR editing site in PCDH7. This result suggested that genetic variation could influence neurodevelopmental processes through modifications in RNA editing patterns related to schizophrenia.
title: Expansion of RNA sequence diversity and RNA editing rates throughout human cortical development

finding: The SNP rs113323321, imputed from the ANTXR2 gene, significantly affected the weighted global efficiency metric over time, with a p-value of 4.85e-09. ANTXR2 mutations are associated with Hyaline fibromatosis syndrome and have implications in cell interaction with the extracellular matrix.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Brain Connectivity Changes for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7692897 was part of the identified 15.2 Mb locus on chromosome 4p15.32p15.1, which contained the pathogenic variant c.494C>A in <italic>CLRN2</italic>. This locus was confirmed to segregate with the hearing loss phenotype in the studied family.
title: Biallelic mutation of CLRN2 causes non-syndromic hearing loss in humans

finding: Similar to rs7692897, the SNP rs17081424 defined the homozygous interval on chromosome 4p15.32p15.1. It was involved in the mapping of the genetic lesion associated with the pre-lingual, moderate-to-profound autosomal recessive sensorineural hearing loss in the family studied.
title: Biallelic mutation of CLRN2 causes non-syndromic hearing loss in humans

finding: The analysis revealed that the genotype frequencies for rs762855 were significantly different between cases of Huntington's disease (HD) and healthy controls. More than 90% of both groups were found to belong to Haplogroup A, which is predominant in European populations.
title: Distribution of Huntington’s disease Haplogroups in Indian population

finding: Similarly, for rs3856973, significant differences in genotype frequencies were observed between HD cases and healthy controls, with over 90% belonging to Haplogroup A.
title: Distribution of Huntington’s disease Haplogroups in Indian population

finding: Analysis of rs4690073 also indicated significant differences in genotype frequencies between cases and controls, with a majority of individuals in both groups categorized under Haplogroup A.
title: Distribution of Huntington’s disease Haplogroups in Indian population

finding: The SNP rs356182 was identified as a significant Parkinson's disease (PD) risk variant. It was found that this SNP had a meta p-value of 1.85×10⁻⁸², indicating it was among the strongest associations with PD risk. The risk allele (G) had a frequency of 40-50% in the population and exhibited an odds ratio of 1.34, suggesting a higher prevalence in PD cases compared to healthy controls. Importantly, the study revealed that rs356182 affected gene expression beyond just the SNCA gene; specifically, it was associated with abnormal neuronal differentiation processes linked to dopaminergic neuron development. When analyzed in LUHMES cells, clones with the risk allele demonstrated less effective differentiation compared to the protective allele, hinting at a mechanistic role where the G allele inhibits differentiation processes, thereby contributing to PD risk later in life.
title: Global Effects of a PD Risk-SNP at the Alpha-Synuclein Locus

finding: The SNP rs182695896 was identified as being in moderate linkage disequilibrium (R²=0.49) with the deletion variant of the ALB gene promoter that affected serum albumin and total cholesterol levels. Conditional analysis attenuated the association between the deletion and total cholesterol, suggesting this SNP may influence cholesterol levels.
title: Association of Structural Variation with Cardiometabolic Traits in Finns

finding: The SNP rs16850360 was reported to be associated with albumin levels. In the present study, the ALB deletion was identified as the causal variant for this association, confirming its link with prior findings.
title: Association of Structural Variation with Cardiometabolic Traits in Finns

finding: The SNP rs2168889 was found to be linked to albumin levels, and similar to rs16850360, it was also linked to the ALB gene deletion, which was determined to be the causal variant for several reported albumin associations.
title: Association of Structural Variation with Cardiometabolic Traits in Finns

finding: The SNP rs1851024 was associated with albumin levels, and the study identified the ALB gene promoter deletion as the causal variant for this association, consistent with previous reports.
title: Association of Structural Variation with Cardiometabolic Traits in Finns

finding: The SNP rs182616603 was linked to cholesterol levels and identified in the study as being associated with the ALB deletion, thus suggesting a shared genetic influence on cholesterol through the SV.
title: Association of Structural Variation with Cardiometabolic Traits in Finns

finding: The SNP rs187918276 was the top tagging SNP for the ALB promoter deletion and was strongly associated with statin medication use, with additional associations observed in metabolic diseases, supporting its relevance in cardiometabolic contexts.
title: Association of Structural Variation with Cardiometabolic Traits in Finns

finding: This SNP was identified as a fine-mapped eQTL for INPP4B, impacting lymphocyte count. It also regulates IL15, with the genes located far from the variant but strongly linked to lymphocyte function.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The rs75562818 variant was associated with a co-expression module near the SLC39A8 gene in LPS-stimulated monocytes. This association was significant and identified a module consisting of five metallothionein genes. The cis-eQTL effect was linked to a transient response after LPS stimulation.
title: Co-expression analysis reveals interpretable gene modules controlled by trans-acting genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs13143575 was associated with the effectiveness of HDAC inhibitors in countering tumor heterogeneity. This finding highlighted a potential vulnerability of cancers with TERT promoter mutations, as those tumors exhibited altered responses to treatment based on this genetic variant.
title: SNAI2 cooperates with MEK1/2 and HDACs to suppress BIM- and BMF-dependent apoptosis in TERT promoter mutant cancers

finding: The SNP rs10010129 was associated with significant changes in land cover and landscape fragmentation in the context of the socio-political landscape post-war Western Area, Sierra Leone. This finding provided insights into how genetic factors could correlate with human environmental impact, particularly in regions experiencing transformation due to conflict and recovery efforts.
title: Dense satellite data reveals landscape connectivity decline in the Andes-Amazon region

finding: The SNP rs1229984, on ADH1B, was a known risk locus for alcohol use disorder and identified as significant for smoking initiation in this study.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs2071559 (T/C) polymorphism in VEGFR2 was associated with lymphatic metastasis in patients with nasopharyngeal carcinoma, suggesting that variants of this SNP could potentially influence the metastatic behavior of tumors through mechanisms involving lymphatic pathways.
title: A critical role of VEGFR2 in lymphatic tumor metastasis

finding: The study provided strong evidence of genetic variation in the Norwegian population, highlighting significant frequency differences for SNP rs904274 with a weighted F_ST value of 0.0073 between the Rogaland and Finnmark regions. This original finding related to the geographical patterns of genetic diversity underscores the importance of local ancestry and aids in the effort to establish national frequency-based databases for disease studies.
title: The genetic structure of Norway

finding: The novel rare variant rs75967634 in the ADH1B gene was identified, causing a substitution of histidine for arginine. This variant was highlighted due to its detection in a meta-analysis with greater power, and it was independent from other known variants in the same gene.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The SNP rs10434445 was identified as a trans-eQTL influencing SRP72 expression and further impacting TUBG2 via SRP72 in progenitors, underlining its relevant role in mediating relationships between gene expressions.
title: Inferring cell-type-specific causal gene regulatory networks during human neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs337638, located in a non-coding region on chromosome 4, showed a significant association with predicted brain age (RBA) with a p-value of 3E-16. It was the most significant SNP discovered in the study and was closest to the KLF3 gene, which is known to mediate lifespan in C. elegans and is possibly linked to educational attainment in humans.
title: Improving brain age estimates with deep learning leads to identification of novel genetic factors associated with brain aging

finding: The SNP rs6446553 was associated with the demethylation of the immune-modulated CpG cg19906672 in response to LPS stimulation. Carriers of the T allele experienced increased LPS-induced demethylation. This SNP colocalised with genetic determinants of several haematological parameters, including white blood cell count and neutrophil count, indicating its role in modulating immune responses.
title: Characterisation of the genetic determinants of context specific DNA methylation in primary monocytes

finding: The SNP rs10010025 was found to be associated with the morphology of repair foci, specifically influencing the organization of histone variant H2AX at double-strand breaks (DSBs). In the context of the study, this SNP was linked to variations in nucleosome density and chromatin structure around the break sites, which was quantitatively analyzed using a novel super-resolution microscopy method. This finding contributed to a better understanding of genome organization during the DNA repair processes.
title: Quantification of DNA damage induced γH2AX focus formation via super-resolution dSTORM localization microscopy

finding: The SNP rs7659456 was identified as the most significantly associated SNP in the African American cohort, with a p-value of 1.01 × 10^-15. Its minor allele (T) was found only in individuals of recent African ancestries, indicating a strong population-specific association with prostate cancer.
title: Multi-ethnic transcriptome-wide association study of prostate cancer

finding: The <italic>ABCG2</italic> Q141K (T) allele associated with gout in both European and Polynesian populations when using hyperuricaemia (HU) controls. The odds ratio (OR) for gout was reported as 1.85 (P=3.8E-21) in Europeans and 1.85 (P=1.3E-03) in Polynesians. Additionally, this allele was associated with higher serum urate levels in Polynesian individuals (β=0.018 mmol/L, P=0.014). The findings support a role for <italic>ABCG2</italic> in the progression from HU to gout and indicated that the 141K allele significantly correlated with an increase in gout flare frequency within Polynesian individuals (P=2.5E-03).
title: Pleiotropic effect of ABCG2 in gout: involvement in serum urate levels and progression from hyperuricemia to gout

finding: The <italic>rs10011796</italic> variant exhibited a similar association pattern with gout as <italic>rs2231142</italic>, albeit the effect size was weaker (OR=1.39, P=3.5E-11 for gout compared to HU in Europeans). However, it was not significantly associated with gout in any of the Polynesian samples. The allele also showed a significant epistatic interaction with <italic>ABCG2 rs2231142</italic>, particularly in Western Polynesian individuals, enhancing gout risk when combined (OR significantly increased to 21.5 in the presence of the non-risk genotype at <italic>rs10011796</italic>).
title: Pleiotropic effect of ABCG2 in gout: involvement in serum urate levels and progression from hyperuricemia to gout

finding: In the context of head and neck cancers, the SNP rs1516535 was found to be located within a spatially autocorrelated cuTAR (cuTAR213507), which was co-expressed with the cancer-relevant gene FGFR3 among others on chromosome 4. The cuTAR contained evidence suggesting functional relevance due to its association with TENM3, a gene known to be upregulated in several cancers, particularly in head and neck squamous cell carcinomas (HNSCC). Additionally, TENM3 is an integration site for HPV, which is linked to a high proportion of oropharyngeal cancers.
title: Unraveling lncRNA Diversity at a Single Cell Resolution and in a Spatial Context across Different Cancer Types

finding: The SNP rs13122872 was associated with Cbp/P300 functioning as critical co-activators for nuclear steroid hormone receptors. This relationship was emphasized in the context of prostate and breast cancers, suggesting the potential therapeutic targeting of pathways involving p300 in these cancer types.
title: VGLL2 and TEAD1 fusion proteins drive YAP/TAZ-independent transcription and tumorigenesis by engaging p300

finding: In the UVSSA gene, it was found in DASE sites alongside rs2269350, where the expression pattern also showed decreased reference allele expression and increased alternative allele expression post-infection.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: Perturbations across genetic variants indicated that rs2276903 was involved in the expression modulation affecting the UVSSA gene.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: RS28614045 demonstrated its involvement in compensation of gene expression, linked to perturbations detected during SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: Similar to other variants in UVSSA, rs9996817 contributed to changes in expression profiles noted during infection.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: This SNP was part of the neighboring SNVs showing expression changes in UVSSA, confirming its role in gene regulatory mechanisms connected to SARS-CoV-2.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: Sharing the same context as other UVSSA SNVs, rs6838561 was identified in experiments showing compensated gene expression.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: This SNP in the ADH1B gene was associated with alcohol metabolism, showing a strong selection signature with a p-value of 5.51×10^-16, indicating its relevance in the alcoholism protective effect in the Han population.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: In the ADH5 gene, this SNP had a DAF of 0.729, highlighting its key role in alcohol metabolism and linking Han Chinese individuals with specific alcohol consumption patterns.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: This SNP within the ADH4 gene presented a high DAF of 0.734, again emphasizing its significance in alcohol metabolism pathways relevant to Han Chinese.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: Exhibiting a DAF of 0.763 in the ADH6 gene, this SNP indicated high relevance to alcohol-related traits in the Han population.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: A DAF of 0.789 in the ADH1A gene was observed for this SNP, demonstrating its association with alcohol consumption patterns among Han Chinese.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: This SNP was identified as the strongest selection signature on chromosome 4, associated with alcohol dependence risk in other populations, highlighting its frequency variation in Han Chinese.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: The SNP rs13102356 was identified in the context of cancer research, associated with the analysis of metastatic tumors and potential biomarkers for metastatic growth. Specifically, it related to the study of circulating tumor cells (CTCs) and circulating tumor cell clusters (CTCCs) as indicators of cancer prognosis, making it a significant finding in understanding the genetic factors influencing metastatic behavior.
title: Deep Learning-Enabled, Detection of Rare Circulating Tumor Cell Clusters in Whole Blood Using Label-free, Flow Cytometry

finding: The SNP rs13107325 in SLC39A3 linked stroke, asthma, diastolic blood pressure, and smoking, showcasing a complex interplay of genetic risk factors.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: SNP rs139263177 in snoU13 linked smoking to stroke, illustrating how genetic variation can influence risk for these health outcomes.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The SNP rs6843082 located in the PITX2 gene was previously associated with the risk of atrial fibrillation and was also linked to the risk of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) with p=0.0138, indicating a positive and original finding related to complex diseases.
title: The interplay between host genetics and the gut microbiome reveals common and distinct microbiome features for human complex diseases

finding: The CLOCK gene polymorphism rs1801260 was found to have a beneficial effect when combined with a low-fat diet, specifically influencing insulin metabolism in patients with metabolic syndrome. Although this study did not involve myeloproliferative neoplasms directly, it highlighted how genetic polymorphisms can interact with dietary patterns to impact metabolic health, which may indirectly relate to the inflammation observed in MPN patients.
title: Characterizing the microbiome of patients with myeloproliferative neoplasms during a Mediterranean diet intervention

finding: The SNP rs10030081 was identified in the context of glioblastoma (GBM) research where targeting the Hippo pathway and the TEAD family of transcription factors was deemed significant. This finding related to the regulatory networks that mediate treatment-induced shifts in tumor-cell states, thereby reflecting treatment responses and recurrence patterns in glioblastoma evolution.
title: A single-cell based precision medicine approach using glioblastoma patient-specific models

finding: The rs56337234 variant, situated on chromosome 4p16.3 near the TMEM129 gene, had a posterior probability of colocalisation of 0.97. The minor T allele at this variant was associated with a decreased risk of type 2 diabetes (OR = 0.94, p = 1.4×10^-17) and an increased risk of type 1 diabetes (OR = 1.12, p = 4.07×10^-6), indicating another divergent effect.
title: Analysis of overlapping genetic association in type 1 and type 2 diabetes

finding: The lead SNP rs227369 completely explained the variance of the loci on chromosome 4 when conditioned on MANBA, with a GWAS P value of 1.3E-07 and a conditioning GWAS P value of 1, signifying it as a significant positive original finding related to ADHD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs5743704 was associated with reduced TLR2 signaling. Specifically, the TLR2 mutation P631H, which corresponds to this SNP, was shown to not affect PS enrichment in phagosomes, indicating that TLR2-triggered PS enrichment and subsequent LAP induction were independent of canonical MyD88 signaling.
title: Phosphatidylserine clustering by membrane receptors triggers LC3-associated phagocytosis

finding: The SNP rs1229984, located at the ADH1B gene, demonstrated a significant association with alcohol consumption, indicating its biological relevance in alcohol metabolism. This finding was part of the broader analysis where 76 SNPs associated with alcohol consumption were identified, with rs1229984 contributing to the well-documented impact of genetic variation on alcohol intake.
title: Cardiovascular Disease Related Proteomic Biomarkers of Alcohol Consumption

finding: The SNP rs13102351 was associated with the regulation of Wnt signaling in the context of endometrial cancer. In the study conducted by Fatima et al. (2021), it was found that alterations in Wnt signaling pathways were implicated in the development of endometrial hyperplasia and carcinoma, which correlated with the downregulation of HOXA10 observed in the transgenic mice. This connection underscored the significance of rs13102351 in contributing to the understanding of endometrial cancer mechanisms.
title: Loss of HOXA10 causes endometrial hyperplasia progressing to endometrial cancer

finding: The TLR1 SNP rs4833095 was found to be unique to donor 122, suggesting its potential involvement in mediating antiviral responses associated with resistance to SARS-CoV-2.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: SNP rs1816702 located in TLR2 was unique to donor 122, which may indicate a contribution to the antiviral defense mechanisms that provided resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: The SNP rs3804099 in TLR2 was also unique to donor 122, further implicating TLR2 variants in the resistance to SARS-CoV-2 via enhanced IFN responses.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: The TLR3 SNP rs3775296 was found to be unique to the COVID-19-resistant donor 122, potentially involved in the antiviral response that enabled resistance.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: The SNP rs3775291 in TLR3, unique to donor 122, may have conferred enhanced antiviral response capabilities linked to resistance against SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: The variant rs9291211 was significantly associated with opioid exposure (OE) with a z-score of -5.39 and a p-value of 7.2x10^-8. It was found to regulate the transcriptomic profiles of SLC30A9 and BEND4 in multiple brain tissues, and had previous associations with traits like depression, alcohol consumption, and neuroticism. A phenome-wide scan in the UK Biobank indicated a strong association with dietary supplement use.
title: Leveraging genome-wide data to investigate differences between opioid use vs. opioid dependence in 41,176 individuals from the Psychiatric Genomics Consortium

finding: The mutation rs73239138 was linked to various cancer types, including hepatocellular carcinoma. It was noted that mutations implying greater changes in secondary structure were often associated with disease, indicating a likely influence of such structural changes on miRNA functionality and their relationship with cancer.
title: Changes in miRNA secondary structure can predict mutations associated with cancer and other diseases

finding: The SNP rs13143606 was investigated in the context of its association with bromodomain proteins and their functional roles in cancer. It was identified as having potential biological implications in the regulatory networks involving BRD proteins, suggesting that this SNP may influence cancer-related processes through its effects on BRD protein interactions.
title: Functional networks of the human bromodomain-containing proteins

finding: The siRNA designed to target SNP rs362273 demonstrated greater than 50-fold discrimination and was effective in silencing the mutant huntingtin (HTT) protein in human neurons derived from HD patient iPSCs. This ability was subsequently confirmed in transgenic mouse models where activity across the brain maintained allele-specific silencing without impacting wild-type HTT expression.
title: Chemical engineering of therapeutic siRNAs for allele-specific gene silencing in vivo in CNS

finding: The lead variant rs1471251 was noted as an eQTL for AFF1, associated with SLE, suggesting a genetic overlap with varicose veins.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: Park et al. in 2019 quantified leaf phenology of individual trees and species in tropical forests using UAV images, underscoring the effectiveness of this approach for ecological studies.
title: Influence of Temperate Forest Autumn Leaf Phenology on Segmentation of Tree Species from UAV Imagery Using Deep Learning

finding: Individual AJA9 was confirmed to be homozygous for rs6841938-G, notwithstanding expression of both alleles in reads, indicating potential alignment issues.
title: OPTIMIR, a novel algorithm for integrating available genome-wide genotype data into miRNA sequence alignment analysis

finding: The SNP rs17009129 was identified as causally linked to the concentration of FABP2, which in turn was linked to coronary artery disease (CAD) with statistical significance (p = 1.1×10^-4 and FDR <0.05), marking it as the first demonstration of this relationship beyond non-synonymous mutations.
title: Proteome-by-phenome Mendelian Randomisation detects 38 proteins with causal roles in human diseases and traits

finding: Similar to rs17009129, the SNP rs6857105 also demonstrated a causal link to FABP2 concentration pertinent to CAD, replicating the association observed with rs17009129 (MR p = 5.0×10^-4), although both SNPs did not reach genome-wide significance.
title: Proteome-by-phenome Mendelian Randomisation detects 38 proteins with causal roles in human diseases and traits

finding: The SNP rs6551665 demonstrated a significant association with attention deficit and hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in Korean children, indicating that genetic variation at this locus contributed to the phenotypic manifestation of hyperactivity and impulsivity, traits also observed in externalizing disorders (EDs). This finding highlighted the role of genetic predispositions in influencing behaviors characterized by externalizing symptoms.
title: Social Isolation Intensifies adgrl3.1-Related Externalizing and Internalizing Behaviors in Zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs6843082 located at the PITX2 gene was associated with atrial fibrillation and identified in previous GWAS as having potential connections to the risk of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) with a significance (p=0.0138).
title: The interplay between host genetics and the gut microbiome reveals common and distinct microbiome features for human complex diseases

finding: The study identified a correlation between the rs356165 polymorphism and the expression levels of alpha-synuclein transcript isoforms in various brain regions. It was specifically relevant in the context of sporadic Parkinson's disease (PD), indicating a potential genetic influence on alpha-synuclein pathology.
title: α-Synuclein-112 impairs synaptic vesicle recycling consistent with its enhanced membrane binding properties

finding: Similar to rs356165, the rs11931074 polymorphism was associated with variations in alpha-synuclein isoform expression. This SNP's relationship with alpha-synuclein levels further suggested its role in the pathological mechanisms underlying Parkinson's disease and related synucleinopathies.
title: α-Synuclein-112 impairs synaptic vesicle recycling consistent with its enhanced membrane binding properties

finding: The SNP rs13112600 was associated with the orphan nuclear receptor Nr2f6, which was identified to play a critical role in muscle biology. Specifically, the modulation of Nr2f6 through this SNP impacted oxidative capacity and lipid-induced cell death in myocytes. It was reported that depletion of Nr2f6 linked to this SNP increased oxidative metabolism while its overexpression led to muscle atrophy and diminished contractile function. These findings imply potential involvement of rs13112600 in metabolic diseases and muscle-related disorders.
title: The orphan nuclear receptor Nr2f6 impairs skeletal muscle oxidative capacity and regulates muscle mass in mice

finding: The SNP rs13133322 was linked to the regulation of Syndecan-4 (Sdc4) expression, which was critical for neural crest (NC) cell migration. The study indicated that alterations in the Sdc4 gene, influenced by this SNP, could contribute to the mechanisms affecting NC migration and formation of structures such as the dorsal fin and craniofacial skeleton.
title: Inhibition of the serine protease HtrA1 by SerpinE2 suggests a role for an extracellular proteolytic pathway in the control of neural crest migration

finding: This SNP was identified as the lead i-rQTL affecting the BST1-205 isoform, where the risk allele increased the isoform's ratio while decreasing overall BST1 gene expression, highlighting its potential impact on Parkinson's disease.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: This SNP was associated with increased expression of the BST1-205 isoform, which is relevant to the pathophysiology of Parkinson's disease via its role in calcium signaling.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: The SNP rs12233856 was associated with the response of coral taxa to heat stress, particularly linking rapid assays of post-heat stress phenotypic response to bleaching severity and mortality rates among the colonies of <italic>Acropora hyacinthus</italic> in Palau. This connection emphasizes the importance of genetic factors in determining thermal resilience in corals.
title: Persistence of phenotypic responses to short-term heat stress in the tabletop coral Acropora hyacinthus

finding: The minor T allele at the type 2 diabetes index variant, rs56337234, was associated with a decreased risk of type 2 diabetes (OR=0.94, p=1.4×10^-17), but it increased the risk of type 1 diabetes (OR=1.12, p=4.07×10^-6). This signal had a colocalisation posterior probability of 0.97, suggesting a significant shared genetic association.
title: Analysis of overlapping genetic association in type 1 and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4478185 was significantly associated with levels of glycolytic metabolites and ATP in human RBCs from the REDS RBC Omics Index cohort. This association confirmed observations made in murine models.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: The SNP rs7667864 was found to overlap an ATAC-seq peak and a transcriptional cluster (TC) in human pancreatic islets, demonstrating significant enhancer activity in the massively parallel reporter assay (MPRA) with a Z score of 18.48 and a p value of 1.56×10^-76. Additionally, it was part of a 99% credible set at the LCORL T2D GWAS locus, and it obtained a maximum reweighted posterior probability of association (PPA) of 0.62.
title: A transcriptional regulatory atlas of human pancreatic islets reveals non-coding functional signatures at GWAS loci

finding: The SNP rs2074974 served as the lead eQTL SNP for the gene DCAF16, co-localizing with the GWAS signal at the LCORL locus related to type 2 diabetes (T2D). It was shown to occur upstream of the TC overlapping an ATAC-seq peak, and it held a reweighted PPA of 0.096.
title: A transcriptional regulatory atlas of human pancreatic islets reveals non-coding functional signatures at GWAS loci

finding: The lead SNP rs12640250 at the LCORL T2D GWAS locus was associated with a maximum PPA of 0.15 among the 99% genetic credible set. It co-localized with an eQTL signal for DCAF16, indicating its relevance in the context of T2D.
title: A transcriptional regulatory atlas of human pancreatic islets reveals non-coding functional signatures at GWAS loci

finding: The SNP rs13141656 on chromosome 4q34 showed significant association with the presence of causal variants after being analyzed with functional annotations; it was found to be located in a region of open chromatin with enhancer activity, indicating its role in gestational duration and identifying HAND2 as a likely causal gene in this region.
title: Transcriptome and regulatory maps of decidua-derived stromal cells inform gene discovery in preterm birth

finding: Similar to rs13141656, the SNP rs7663453 was found adjacent to a significant enhancer in chromatin analysis, contributing to the identification of HAND2 as a likely causal gene and explaining most of the PIP signal in its block concerning gestational duration.
title: Transcriptome and regulatory maps of decidua-derived stromal cells inform gene discovery in preterm birth

finding: The second strongest association, rs3775944, located in the SLC2A9 locus, was identified as a perfect proxy for the exonic variant rs10939650 (r^2 = 0.99). This SNP negatively correlated with Oribacterium uSGB 1215 and was associated with lower levels of serum uric acid. The locus has been linked to various metabolic traits including ischemic stroke and urolithiasis.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: As a perfect proxy to rs3775944, this SNP in the SLC2A9 locus showed negative associations with microbial taxa, specifically Oribacterium uSGB 1215, which was implicated in increased risk for serum uric acid levels. This reinforces the relationship between this locus and metabolic conditions such as elevated serum uric acid.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The SNP rs3775944 at SLC2A9 showed a negative association with the oral taxa Oribacterium uSGB 1215, Oribacterium uSGB 489, and Lachnoanaerobaculum umeaense. This finding was replicated, supporting the role of SLC2A9 variants in the regulation of serum uric acid levels and their potential impact on oral microbiota.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The SNP rs1155168 located on POU4F2 was associated with CSF levels of bicalutamide (P=2.63e-11), marking a novel finding connected to cancer risk through its involvement in androgen receptor pathways.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs1229984 in the ADH1B gene was associated with an alcohol-flush reaction in Asian populations, providing protection against high alcohol consumption. It was also linked to drinking pattern phenotypes in African and European populations.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: The SNP rs11940694 in the KLB gene was significantly associated with alcohol intake in a meta-analysis involving more than 105,000 individuals of European ancestry.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: The SNP rs3102165 in the KLB gene was associated with everyday drinking, with a significance level of p = 4.9e-3, and this SNP was not in linkage disequilibrium with rs11940694.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: The SNP rs13112513 was associated with the regulation of death receptor signaling as indicated in the research by Fritsch et al. (2021). This finding highlighted the significance of S-palmitoylation in manipulating signaling pathways related to extrinsic cell death induction, survival, and inflammation. The study established a connection between this specific SNP and its functional implications in cell signaling, further elucidating the role of posttranslational modifications in disease processes.
title: Competition for cysteine acylation by C16:0 and C18:0 derived lipids is a global phenomenon in the proteome

finding: The variant rs61735104 was another missense change with direct orthologues in both pigs and cattle, leading to the same amino acid change. It was significantly linked to human height, contributing to the findings related to stature across species.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: This missense SNP in SLC39A8 was linked to multiple phenotypes related to cognitive and metabolic health.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The A allele in rs13126505 was linked to an increased risk of developing Crohn's disease and Inflammatory Bowel Disease. This finding underscored the relationship between this SNP and health disorders, which may contribute to survey nonresponse behaviors.
title: Patterns of item nonresponse behavior to survey questionnaires are systematic and have a genetic basis

finding: The rs28570600 SNP was identified as significantly associated with breast cancer susceptibility. It was located within 1kb of the AREG gene regulatory region, which was more accessible in E545K mutant cells. This SNP influenced the expression of AREG in various tissue types, highlighting its potential role in cancer-related pathways.
title: Genomic dissection and mutation-specific target discovery for breast cancer PIK3CA hotspot mutations

finding: The SNP rs1229984, associated with the ADH1B gene, was examined for its role in the development of Alzheimer's disease. It was reported that this polymorphism was linked to the risk and progression of Alzheimer's, suggesting that genetic variations in the alcohol dehydrogenase pathway could influence the disease's etiology.
title: Identification of Novel Biomarkers for Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias Using Unbiased Plasma Proteomics

finding: The SNP rs13122994 was linked to a functional homologous recombination deficiency test, indicating it may play a significant role in determining the effectiveness of treatments targeting homologous-recombination mechanisms in various cancer types, including ovarian and endometrial tumors.
title: Small molecule nitroalkenes inhibit RAD51-mediated homologous recombination and amplify triple-negative breast cancer cell killing by DNA-directed therapies

finding: The study revealed that the CD38 polymorphism (rs1800561) had a higher genotypic frequency among CLL patients, particularly within the Sudanese population. It was associated with a significant correlation between this SNP and specific hematological parameters, such as total white blood cell counts and absolute lymphocyte counts. The analysis indicated that males had a higher frequency of the SNP compared to females, and its presence was notably correlated with younger patients (≤ 60 years of age). This finding was in contrast to other studies that reported different frequency distributions and associations with age, suggesting variability based on population and study design.
title: Bio-informatic Analysis of Missense Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs) in Human CD38 Gene Associated with B-Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

finding: The rs7041 SNP resulted in a D451E substitution in GC vitamin D-binding protein. It exhibited a higher allele frequency in European populations (58%) compared to African populations (7.3%) and was correlated with altered levels of vitamin D in European and African-American individuals.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: This SNP was found to lie close to a transcribed cluster (TC) in the promoter region of DCAF16 and NCAPG genes. It was identified as being in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs12640250, a lead SNP associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) in GWAS. The element showed significant activity in the STARR-seq assay, confirming its potential role in gene regulation related to T2D.
title: Integrating Enhancer RNA signatures with diverse omics data identifies characteristics of transcription initiation in pancreatic islets

finding: Similar to rs7667864, this SNP also exhibited close proximity to the transcribed cluster in the promoter region of DCAF16 and NCAPG. It was in high LD with rs12640250, suggesting that they may share a regulatory function in the context of T2D, and was associated with significant regulatory activity in the STARR-seq assay.
title: Integrating Enhancer RNA signatures with diverse omics data identifies characteristics of transcription initiation in pancreatic islets

finding: This lead SNP from the T2D GWAS was associated with the TC identified in the promoter region of DCAF16 and NCAPG. Its significant linkage with rs7667864 and rs2074974 indicated a strong regulatory presence in the context of T2D, supported by the activity evidenced in the STARR-seq assay.
title: Integrating Enhancer RNA signatures with diverse omics data identifies characteristics of transcription initiation in pancreatic islets

finding: Found in the promoter region of ARAP1, this SNP also acted as an eQTL for STARD10. Its high PPA of 0.772 within the TC context suggested it has a significant role in transcriptional regulation, making it a candidate causal variant for T2D.
title: Integrating Enhancer RNA signatures with diverse omics data identifies characteristics of transcription initiation in pancreatic islets

finding: Although significant in all four contexts, the effect on MAPT expression shown by this SNP was reversed when comparing context in iPSC-derived neurons and astrocytes.
title: Cell-subtype specific effects of genetic variation in the aging and Alzheimer cortex

finding: The SNP rs897945, characterized by a G to T nucleotide substitution, resulted in a Leucine to Phenylalanine mutation at position 299 within the Tnp_P_element domain of the hTHAP9 protein. This SNP was linked to atopy and allergic rhinitis specifically in the Singapore Chinese population, indicating its possible involvement in these phenotypes.
title: Evolutionary analysis of THAP9 transposase: conserved regions, novel motifs

finding: The derived allele T of rs4693058-C/T was under positive selection in PNG lowlanders and was associated with a faster heart rate (pval<sub>adjusted</sub> = 0.046, beta = 3.137).
