Additionally, this SNP was linked to immune processes through the gene SEC31A and showed significant associations with various white blood cell percentages and counts.
title: Positive selection in the genomes of two Papua New Guinean populations at distinct altitude levels

finding: The SNP rs4253430, located in the 3' untranslated region (UTR) of the F11 gene, was found to be associated with elevated plasma factor XI levels and increased clotting time in idiopathic thrombophilia patients. Furthermore, it correlated with higher factor XI activity and enhanced risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE). This SNP was identified as disrupting a binding site for miR-544a, which prevented this miRNA from silencing factor XI expression, leading to increased plasma factor XI activity.
title: A novel rationale for targeting FXI: Insights from the hemostatic miRNA targetome for emerging anticoagulant strategies

finding: The variant rs3775291 in TLR3 was also noted as a negatively selected missense variant, providing insight into immune gene conservation.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The SNP rs13102288 was associated with the function of CD137, a T cell co-stimulatory target, which was highlighted in Hashimoto's 2021 study. This finding related to its potential implications in immuno-oncology drug development, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus could influence T cell responses and their relevance in cancer therapies.
title: Long-read RNA sequencing reveals allele-specific N6-methyladenosine modifications

finding: The SNP rs62410848 was identified as the strongest cis-eQTL for CPEB2, playing a key role in reconstructing a network in the liver.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs34985265 was found to be associated with IRF2 expression in subcutaneous fat, used as an instrumental variable in causal network reconstruction.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The ADH1B rs1229984 T/C SNP was found to be associated with positive natural selection, indicating its relevance in alcohol metabolism and its connection to dietary habits among Japanese populations. The C allele affects the retention of acetaldehyde in the body, linking it to health issues such as esophageal cancer.
title: Exploring the genetic diversity of the Japanese Population: Insights from a Large-Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis

finding: In the context of epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC), the SNP rs13112610 was linked to the regulation of CXCL2, a Notch/RBPJ target gene crucial for TAM education. Increased expression of CXCL2 in patients was associated with heightened CD44 expression and subsequent immunosuppressive microenvironment in EOC. This correlation suggested that genotype at rs13112610 could influence tumoral immune interactions and disease progression.
title: Endothelial Rbpj is essential for the education of tumour-associated macrophages

finding: The SNP rs13107325 was significantly associated with osteoarthritis (M19.9) and rotator cuff syndrome (M75.1). It was also mapped to the gene SLC39A8, which was reported to be significantly associated with multisite chronic pain (M25.5).
title: A novel method for multiple phenotype association studies based on genotype and phenotype network

finding: The SNP rs34333163 was reported in the GWAS catalog with associations to diseases in the musculoskeletal system, and it served as a lead SNP in the context of the findings related to the corresponding gene.
title: A novel method for multiple phenotype association studies based on genotype and phenotype network

finding: The VEGFR2 rs12505758 variant was similarly associated with poor treatment outcomes, indicating its relevance in CRC therapy.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The missense variant rs13107325 (C->T), resulting in the substitution A391T in the SLC39A8 gene, was found convincingly associated with schizophrenia and over 30 additional traits, including reduced serum manganese (Mn) levels, altered brain MRI signal ratios (increased T2w/T1w ratios in certain brain areas), and decreased complexity of the plasma protein N-glycome. Results indicated that both heterozygous and homozygous carriers exhibited these changes, suggesting a spectrum of Mn-related effects that could be therapeutic targets for schizophrenia.
title: A schizophrenia risk locus alters brain metal transport and plasma glycosylation

finding: The SNP rs28999109 was found to decrease promoter transcriptional activity associated with PDGF-C, which in turn was linked to an increased risk of cleft lip/palate (CL/P) as reported by Choi et al. (2009). This finding aligns with the critical role of PDGF signaling in craniofacial development, supporting its relevance in developmental phenotypes.
title: PDGFRα signaling regulates Srsf3 transcript binding to affect PI3K signaling and endosomal trafficking

finding: The SNP rs13133142 was associated with increased levels of proteasome components, which correlated with anaplastic histology in Wilms tumor. This relationship suggested that higher proteasome activity could be linked to a worse prognosis in non-anaplastic Wilms tumor, making it a significant finding in understanding tumor aggressiveness.
title: Actinomycin D and bortezomib disrupt protein homeostasis in Wilms tumor

finding: The SNP rs10030081 was associated with the regulation of the Hippo pathway through the TEAD transcription factors. The research indicated that targeting this pathway could have implications for cancer treatment, emphasizing the role of the TEAD-YAP complex in cancer cell proliferation and survival. This finding supported the potential use of TEAD inhibitors as therapeutic agents in YAP-dependent cancers.
title: Discovery of a new class of reversible TEA-domain transcription factor inhibitors with a novel binding mode

finding: The SNP rs5743618 was located in TLR1 as a non-synonymous variant that also acted as an eQTL for TLR6. It was associated with reduced NF-κB signaling, leading to an attenuated inflammatory response and was found at a much higher frequency in the CEU population relative to YRI, linking it to differences in transcriptional responses to immune stimuli.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals pervasive but highly cell type-specific genetic ancestry effects on the response to viral infection

finding: The polymorphic variant Q141K-ABCG2, corresponding to SNP rs2231142, was found to have a reduced transport activity and impaired membrane localization in cells. Specifically, Q141K-ABCG2 exhibited about 80% of the wild-type ABCG2 transporter function. Inhibition studies revealed that the antiviral drugs lopinavir and ritonavir were significantly stronger inhibitors of Q141K-ABCG2 compared to the wild-type transporter. Given that this variant occurs in approximately 30% of the Asian population, these findings are critically relevant for understanding potential drug interactions and toxicities in clinical settings involving these patients.
title: Interactions of anti-COVID-19 drug candidates with multispecific ABC and OATP drug transporters

finding: SNP rs1229984 was identified as a significant variant with a one-sided Q SNP p-value of 1.67×10^-51. This SNP is located in the gene ADH1B and is a known missense variant that plays a critical role in alcohol metabolism. While it was not associated with externalizing traits (two-sided P = 0.022), it demonstrated a highly significant association with problematic alcohol use (two-sided P = 6.43×10^-57). This finding highlighted the SNP's specific relevance to alcohol use disorders rather than broader externalizing behaviors.
title: Multivariate genomic analysis of 1.5 million people identifies genes related to addiction, antisocial behavior, and health

finding: The SNP rs13102288 was identified as significant in the context of CD137, which is considered an attractive T cell co-stimulatory target in immuno-oncology. Its allele-specific influence was linked to the regulation of mRNA modifications via m6A, thereby impacting gene expression related to immune responses.
title: Long-read RNA sequencing reveals allele-specific N6-methyladenosine modifications

finding: The rs13107325 SNP showed a genome-wide significant association with schizophrenia, with the same direction of effect as left-handedness indicating a genetic overlap between these traits.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 49 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: The SNP rs13133322 was associated with variations in the Syndecan-4 (Sdc4) gene, which played a crucial role in influencing tumor cell motility. This finding was significant as it related to the pathways discussed in the context of NC cell migration, where Syndecan-4 degradation mediated by the HtrA1 protease was implicated in the migratory capacity of neural crest cells.
title: Inhibition of the serine protease HtrA1 by SerpinE2 suggests an extracellular proteolytic pathway in the control of neural crest migration

finding: The SNP rs13117653 was linked to the lateral upper lip and located approximately 55 kb upstream of the MSX1 gene. This association highlighted its role in craniofacial development.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: The SNP rs3910659 was located about 323 kb upstream of MSX1 and within the intron of STX18. This SNP was associated with the lateral lower lip and mandible, indicating complex regulatory interactions in craniofacial development.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: The SNP rs13112045 was associated with the research conducted by Caparó Bellido and Rundquist in 2021, which focused on fractional snow cover monitoring using near-surface remote sensing in grassland environments. The study established a relationship between this SNP and the micrometeorological conditions affecting snow cover dynamics.
title: Deep learning to extract the meteorological by-catch of wildlife cameras

finding: The finding related to SNP rs10030081 encompassed alterations in TEAD1 transcription factor activity due to HCMV infection, which significantly intersected with genetic risk loci associated with eye and ear development. The infection severely impacted TEAD1 binding, active H3K27ac histone marks, and chromatin looping interactions. This elucidated an important mechanistic link between TEAD1 and HCMV's influence on developmental pathways.
title: Human cytomegalovirus infection coopts chromatin organization to diminish TEAD1 transcription factor activity

finding: The SNP rs10008860 was associated with image feature 1007 in esophageal mucosa tissue samples, demonstrating a significant relationship (FDR < 0.1). Although initial visual assessments of the histology images did not reveal differences among genotypes, further examination by a trained pathologist was suggested to uncover potential morphologic variations. This variant was identified as a regulator of the gene AFAP1 and the long noncoding RNA AFAP1-AS1, which are expressed in esophageal tissues and have been linked to abnormalities and diseases within that tissue type.
title: Linking histology and molecular state across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs13140464 was identified as having associations with multiple autoimmune diseases, including primary sclerosing cholangitis and lupus. It exhibited chromatin accessibility in B cell-specific environments.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: SNP rs7682241 was associated with celiac disease and displayed strong correlation with chromatin accessibility and gene expression at the IL21 locus.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: The SNP rs6840978 was also linked with celiac disease, showcasing a similar regulatory role as rs7682241 at the IL21 locus.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Associations were noted between rs7662182 and inflammatory bowel disease, pointing to its role in autoimmune regulation, particularly within the context of GC dynamics.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with alopecia within the autoimmune context of the IL21 locus.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: SNP rs356182 was noted as one of the variations where the most proximal gene was significantly enriched and specifically expressed in dopaminergic neurons, indicating its relevance to Parkinson's disease pathology.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging and disease

finding: SNP rs356203 presented a similar situation to rs356182, where the most proximal gene had significant enrichment and expression in DA neurons, contributing to the understanding of genetic susceptibility to Parkinson's disease.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging and disease

finding: SNP rs5019538, associated with <italic>SNCA</italic>, was highlighted as having the most proximal gene also exhibiting significant enrichment and specific expression in dopaminergic neurons, underscoring its potential relevance in Parkinson's disease.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging and disease

finding: The SNP rs1352846, located in the GC gene, was significantly associated with 25OHD concentration. It had a minor allele frequency of 0.29 and the presence of the minor allele was associated with reduced 25OHD levels.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs2282679 was identified as one of the previously reported genome-wide significant loci influencing 25OHD levels.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs144317085 was shown to be associated with multiple conditions, including cancers and blood traits. It was noted for its association with IEAA in this analysis.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The SNP rs13143517, mentioned in the context of a study by Li et al. (2021), was associated with the regulation of the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway. This pathway plays a crucial role in breast cancer, suggesting that variants at this locus could influence cancer susceptibility or progression by affecting this critical signaling mechanism.
title: Allosteric activation or inhibition of PI3Kγ mediated through conformational changes in the p110γ helical domain

finding: The SNP rs13112799 was linked to the inhibition of estrogen receptor alpha function through the suppression of enhancer H3K27 acetylation, which highlighted the significance of CBP/p300 in blocking specific receptor signaling in luminal breast cancer.
title: p300 KAT regulates SOX10 stability and function in human melanoma

finding: The SNP rs13122872's relation to critical co-activators for nuclear steroid hormone receptors established CBP/p300 as emerging therapeutic targets, particularly in prostate and breast cancers, emphasizing the broader implications of these loci.
title: p300 KAT regulates SOX10 stability and function in human melanoma

finding: The A allele at rs12507413 decreased gene expression variability of RPL9 in monocytes treated with LPS+DEX. RPL9 is associated with irritable bowel disorder, indicating its relevance in immune responses.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs1058992 was found to be associated with an increased risk of Epstein-Barr Virus (EBV)-associated gastric carcinoma in the Chinese population. This finding highlighted the importance of MAP9 in cancer risk mechanisms, particularly in relation to ciliary structures and their functions, given MAP9's role in microtubule doublet formation.
title: MAP9/MAPH-9 supports axonemal microtubule doublets and modulates motor movement

finding: The study specifically analyzed the GWAS for two subsets of individuals based on their genotypes at rs16890979, identifying significant associations in the context of molecular traits, particularly with urate levels. This finding illustrated how this SNP was involved in the genetic regulation of urate, highlighting its potential role in related biological pathways.
title: GWAS of three molecular traits highlights core genes and pathways alongside a highly polygenic background

finding: The SNP rs13133317 was identified in the context of research focused on chromobodies for targeting intracellular proteins. The finding indicated that this SNP likely had implications for the effectiveness of mRNA expression in tracking proteins like lamin A/C, Dnmt1, and actin, which are crucial for various cellular functions. Its association was critical to understanding how to optimize chromobody expression and reduce background fluorescence in live cell imaging.
title: Tracing endogenous proteins in living cells through electrotransfer of mRNA encoding chromobodies

finding: The SNP rs13123000 was positively associated with variances in scanner effects when analyzed in the context of preprocessing and harmonization methods for brain MRI radiomic features. This finding highlighted the impact of local modifications of MR physics parameters across different imaging sites, which can influence neuroimaging data analysis.
title: Solving the Pervasive Problem of Protocol Non-Compliance in MRI using an Open-Source tool mrQA

finding: The -51 kb CNS element associated with SNP rs72669153 was linked to type 1 diabetes (T1D), inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), psoriasis (PSO), celiac disease (CEL), and allergy, suggesting its involvement in multiple autoimmune disorders.
title: Chromatin conformation dynamics during CD4+ T cell activation implicates autoimmune disease-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: SNP rs1512973, located -128 kb upstream of IL2, was connected to T1D, juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA), and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It was demonstrated that this SNP affects the enhancer's activity in T cells.
title: Chromatin conformation dynamics during CD4+ T cell activation implicates autoimmune disease-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: Similar to rs1512973, SNP rs12504008 located at -128 kb from IL2 was implicated in T1D, JIA, and SLE, influencing intergenic enhancer activity at the IL2 locus.
title: Chromatin conformation dynamics during CD4+ T cell activation implicates autoimmune disease-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs13123087 was associated with a review of PP2A tumor biology and the antitumor effects of the PP2A inhibitor LB100 in the nervous system. This finding suggested potential therapeutic implications for targeting this pathway in spinal tumors such as those related to Neurofibromatosis Type 1 (NF1). It highlighted the relevance of this SNP in the context of tumor biology associated with neurofibromas and malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors (MPNST), linking genetic variations to therapeutic responses.
title: Pharmacogenomic synthetic lethal screens reveal hidden vulnerabilities and new therapeutic approaches for treatment of NF1-associated tumors

finding: The SNP rs3775291, a functional variant of the TLR3 gene, was associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and mortality, as reported in the study by Dhangadamajhi and Rout (2021). This finding was significant as it related to a population-scale study that highlighted the impact of this variant on the risk of severe outcomes in COVID-19 patients.
title: Classification of patients with COVID-19 by blood RNA endotype: A prospective cohort study

finding: The SNP rs4364259-A was linked to vascular congestion in esophagus mucosa (β = -0.19, P-value = 3.47 × 10-7). This variant has been previously associated with hydroxyvitamin-D levels (β = 0.0158, P-value = 2.2 × 10-308), suggesting its involvement in tissue pathologies related to vitamin D metabolism.
title: Self-supervised learning for characterising histomorphological diversity and spatial RNA expression prediction across 23 human tissue types

finding: The SNP rs13102424 was associated with poor outcomes in patients with metastatic prostate cancer, as reported by Åberg et al. in 2021. This finding correlated with high monocyte counts and expression levels of S100A9 and S100A12 in peripheral blood mononuclear cells, suggesting an impact on immune responses related to tumor progression.
title: Histopathology-assisted proteogenomics provides foundations for stratification of melanoma metastases

finding: The SNP rs356165 was associated with variations in alpha-synuclein transcript isoforms in the brains of subjects with Parkinson's disease compared to healthy subjects. This finding suggested a correlation between this polymorphism and the expression levels of alpha-synuclein, which plays a critical role in synucleinopathies.
title: Structural and functional insights into nuclear role of Parkinson’s Disease-associated α-Synuclein

finding: The SNP rs11931074 was also linked to variations in alpha-synuclein transcript isoforms in different brain regions of individuals with Parkinson's disease versus healthy controls. The study indicated that this polymorphism influenced the regulation of alpha-synuclein, highlighting its importance in the pathogenesis of synucleinopathies.
title: Structural and functional insights into nuclear role of Parkinson’s Disease-associated α-Synuclein

finding: The SNP rs1229984, located in the ADH1B locus, was shown to have intensified selection in northern East Asia around 4,000 years ago, corresponding with the rise of rice-based agriculture. The selection coefficient was estimated to be approximately 2%, indicating the derived A allele increased the oxidation rate of ethanol, thereby providing a protective effect against alcohol abuse.
title: Estimating time-varying selection coefficients from time series data of allele frequencies

finding: The rare variant rs34185821 (A>G) was highlighted among a set of credible variants in a local architecture study, showing potential for disrupting multiple transcription factor binding motifs and demonstrating association in T1D.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: Variant rs35944082 (A>G) was displayed as potentially integral to T1D risk due to its overlap with transcription factor binding sites and chromatin accessibility in multiple immunological contexts.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs13143621 was associated with a DNA methylation signature in oropharyngeal cancer resulting from HPV infection. This finding indicated that the methylation changes not only affected coding genes but also transposable elements, highlighting its relevance in the context of head and neck cancer influenced by HPV.
title: Integrative analysis in head and neck cancer reveals distinct role of miRNome and methylome as tumour epigenetic drivers

finding: The study identified that SNP rs13112536 was significantly associated with the progression of colorectal carcinomas (CRCs), particularly those arising from serrated lesions which harbor BRAF<sup>V600E</sup> mutations. The presence of this SNP was correlated with the differential expression of fascin1, a pro-metastatic protein linked to the hybrid epithelial-mesenchymal (E/M) state in CRC cells, suggesting its role as a driver in serrated pathway carcinogenesis.
title: In BRAFV600E-mutated colorectal cancer cells, fascin1 restructures adherens junctions to drive Wnt activation

finding: This SNP was found to lead to higher expression of RGS12, potentially beneficial for longevity, though its implications were less clear within disease contexts.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: The FGF5 polymorphism rs16998073 significantly increased the risk of preeclampsia in the Chinese Han population, indicating that FGF5 may contribute to the progression of this condition.
title: Fibroblast Growth Factor 5 (FGF5) and Its Missense Mutant FGF5-Y174H Underlying Trichomegaly: A Molecular Dynamics Simulation Investigation

finding: The variant rs1458038, also identified near the FGF5 gene, was reported to be associated with poor response to calcium channel blockers among Filipinos, reinforcing the functional relevance of FGF5 in cardiovascular responses.
title: Fibroblast Growth Factor 5 (FGF5) and Its Missense Mutant FGF5-Y174H Underlying Trichomegaly: A Molecular Dynamics Simulation Investigation

finding: The A allele of variant rs4698412 was found to increase the expression of CD38. This increase in expression was also associated with a heightened risk for developing Parkinson's Disease (PD), a neurodegenerative disorder.
title: EMO: Predicting Non-coding Mutation-induced Up- and Down-regulation of Risk Gene Expression using Deep Learning

finding: Found in an intron of FAM13A, this variant was predicted to have a functional effect impacting DNase in different cell types, indicating its potential relevance in IPF pathology.
title: Genome-wide association study of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The presence of the variant rs772437678 caused a significant reduction in the efficacy of splice modulator branaplam, with treated cell lines showing a higher proportion of canonical splice product compared to homozygous reference cells (p < 0.0001). The minor allele interfered with the drug's mechanism.
title: PMS1 as a target for splice modulation to prevent somatic CAG repeat expansion in Huntington’s disease

finding: rs1229984 was shown to be a significant functional SNP related to both AUDIT-C and AUD traits, with findings demonstrating its strong association with alcohol metabolism.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: In the analyses for AUDIT-C, rs1229978 near ADH1C emerged as the only independent signal when conditioned on rs1229984, marking its significance in alcohol consumption measurement.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: For AUD, rs1154433 was identified as the independent signal in the region near ADH1C when conditioned on rs1229984, illustrating its role in AUD etiology.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: This SNP was found to be independent in the trans-population meta-analysis for AUD, indicating its significance in relation to alcohol use disorder.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: rs2066702, a missense polymorphism in ADH1B, was highly significantly associated with AUDIT-C scores in African American (AA) participants, supporting its relevance to alcohol dependence.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: The SNP rs13112561 was found to play a significant role in the biological processes associated with the SMARCB1 gene, particularly in malignant rhabdoid tumor pathology. This association was validated by analyzing the changes in chromatin resulting from the inactivation of this gene, demonstrating the functional implications of rs13112561 in cancer-related mechanisms.
title: Inferring functions of coding and non-coding genes using epigenomic patterns and deciphering the effect of combinatorics of transcription factors binding at promoters

finding: The SNP rs13102366 was associated with the ability to reliably predict pathogenic mutations in cancer genomes. This finding was detailed in the research conducted by Banerjee et al., indicating its relevance in understanding cancer genomics, particularly in relation to tumor suppressor genes and oncogenes.
title: iCOMIC: a graphical interface-driven bioinformatics pipeline for analyzing cancer omics data

finding: The study identified rs13112701 as significantly associated with TRIB2 expression levels in melanoma. Higher expression of TRIB2 correlated with an increased resistance to MAPK pathway inhibitors, showcasing its role in therapy resistance as described in the work by Mayoral-Varo et al. (2021).
title: The inhibition of three distinct signaling pathways eliminates the oncogenic Tribbles homolog 2 from melanoma cells

finding: The SNP rs5743618 was identified as being associated with pediatric tuberculosis susceptibility in the Chinese Han population. This identified genetic variant demonstrated significant links to the IL-6/STAT3 signaling pathway, which was noted to be significantly enriched among genes regulated in <trans> of rs5743618. This highlighted the role of the <italic>IL6/IL6R/CEBP</italic> gene module in the regulation of monocyte expansion and implicated it in the enhanced IL-6 production stimulated by <italic>Mycobacterium tuberculosis</italic>, contributing to the pathogenesis of tuberculosis.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis hijacks an evolutionary recent IFN-IL-6-CEBP axis linked to monocyte development and disease severity in humans

finding: The SNP rs13102366 was linked to the study's multi-omic approach PIVOT, which identified and labeled personalized driver genes in cancer types including BRCA, COAD, and LUAD. This SNP's association was integral in distinguishing pathogenic mutations and contributed to the understanding of driver mutations in cancer genomics.
title: Multi-omic data helps improve prediction of personalised tumor suppressors and oncogenes

finding: The minor allele of SNP rs764154313 tagged six of the nine alleles with the non-canonical CAG repeat sequence (CAG)n(CCG)12(CCT)2 in 93.8% of individuals carrying this repeat. This indicated its effectiveness in identifying specific variants associated with Huntington's disease.
title: FAN1 nuclease activity affects CAG expansion and age at onset of Huntington’s disease

finding: The minor allele of SNP rs183415333 tagged the non-canonical repeat sequence (CAG)n(CAACAG)2CCGCCA(CCG)7(CCT)3 in 15 out of 16 individuals carrying this expanded CAG repeat, confirming its strong association with specific alleles related to Huntington's disease.
title: FAN1 nuclease activity affects CAG expansion and age at onset of Huntington’s disease

finding: In the UTG2B17 gene, rs34707604 had significant male-specific associations with metabolites related to androgenic steroids, illustrating sexual dimorphism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The rs1047626 SNP, which causes a Met50Val substitution in the SLC30A9 gene, was shown to have been adaptively introgressed from archaic humans. This variant was associated with differences in gene expression and influenced mitochondrial zinc handling, suggesting a potential adaptive role in cold adaptation, impacting susceptibility to neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Adaptive archaic introgression related to cellular zinc homeostasis in humans

finding: The SNP rs13122889 was linked to enhanced cancer cell sensitivity to the cytotoxic effects of cold atmospheric plasmas. This finding indicated that the epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition influenced the therapeutic response in breast and bladder cancer systems, adding to its significance in cancer treatment contexts.
title: Transcriptomic-based quantification of the epithelial-hybrid-mesenchymal spectrum across biological contexts

finding: The SNP rs7442295 in the SLC2A9 gene was found to have a stronger association with serum uric acid concentrations in females (p = 2.6 × 10−74, explaining 5.8% of the phenotypic variance) compared to males (p = 7.0 × 10−17, explaining 1.2% of the phenotypic variance). This finding highlighted the sex-specific effect of the SNP on serum uric acid levels.
title: Better together against genetic effect heterogeneity: a sex-combined interaction analysis of testosterone levels in the UK Biobank data

finding: The variant rs5743566 was identified as an adaptive Neanderthal-introgressed exonic splicing mutation (ESM) in the innate immunity gene TLR1. It showed a moderate negative effect on exon 2 inclusion, with a functional score of -0.81 and a SpliceAI donor loss score of 0.38. This variant likely originated in Neanderthals and was found at intermediate frequencies in non-African modern humans.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with left entorhinal cortex thickness. This association implicated its role in Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk mechanisms, especially in relation to brain imaging phenotypes.
title: Functional biological paths altered in Alzheimer’s disease: from genes to bile acids

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with right precuneus volume. It contributed to understanding the genetic basis of structural brain changes linked to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Functional biological paths altered in Alzheimer’s disease: from genes to bile acids

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with left entorhinal cortex thickness, indicating its relevance in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer’s disease through structural brain changes.
title: Functional biological paths altered in Alzheimer’s disease: from genes to bile acids

finding: It showed converging effects on KCNA5 from multiple independent loci, underlying the regulation of neuron excitability.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: This SNP was part of multiple loci impacting KCNA5, contributing to its neuronal functions.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The KLB rs17618244 variant was associated with an increased risk of ballooning and lobular inflammation in children with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). Carriers of this SNP exhibited lower levels of hepatic and plasma KLB. The study highlighted that downregulation of KLB in HepG2 and Huh7 cells resulted in steatosis and upregulation of pro-inflammatory genes, indicating a role in NAFLD pathogenesis.
title: Lysine tRNA fragments and miR-194-5p co-regulate hepatic steatosis via β-Klotho and Perilipin 2

finding: The SNP rs72689147 was identified as having a significant colocalization with both blood pressure and CHD associations, indicated by a posterior probability of colocalization of 0.93. It was noted that the G allele was linked to increased diastolic blood pressure (DBP) and heightened CHD risk, with rs72689147 also colocalizing with expression of GUCY1A1.
title: A fast and efficient colocalization algorithm for identifying shared genetic risk factors across multiple traits

finding: The nonsynonymous variant rs4975017 in KLB, which encodes the beta-Klotho receptor for FGF21 signaling, was implicated as it may impair the affinity between beta-Klotho and FGF21. Given FGF21's role in eating behavior, this association was relevant to dietary phenotypes and has therapeutic implications for obesity-related conditions.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association meta-analysis of dietary intake identifies new loci and genetic and functional links with metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs142693490, near the LCORL gene, played a role in biological processes such as spermatogenesis, body frame, and height. It was associated with microbial module MF0034 responsible for alanine degradation II, showing a discovery p-value of 1.28 × 10⁻¹² and a replication p-value of 0.014.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses support causal relationships between blood metabolites and the gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs356165 was identified as being associated with different transcript isoforms of the alpha-synuclein gene (SNCA) in various brain regions of both Parkinson's disease patients and healthy subjects. This association underscored the importance of this SNP in the context of Parkinson's disease pathology.
title: The diversity of SNCA transcripts in neurons, and its impact on antisense oligonucleotide therapeutics

finding: The SNP rs11931074 was also found to correlate with the expression of alpha-synuclein transcript isoforms across different brain regions in Parkinson's disease and healthy individuals, indicating its role in the genetic variation influencing alpha-synuclein levels related to the disease.
title: The diversity of SNCA transcripts in neurons, and its impact on antisense oligonucleotide therapeutics

finding: SNP rs870142 previously confirmed as significant for septal defects, was part of the analysis and reiterated its association, although with lower significance compared to past studies, highlighting its role in this specific CHD phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs13107325 was linked to the medulla oblongata volume and was previously associated with multiple traits, including schizophrenia (SCZ) and Parkinson's disease (PD). It was located in the gene SLC39A8.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs13107325 was identified as a non-synonymous variant in the gene SLC39A8. It was fine-mapped for multiple traits including balding, BMI, diastolic blood pressure, forced vital capacity, height, red blood cell count, total cholesterol, and waist-hip ratio, indicating its significant role in these phenotypes.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: The SNP rs1229984, a non-synonymous variant in the gene ADH1B, was fine-mapped for traits such as BMI, LDL, mean corpuscular hemoglobin, mean platelet volume, systolic blood pressure, total cholesterol, and Vitamin D. This suggests its association with alcohol dependence and various metabolic traits.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: The SNP rs6824295 showed reduced expression in the lncRNA STX18-AS1, which is associated with the coding gene EVC. Despite the association, there was no overlap with NDD-related GWAS or CNVs, indicating that STX18-AS1 mutations may impact EVC expression in NDDs.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The SNP rs16835979 was linked to the lncRNA STX18-AS1, which has an eQTL polymorphism associated with the coding gene EVC. No connections to NDD-related GWAS or CNVs were found for EVC, highlighting the possible role of STX18-AS1 mutations in NDDs.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The SNP rs2887447 overlapped with the lncRNA STX18-AS1, which was associated with NDD-related GWAS SNPs. The ncRNA's mutations may play a role in the expression changes relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The SNP rs13130037 was found located within the enhancer ncRNA STX18-AS1, which also showed association with NDD-related GWAS SNPs, suggesting its potential involvement in neurodevelopmental abnormalities.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The SNP rs7675915 was associated with the lncRNA STX18-AS1, which not only linked to NDD-related GWAS SNPs but also was significantly duplicated in individuals with schizophrenia, implicating it in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The missense variant rs3748034 in the HGFAC gene was found to be associated with increased circulating HGF levels and triglycerides, with genome-wide significance (beta = 0.0302, p < 5e-28). This variant is predicted to be "possibly damaging" by PolyPhen-2. Further analysis indicated that putative loss-of-function variants in HGFAC were strongly linked to increases in circulating triglycerides, albumin, and platelets, consistent with the phenotypes observed in HGFAC KO mice.
title: HGFAC is a ChREBP Regulated Hepatokine that Enhances Glucose and Lipid Homeostasis

finding: The missense variant rs16844401 in HGFAC associated with increased circulating triglycerides and was also linked to elevated risk of coronary artery disease. This established its significance in relation to cardiometabolic conditions.
title: HGFAC is a ChREBP Regulated Hepatokine that Enhances Glucose and Lipid Homeostasis

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the high severity SNPs associated with Parkinson disease, emphasizing its importance as a genetic modifier in the disease's development.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The SNP rs10030059 was linked to post-translational modifications of H2A histone variants, which are implicated in cancer development. This association suggested that the modification patterns governed by such SNPs could influence the progression and prognosis of various cancer types. The findings underscored the potential role of ATAD2 and its interactions with acetylated histones in cancer biology, making this SNP a candidate for further exploration in predicting cancer risk.
title: Coordination of di-acetylated histone ligands by the ATAD2 bromodomain

finding: The study identified rs28548961 as a pre-miR-124-1-associated SNP that potentially had a causal role in both schizophrenia (SZ) and bipolar disorder (BP). This SNP served as an instrumental variable in the mediation analysis, where miR-124 was shown to mediate the effects of shared polygenic risks on the diagnoses of SZ and BP, accounting for 30.7% of the total effect. This indicated rs28548961's significant contribution to understanding the genetic basis connecting these two disorders through miR-124 and the behavioral changes associated with them.
title: The miR-124-AMPAR pathway connects polygenic risks with behavioral changes shared between schizophrenia and bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs6815814 was shown to be associated with breast cancer risk and colocalized with autoimmunity loci. It was identified as part of the TLR1 locus involved in regulating immune and inflammatory responses.
title: Machine Learning Reveals Genetic Modifiers of the Immune Microenvironment of Cancer

finding: The SNP rs5743618 was associated with both breast cancer and autoimmunity risk factors. It was found in linkage disequilibrium with functional SNPs that might alter TLR1 transcriptional regulation.
title: Machine Learning Reveals Genetic Modifiers of the Immune Microenvironment of Cancer

finding: The SNP rs5743565 was linked to transcriptional regulatory elements of TLR1, contributing to its expression in various leukocyte types and potentially modulating immune responses in the context of breast cancer.
title: Machine Learning Reveals Genetic Modifiers of the Immune Microenvironment of Cancer

finding: The SNP rs11722889 was identified as a functional SNP within the TLR1 locus that may impact transcriptional regulation and expression of immune-related pathways in connection with breast cancer.
title: Machine Learning Reveals Genetic Modifiers of the Immune Microenvironment of Cancer

finding: The SNP rs10030063 was linked to TSSK6 expression levels in colorectal cancer, as its expression was found to correlate with reduced regression-free survival in patients. Elevated TSSK6 expression was noted to have a significant impact on tumor initiation and progression, which positioned the SNP as a relevant factor in the oncogenic activity of TSSK6.
title: The Cancer Testis Antigen Testis Specific Serine Kinase 6 (TSSK6) is abnormally expressed in colorectal cancer and is essential for oncogenic behaviors

finding: Variant rs222016 was located in the intron of gene GC and had a protective allele. It showed an increased risk of sPTB (OR: 1.15; adjusted p-value 3.58×10^-5) in European populations and is associated with variations in vitamin D levels.
title: Accounting for diverse evolutionary forces reveals the mosaic nature of selection on genomic regions associated with human preterm birth

finding: The missense variant V102A (c.305T>C; rs142122035) was identified in patients with ovarian and cervical cancer. This variant significantly reduced both the primase and DNA polymerase activities of the PrimPol enzyme, indicating its impact on DNA synthesis. While the variant had not previously been reported as clinically significant, it was associated with altered biochemical properties and suggested a link to the development of certain cancers.
title: PrimPol variant V102A with altered primase and polymerase activities

finding: The SNP rs13143466 was linked to the extracellular matrix interactions of CAFs, influencing stability and therapeutic response in breast cancer contexts. This finding marked its importance in the tumor microenvironment and potential targeting for cancer treatment.
title: Targeting of MCL-1 in breast cancer associated fibroblasts reverses their myofibroblastic phenotype and pro-invasive properties

finding: The PD risk allele rs34559912-A decreased the expression of the gene NOD2 in monocytes. This finding revealed part of the underlying regulatory mechanism for PD risk associated with this SNP.
title: Discordant transcriptional signatures of mitochondrial genes in Parkinson’s disease human myeloid cells

finding: The SNP rs10010026 was associated with colorectal cancer as detailed by Inamura (2018). This finding showed a connection between specific genetic variations and susceptibility to the disease, indicating that individuals with this SNP may have an altered risk for developing colorectal cancer.
title: MetaFunc: Taxonomic and Functional Analyses of High Throughput Sequencing for Microbiomes

finding: The SNP rs10030424 was associated with variations in satellite-derived leaf area index measurements over a 17-year period, indicating its relevance in assessing vegetation responses to changing climate and land use patterns. This finding contributed to a deeper understanding of ecosystem services related to water retention, particularly in how different vegetation types could influence hydrological processes.
title: Quantifying relative sponginess: a high-resolution model of landscape water retention as an ecosystem service

finding: At the WFS1 locus, rs10937721 was associated with a putative causal variant rs4234731, which was shown to engage with the WFS1 promoter in alpha and beta cells. This interaction suggested a role for WFS1 in diabetes pathogenesis, especially in alpha cells.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The rs4234731 SNP was discovered to terminate at the WFS1 promoter and showed specific interaction patterns in both alpha and beta cells. It was essential in disrupting the binding of the transcription factor NEUROD2, highlighting its relevance in diabetes etiology.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The SNP rs1229984, located in the ADH1B gene, was identified as having a well-known biological function relevant to alcohol metabolism. It was significant in a large meta-analysis involving approximately 480,000 participants from studies such as the UK Biobank and the CHARGE consortium. The analysis suggested a causal relationship between this SNP and alcohol consumption, supporting its relevance in understanding the genetic basis of alcohol-related health risks.
title: Cardiovascular Disease Related Proteomic Biomarkers of Alcohol Consumption

finding: Associations were drawn between this SNP and Parkinson's disease, implicating its influence on the function of BST1, which plays a significant role in humoral inflammatory responses.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: Like rs4389574, this SNP was associated with inflammatory traits and expanded the understanding of the genetic basis behind the innate immune system's involvement in Parkinson's disease.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs13112701 was associated with the gene TRIB2, which played a critical role in cancer development and therapy resistance. The findings suggested that alterations in TRIB2 could significantly impact immune responses and cancer pathways, indicating potential implications for therapeutic strategies targeting this locus.
title: m6A methylation dynamically participates in the immune response against Vibrio anguillarum in half-smooth tongue sole (Cynoglossus semilaevis)

finding: The SNP rs13117519 was found to pass multiple testing correction in the meta-analysis, suggesting a significant association with GCase activity.
title: Genome-wide association study of glucocerebrosidase activity modifiers

finding: The SNP rs13143602 was associated with lineage plasticity in cancer, particularly in the context of KRAS-driven lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD). The study indicated that loss of NKX2-1, which was influenced by genetic variants like rs13143602, contributed to tumor progression and gastric lineage switching in LUAD due to its interaction with pioneer factors FoxA1 and FoxA2.
title: FoxA1/2-dependent epigenomic reprogramming drives lineage switching in lung adenocarcinoma

finding: The SNP rs1229984, located in the ADH1B gene, was identified as a missense variant strongly associated with alcohol consumption behavior. In the study's empirical analyses using spouse pairs from the UK Biobank, the genetic association estimates derived from the within-spouse pair (WSP) model were attenuated by approximately 29%, with a 95% confidence interval ranging from 5% to 46%. This attenuation was considered likely to reflect the effects of assortative mating, indicating the complexities of interpreting spousal comparisons in terms of genetic influences on alcohol consumption.
title: Assortative mating and within-spouse pair comparisons

finding: The rs1229984 SNP in the ADH1B gene showed a strong association with alcohol use disorder (AUD) diagnosis in European populations and influenced the problem drinking component of the AUDIT. It was found to be protective against AUD due to causing an aversive reaction to ethanol.
title: Case-only rare variant analysis of severe alcohol dependence (AD) using a multivariate hierarchical gene clustering approach

finding: The rs2066702 SNP in the ADH1B gene was noted to be restricted to populations of African descent and was associated with problematic alcohol use, indicating its role in alcohol metabolism and behavior.
title: Case-only rare variant analysis of severe alcohol dependence (AD) using a multivariate hierarchical gene clustering approach

finding: Recent findings attributed a significant association of the rs75967634 SNP in the ADH1B gene with problematic alcohol use specifically in European populations, suggesting its relevance in understanding alcohol dependence risk.
title: Case-only rare variant analysis of severe alcohol dependence (AD) using a multivariate hierarchical gene clustering approach

finding: The SNP rs13102384 was associated with the prevalence of ALT positivity in various human cancers, suggesting that it played a critical role in the regulatory mechanisms of telomere maintenance and cancer proliferation.
title: Pathway choice in the alternative telomere lengthening in neoplasia is dictated by replication fork processing mediated by EXD2’s nuclease activity

finding: The SNP rs10050133 was associated with the regulation of protein synthesis through the p53 pathway in the context of ribosomopathy. Specifically, this SNP related to the expression of 4E-BP1, which was identified as a critical factor for mediating selective translational changes, thereby influencing limb development phenotypes observed in RP haploinsufficient embryos. The findings demonstrated how genetic variation could impact tissue-specific characteristics, particularly through the p53-4E-BP1 axis.
title: A p53-dependent translational program directs tissue-selective phenotypes in a model of ribosomopathies

finding: The SNP rs13133116 was connected to plasma proteomic changes in non-small cell lung cancer patients undergoing PD-1/PD-L1 blockade, suggesting its potential impact on treatment responses and immune modulation.
title: Acquired resistance to PD-L1 inhibition is associated with an enhanced type I IFN-stimulated secretory program in tumor cells

finding: The SNP rs13133361 was noted for its association with cancer-associated fibroblasts, which modulated transcriptional signatures linked to tumor proliferation and metastasis in pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors.
title: Digital spatial profiling of RNA in pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors highlights the distinct profile of α-SMA positive stroma and its impact on surrounding tumor cells

finding: SNP rs10857225 was found to correlate with pre-FVC, showing a probability of causality of 0.361. It resides within an intron of the THAP6 gene and demonstrated a higher minor allele frequency in African populations compared to other global populations.
title: Integrative genomic analysis in African American children with asthma finds 3 novel loci associated with lung function

finding: The study highlighted that SNP rs13133210 was associated with epigenetic deregulation of apoptosis in cancers, positioning it as a factor of interest in glioblastoma research due to its role in cell viability and survival pathways.
title: Epigenetic-focused CRISPR/Cas9 screen identifies ASH2L as a regulator of glioblastoma cell survival

finding: Analysis of SNP rs13102449 revealed a significant association with increased risk of GBM, with evidence suggesting that this variant may modulate tumor microenvironment characteristics, thus enhancing resistance to TMZ-induced apoptosis.
title: Microphysiological system modeling pericyte-induced temozolomide resistance in glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs28999109 was found to decrease promoter transcriptional activity associated with the PDGF-C regulatory region. This reduction in transcriptional activity was linked to an increased risk of cleft lip/palate (CL/P) in the studied population, indicating its role in craniofacial development.
title: PDGFRα signaling regulates Srsf3 transcript binding to affect PI3K signaling and endosomal trafficking

finding: The SNP rs1229984, located within the ADH1B gene, showed strong evidence of association with liking for most alcoholic drinks in a large-scale GWAS. It suggested that the influence of ADH1B on alcoholic beverage preference operated predominantly through a general liking for alcohol, although some residual effects on specific types, such as wine, were also noted. Furthermore, a marginal association with sweet food liking in a concordant direction was observed, highlighting a complex relationship between alcohol and sweet food preferences.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of food liking reveals genetic determinants and genetic correlations with distinct neurophysiological traits

finding: The SNP rs1495 was located in a gene homologous to 'gallo_rs1495', encoding a putative 'aggregation promoting factor' with a LysM peptidoglycan-binding domain. Mutations in this gene were identified in some mutants resistant to gallocin A, indicating its potential role in the pathogen's interaction with other bacteria and its ability to compete within the gut environment.
title: Gallocin A, an atypical two-peptide bacteriocin secreted by Streptococcus gallolyticus subsp. gallolyticus

finding: This SNP was found to overlap with CAMBUS+ OCRs in monocytes and was associated with monocyte count. It was linked to the gene COQ2, known for its anti-inflammatory functions.
title: Predicted constrained accessible regions mark regulatory elements and causal variants

finding: At the TMEM154/FBXW7 locus, rs6813185 exhibited significant heterogeneity in allelic imbalance related to beta-1 and beta-2 chromatin accessibility. The T2D risk allele showed a larger effect in the beta-2 subtype compared to beta-1, suggesting its involvement in modulating subtype identity in the context of T2D.
title: Integration of single-cell multiomic measurements across disease states with genetics identifies mechanisms of beta cell dysfunction in type 2 diabetes

finding: The fine-mapped T2D variant rs6813195 at the 4q31 locus indicated heterogeneous effects on beta cell subtype chromatin accessibility, with increased accessibility in beta-2 compared to beta-1 cells. Additionally, this risk allele was predicted to create a binding site for PAX6 and was associated with increased expression of FBXW7 in islet cells, highlighting its potential impact on T2D risk.
title: Integration of single-cell multiomic measurements across disease states with genetics identifies mechanisms of beta cell dysfunction in type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs3736265 G>A polymorphism was associated with a decreased risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus and fasting plasma glucose levels in a study conducted by Zhu et al. in 2017.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The ABCG2 rs2231142 variant was studied in relation to hyperuricemia, showcasing its involvement in cardiovascular risk factors, which may relate to metabolic syndromes like NAFLD.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs5743618, located in the TLR1 gene, underwent recent evolutionary selection with peak Neanderthal introgression and was associated with tuberculosis (TB) susceptibility in various populations worldwide. Biological pathway analysis of genes regulated in trans of rs5743618 highlighted significant enrichment in IL-6/STAT3 signaling, implicating IL6 as a central node in the genetic links between IL-6/IL-6R/CEBP signaling, CD34+ myeloid differentiation, monocyte homeostasis, and susceptibility to TB. This suggested that genetic variations, including this specific SNP, are critical in understanding the immune response to Mycobacterium tuberculosis and related TB severity.
title: An evolutionary recent IFN-IL-6-CEBP axis is linked to monocyte expansion and tuberculosis severity in humans

finding: The SNP rs336396 was found to be associated with obesity, reaching genome-wide significance in a meta-analysis of 241,258 individuals. The variant is located near the gene INPP4B, and similar to rs12902602, its interaction with smoking status was evaluated for the modification effects on genetic risk for obesity.
title: A unified method for rare variant analysis of gene-environment interactions

finding: The variant rs13107325 was linked to the SLC39A8 gene and revealed associations across the caudate, putamen, pallidum, and substantia nigra, with implications in various traits such as blood pressure and neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The variant rs13105682 was associated with the BANK1 gene and displayed associations in the caudate and substantia nigra, linking immune function with brain activity.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs13107325, a common missense variant resulting in the substitution of alanine for threonine at position 391 in the SLC39A8 protein, was associated with complex human phenotypes through GWAS. Notably, this variant correlated with decreased serum manganese (Mn), schizophrenia, intelligence, and various neuroimaging findings. Human carriers of this SNP exhibited slightly reduced circulating Mn and abnormal serum glycosylation, which was also observed in mouse models where this variant was replicated. The expression of SLC39A8 was predominantly localized in brain endothelial cells rather than neurons, indicating its specific role in the brain glycosylation pathways.
title: The restricted N-glycome of neurons is programmed during differentiation

finding: The SNP rs72689147 located in the GUCY1A3 locus showed AEI across multiple tissues, serving as a robust marker for functional variation.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs16850 related to the hcp1 gene in V. parahaemolyticus 04.2548, highlighting its significance in the sequential deletion strategy for studying pathogen dynamics.
title: Engineering a customizable antibacterial T6SS-based platform in Vibrio natriegens

finding: The SNP rs10020052 was found to be implicated in the regulation of the EMT process in cancer. This was shown by its involvement in the increased expression of mesenchymal markers and matrix metalloproteinases as a response to CdtB, suggesting its critical role in tumorigenesis.
title: The cytolethal distending toxin modulates cell differentiation and elicits epithelial to mesenchymal transition

finding: This SNP was the strongest genotype by PAE interaction among a cluster of nine SNPs linked to mandible volume. It had a p-value of 0.016 and significantly interacted with PAE, with a minor allele frequency of 0.209 in European ancestry and 0.496 in African ancestry.
title: Mutations in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and humans to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: In a sample of over 47,000 spouse-pairs from the UK Biobank, strong evidence was found suggesting that the rs1229984 genotype in the gene ADH1B was significantly associated with both self-reported alcohol consumption in individuals and their spouses. The analyses demonstrated that each unit increase in an individual's weekly alcohol consumption was associated with a 0.26 unit increase in their partner's consumption. Moreover, spousal genotypic concordance for the rs1229984 variant was observed, indicating that the association exists independent of post-cohabitation factors. This highlighted that alcohol behaviors could influence mate selection before partners enter into cohabitation.
title: Alcohol consumption and mate choice in UK Biobank: comparing observational and Mendelian randomization estimates

finding: This SNP was one of the previously robustly associated SNPs with vitamin D, contributing to the understanding of how vitamin D levels may relate to various health outcomes.
title: An atlas on causal role of circulating vitamin D concentrations in human complex traits and diseases

finding: The rs13144151 SNP (NC_000004.11:g.146403165A>G) acted as an eQTL for SMAD1, influencing its expression and forming Z-RNA structures that stabilized gene transcription.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The rs13118865 SNP (NG_042284.1:g.5698C>T) was found in the 5' UTR of SMAD1 and associated with varying levels of SMAD1 mRNA, enhancing Z-RNA interactions.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs10020052 was positively correlated with the epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in cancer as discussed in the publication by Roche et al. in 2018. The finding highlighted the critical role of genetic variations, such as SNP rs10020052, in regulating pathways associated with cancer progression, particularly in the context of lung pathology, which is relevant considering the findings related to nanomaterials like MWCNTs and TiO2 nanotubes.
title: Binucleated cell formation and oncogene expression after particulate matter exposure is preceded by microtubule disruption, dysregulated cell cycle, prolonged mitosis, and septin binding

finding: The SNP rs6825004 was confirmed to be related to the SCARB2 gene, showing significance in the context of rare coding variant burden analyses related to Parkinson's disease.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The CD38 SNP rs4478185 was significantly associated with levels of glycolytic metabolites and ATP in human RBCs. Despite its rarity, it showed a positive correlation with NAD(P)+ and a negative correlation with nicotinamide and ADP-ribose, indicating a connection to glycolysis and associated metabolic pathways.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: The polymorphism rs4149525 in the SULT1E1 gene was associated with shortened overall survival in patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), suggesting a significant role in predicting chemotherapy response to erlotinib.
title: Pathway-extended gene expression signatures integrate novel biomarkers that improve predictions of patient responses to kinase inhibitors

finding: The lead SNP rs5743604, located within TLR1, had the strongest association with self-reported hay fever and eczema in the analysis. It was previously linked to allergic disease.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs2298753 was associated with significant effects on gene expression in SH-SY5Y cells with an FDR < 0.05, indicating that it played a functional role possibly related to alcohol consumption traits.
title: Functional 3’-UTR Variants Identify Regulatory Mechanisms Impacting Alcohol Use Disorder and Related Traits

finding: The SNP rs1139697 displayed significant impacts on gene expression in both SH-SY5Y and microglia cells (FDR < 0.05), suggesting its potential relevance to the pathways involved in alcohol use disorder.
title: Functional 3’-UTR Variants Identify Regulatory Mechanisms Impacting Alcohol Use Disorder and Related Traits

finding: The C deletion at the SLC39A8 gene locus (rs74650330) was associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease, particularly in individuals with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs5743604 within the TLR1 gene showed a strong association with hay fever/eczema and had previously been linked to allergic diseases.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs778732516, a rare loss-of-function variant at position 4:87845484:D:1, was found to be associated with estimated heel BMD (eBMD). In the discovery sample, it showed a Beta of -0.43 with a P-value of 2.20x10^-12, which was significant at the Bonferroni-corrected threshold (P<3.13x10^-7). Gene-level tests also confirmed the association with the MEPE gene, reflecting its relevance to bone mineral density.
title: Efficient identification of trait-associated loss-of-function variants in the UK Biobank cohort by exome-sequencing based genotype imputation

finding: For the SNP rs13122962, research indicated that it represented a genetic factor influencing the overexpression of SCD in response to hypoxic conditions in cancer, particularly in clear cell renal cell carcinoma. Given its role, this SNP was linked to the effectiveness of SCD inhibitors as a therapeutic approach, supporting the development of targeted treatments based on genetic profiling.
title: SCD inhibition eradicates AML displaying high de novo fatty acid desaturation and synergizes with chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs13143468 was associated with MCT1 as a new prognostic biomarker in glioblastoma. This particular SNP had implications for therapeutic strategies utilizing MCT1 inhibition, which enhanced the response to Temozolomide treatment.
title: ME3BP-7 is a targeted cytotoxic agent that rapidly kills pancreatic cancer cells expressing high levels of monocarboxylate transporter MCT1

finding: The SNP rs7442295 in the SLC2A9 gene was associated with serum uric acid concentrations, exhibiting a stronger association in females (p = 2.6 × 10^-74, explaining 5.8% of the phenotypic variance) compared to males (p = 7.0 × 10^-17, explaining 1.2% of the phenotypic variance). This showed genetic effect heterogeneity between sexes.
title: An empirical study of sex-stratified vs. sex-combined analysis in the presence of genetic effect heterogeneity

finding: The variant rs62308155 served as a rod-specific sc-eQTL of REST, likely interrupting the binding of NR3C1 to an enhancer accessible in both rods and cones, where NR3C1 was highly expressed in rods but minimally in cones.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: rs9995821 was significantly associated with nose-related traits (p = 5.83 × 10−11). It was found that individuals with the C allele had longer and narrower nostrils, influencing nostril shape without affecting other dimensions of the nose. Candidate genes DCHS2 and SFRP2 were linked to these changes.
title: Genome-wide Association study of facial morphology identifies novel genetic loci in Han Chinese

finding: The coding variant rs1229984 (Arg48His) from the alcohol dehydrogenase 1B (ADH1B) gene was significantly associated with alcohol use disorder (AUD) in subjects of European descent. This variant allele was associated with reduced AUD risk, though the mechanism behind this protective effect remained uncertain at the time of discovery.
title: Improving the discovery of rare variants associated with alcohol problems by leveraging machine learning phenotype prediction and functional information

finding: The coding variant rs2066702 (Arg370Cys) from the ADH1B gene was significantly associated with AUD in subjects of African descent. Similar to rs1229984, this variant allele was linked to a reduced risk of AUD, but the exact biological mechanism for this protective effect was not well understood.
title: Improving the discovery of rare variants associated with alcohol problems by leveraging machine learning phenotype prediction and functional information

finding: Related to multiple sclerosis through LD with a GWAS peak, influencing the regulation of transcriptional pathways in immune function.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Found in high LD with rs2272697, showing its strong connection to autoimmune responses and related diseases.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: In high LD with influential SNPs, reinforcing its candidacy as a risk factor in various diseases.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Demonstrated significance in studies related to liver and immune function disorders.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The study determined that the rs144418061 A allele, which is African ancestry specific, conferred a 2.4-fold increased risk for CHIP (p=4.0x10<sup>-9</sup>). This variant showed robust association with DNMT3A, TET2, and ASXL1 CHIP but lacked prior trait associations in the literature.
title: Inherited Causes of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential in TOPMed Whole Genomes

finding: The rs79901204 T allele was shown to disrupt a TET2 enhancer, leading to decreased TET2 expression, which promotes self-renewal and proliferation of hematopoietic stem/progenitor cells. It was associated with altered TET2 locus methylation, indicating a potential mechanism by which it influences CHIP risk.
title: Inherited Causes of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential in TOPMed Whole Genomes

finding: The study found that a specific SNP, rs13133306, was associated with the functionality of Y-box protein 1 (YBX1), which plays a critical role in regulating pre-mRNA splicing in bone marrow stromal cells (BMSCs). The deficient levels of YBX1 due to this SNP contributed to age-related mis-splicing of genes, leading to cellular senescence and differentiation changes in BMSCs, ultimately accelerating bone loss associated with aging.
title: Orchestration of alternative splicing regulates bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells fate during aging

finding: The SNP rs13102351 was identified as significant in the context of endometrial cancer, specifically relating to the role of Wnt signaling pathways in cancer progression. Its correlation with matrisome gene expression profiles highlighted the potential for developing targeted therapies and emphasized the importance of understanding genetic variations in patient survival and tumor behavior.
title: Characterizing the extracellular matrix transcriptome of cervical, endometrial, and uterine cancers

finding: The SNP rs10010004 was associated with the regulation of chromosomal instability (CIN) in breast cancer as reported in Vargas-Rondon et al. (2017). They identified that alterations in mitotic regulators could lead to errors in chromosome segregation, which play a crucial role in cancer development.
title: A characterization of mitotic and centrosomal defects in a continuum model of Breast Cancer

finding: The study described a significant association between GABRA2 variants, specifically rs279858, and disruptions in the structural connectome of reward circuits in individuals with heroin use disorders. This finding provided insights into the genetic basis of altered synaptic processes and reward-related brain connectivity, linking the genetic variant directly to opioid use disorder (OUD) and its associated cognitive and reward-related impairments.
title: Uncovering circadian rhythm disruptions of synaptic proteome signaling in prefrontal cortex and nucleus accumbens associated with opioid use disorder

finding: The SNP rs10030082 was associated with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) subtypes in the context of the study. The identification of HCC subtypes was based on a multi-omics approach, where specific molecular characteristics linked to genotypes were highlighted. This finding indicated potential implications for survival outcomes and personalized treatment targets related to the subgroups identified.
title: Multi-omics subtyping of hepatocellular carcinoma patients using a Bayesian network mixture model

finding: The rs1047626 SNP was reported as a significant positive selection variant, with the derived G allele (Val50) found to enhance ZnT9 function, affecting mitochondrial metabolism and regulation of zinc in the cell. It was associated with increased susceptibility to a number of neuropsychiatric disorders, suggesting adaptation related to cold environments.
title: Human genetic adaptation related to cellular zinc homeostasis

finding: The rs4861157 SNP demonstrated indications of positive selection within African populations, where the derived A allele was associated with higher SLC30A9 expression. This finding highlighted the contrasting adaptive pressures faced by populations in Africa compared to non-African populations.
title: Human genetic adaptation related to cellular zinc homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs1516535 was identified as an intron variant in the cuTAR213507 lncRNA, which was co-expressed with the mRNA of the cancer-associated gene FGFR3 in head and neck cancers. This cuTAR contained significant evidence suggesting its association with cancer due to the genomic proximity to multiple other cancer-relevant genes and was located in the context of various cancers including HNSCC and pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
title: Unraveling lncRNA Diversity at a Single Cell Resolution and in a Spatial Context across Different Cancer Types

finding: The SNP rs13107325 was linked to crystallized cognitive ability, specifically vocabulary knowledge. It is a missense variant within SLC39A8, altering the amino acid at position 391. This variant was previously associated with multiple complex traits, including intelligence, autism, and schizophrenia, and has been functionally connected to altered glycosylation in the brain, which is crucial for neurodevelopment.
title: Shared and distinct genetic influences between cognitive domains and psychiatric disorder risk based on genome-wide data

finding: The SNP rs9998811, which is located in the SLC2A9 gene region, also demonstrated significant dominance deviation with a p-value of less than 5e-8. Similar to rs12124078, this SNP indicated a minimal contribution to dominance variance despite the significant deviation observed.
title: Estimation of non-additive genetic variance in human complex traits from a large sample of unrelated individuals
