finding: The SNP rs71599241 was found to be nominally significantly associated with three phenotypes relevant to reproduction: hydrocele and spermatocele (ICD10 code N43) with a p-value of 0.001, diseases of male genital organs (ICD10 codes N40-51) with a p-value of 0.004, and sleep duration with a p-value of 0.009. This association was derived from a phenome-wide association study utilizing data from the UK Biobank.
title: The impact of ancestral, environmental and genetic influences on germline de novo mutation rates and spectra

finding: The SLC2A9 rs1014290 polymorphism showed an association with prediabetes and type 2 diabetes, which can impact renal function over time.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This lead variant showed significant allelic differences in transcriptional activity, implicating its association with T2D risk specifically near NKX6-1.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: Found near NKX6-1, this variant influenced transcriptional activity linked to T2D, further supporting its functional implications in risk pathways.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: The SNP rs142693490 near the LCORL gene was linked to alanine degradation II, with p-values of 1.28 x 10^-12 for discovery and 0.014 for replication.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: The rs2231142 variant in ABCG2 was recognized as influencing serum uric acid levels, and was noted to be modified by other polymorphisms regarding cardiovascular risk factors in elderly populations.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The KDR gene polymorphism rs2071559 was linked to T2DM-related vascular complications, reinforcing its importance in the context of diabetic pathology.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs13123056 was identified as being linked to whole chromosome instability (W-CIN). It was implicated in understanding the mechanisms that underpin cancer development, particularly those involving whole genome doubling.
title: Distinct and common features of numerical and structural chromosomal instability across different cancer types

finding: The SNP rs7667864 was part of the 99% genetic credible set at the LCORL GWAS locus. It had a genetic posterior probability of association (PPA) of 0.12, with a high linkage disequilibrium (LD) r² of 0.97 with the lead GWAS SNP rs12640250. It was reweighted to a maximum PPA of 0.62 after functional reweighting using islet chromatin states, ATAC-seq peaks, and transcriptional clusters (TCs). Additionally, this SNP overlapped an ATAC-seq peak and a TC in human pancreatic islets.
title: A transcription start site map in human pancreatic islets reveals functional regulatory signatures

finding: The SNP rs2074974 was identified as the lead eQTL SNP for the gene DCAF16, with a genetic PPA of 0.026, and had an LD r² of 0.96 with the lead GWAS SNP rs12640250. It occurred upstream of a TC that overlaps an ATAC-seq peak and was reweighted to a PPA of 0.096. This SNP was associated with significant transcriptional activity, as evidenced by an overlapping CAGE element showing significant activity in the massively parallel reporter assay.
title: A transcription start site map in human pancreatic islets reveals functional regulatory signatures

finding: The SNP rs12640250 served as the lead SNP at the LCORL T2D GWAS locus, achieving a p-value of 3.7×10^-8. It was included in the 99% credible set comprised of 74 variants and had a maximum PPA of 0.15. The GWAS signal for this SNP co-localized with an eQTL signal in human pancreatic islets for the gene DCAF16, indicating its functional relevance.
title: A transcription start site map in human pancreatic islets reveals functional regulatory signatures

finding: Variant rs61216514 was predicted to decrease binding affinity, and this prediction was confirmed through EMSA, with a 1.3-fold change in binding affinity observed.
title: Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Alter NKX2-5 DNA-Binding Affinity

finding: The C allele of rs11544037 was associated with increased chromatin accessibility of a progenitor caPeak located approximately 5 kb upstream from the ETFDH TSS and was linked to increased expression of ETFDH. This SNP disrupted motifs of RAD21, suggesting that RAD21 binding was associated with the increased chromatin accessibility and gene expression.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: This SNP acted as a QTL for all seven data types analyzed. Notably, the T allele was associated with higher expression of UNC5C and was linked to epigenetic marks indicative of activated regions in the genome, highlighting its significance in the immune response context.
title: Epigenetic variation impacts ancestry-associated differences in the transcriptional response to influenza infection

finding: The SNP rs13102260, a G>A variant in the HTT promoter region, was found to correlate with an earlier age of onset for Huntington's disease (HD) in patients. This correlation indicates that lower wild-type HTT expression due to this SNP could contribute to the disease progression.
title: Huntingtin loss-of-function contributes to transcriptional deregulation in Huntington’s disease

finding: The SNP rs13107325, near SLC39A8, was observed to be associated with candidate traits affecting health outcomes like memory function and body composition, indicating complex pathways involved in conditions such as schizophrenia.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: This SNP was related to subcortical volume and many other health-related studies and GWAS.
title: Brain aging comprises many modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The SNP rs13107235 (ZIP8 A391T) was reported as a missense polymorphism predicted to be among the top 1.4% of deleterious mutations in the human genome. It was connected to multiple conditions, including schizophrenia, Crohn's disease, obesity, and alterations in grey matter volume. This SNP exhibited significant pleiotropic effects and was implicated as a potential causal variant for the association with schizophrenia.
title: Behavioral phenotyping of Zip8 393T-KI mice for in vivo study of schizophrenia pathogenesis

finding: The rs13107325_C>T variant was associated with 14 UKBB and 3 GWAS catalog phenotypes, including hypertension and schizophrenia.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The fine-mapped variant rs12509595 was associated with eGFRCr-Cys and located near the FGF5 gene within a proximal tubule cCRE. It displayed chromatin accessibility allelic imbalance, where the alternate allele showed increased accessibility compared to the reference allele, implicating it in regulatory mechanisms affecting kidney function.
title: Variants in tubule epithelial regulatory elements mediate most heritable differences in human kidney function

finding: The SNP rs56405341 on chromosome 4q28.2 was found to have a significant association with Braak neurofibrillary tangle stage in an autopsy cohort of individuals with primary age-related tauopathy (PART). The association was robust, with a p-value of 4.82 x 10^-8, and indicated a linear regression beta value of 0.35. This SNP is located near the genes C4orf33, SCLT1, and JADE1, with additional analysis revealing that homozygous minor allele carriers were linked to higher Braak stages.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: This SNP was connected to HS3ST1 and showed a statistically significant association with PART (p=0.02), reinforcing the link between AD-related genetic factors and tauopathies.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: The SNP rs13127214 was associated with unipolar depression and mapped to the GABRB1 gene, which is related to inhibitory synaptic transmission in the vertebrate brain. After METH overdose, this SNP region became closed in the dentate gyrus but open in the Ammon's horn and subventricular zone.
title: Methamphetamine induced regional-specific transcriptomic and epigenetic changes in the rat brain

finding: Lead SNP rs227369 was associated with variance explained in the ADHD loci on chromosome 4. It was observed that conditioning on the expression of MANBA completely explained the variance, with the lead SNP GWAS P-value recorded as 1.3E-07, and the conditioned lead SNP GWAS P-value at 1.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The variant rs6533181 was significantly associated with kidney function in the eGFR creatinine GWAS (P = 3.83 × 10^-11). It was also found to strongly influence TET2 expression levels in kidney tubule samples (P = 9.66 × 10^-5) and was linked with CpG methylation (cg11878490 meQTLs, P = 1.29 × 10^-19).
title: Genetic Studies Highlight the Role of TET2 and INO80 in DNA Damage Response and Kidney Disease Pathogenesis

finding: This SNP was identified as a Tier-1 SNP for FAM13A, which had optimal epigenetic features indicating its involvement in obesity regulation through its association with varying transcription start site usage.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: Identified as a key SNP for FAM13A, residing in a region associated with differential use of transcription start sites which influences obesity.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: The SNP rs10010019 was reported to correlate with EpCAM expression patterns. The research highlighted new sites of high EpCAM expression, including the choroid plexi in the brain and duodenal papillae, which are of clinical significance for immunotherapy strategies targeting EpCAM.
title: ROCKETS - a novel one-for-all toolbox for light sheet microscopy in drug discovery

finding: The SNP rs1578330963 A>G in gene FRAS1 was reported as a missense variant and was noted in the context of pathogenic findings related to Fraser syndrome, although the specific population carrier frequency was not detailed in the study.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs13122990 was found to have transcriptomic and genetic associations connecting Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, and cancer. This suggests a potential link in the genetics of these diseases, emphasizing the importance of integrating various omics data to identify common genetic factors that could influence disease outcomes.
title: Multi-omics Topic Modeling for Breast Cancer Classification

finding: The rs1554483 G/C polymorphism in the CLOCK gene was found to be associated with susceptibility to Alzheimer's disease in the Chinese population. This genetic variation potentially links circadian regulation to neurodegenerative disorders, which may further relate to the broader discussion of how circadian genes are dysregulated in autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and how this dysregulation could affect metabolic and sleep phenotypes in patients with ASD.
title: Dysregulated Expression of Circadian Genes in Lymphoblastoid Cells of Patients with ASD

finding: The lead variant rs5857598 was linked to TLR1 with a PPA of 67.9%, contributing to the genetic association in IBD.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The study by Díaz Ramírez et al. (2020) demonstrated that the GALNTL6 gene rs558129 polymorphism was associated with power performance, suggesting a significant role in muscle performance traits and hypertrophy.
title: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy rewires glucose metabolism in mice: an experimental investigation and systematic review

finding: The trans-eQTL (rs687492) for microRNA MIR330 was also a cis-eQTL for long non-coding RNA SNHG8 in resting and stimulated T cells, indicating a regulatory pathway involving lncRNA-miRNA interactions.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel shared risk variant for Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) through genomic structural equation modelling. It was mapped to the gene MANBA, which has associations with neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Combining multivariate genomic approaches to elucidate the comorbidity between ASD and ADHD

finding: This SNP was located at 606 kbp upstream of INTU and was associated with enhancer activity and expression levels related to certain facial features.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: Found in the INTU region, this SNP exhibited significant enhancer activity in neural crest progenitor cells, related to facial morphology.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: Also from the INTU locus, this SNP was associated with transcription factor regulation and enhancer activity affecting facial features.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: This SNP was identified in the INTU region, contributing to enhancer activity relevant to facial morphology.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: The SNP rs62410848 served as an instrumental variable for network reconstruction in the CPEB2 gene network in liver, being the strongest cis-eQTL associated with CPEB2, reinforcing its critical role in cortisol-regulated processes.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs34985265 was associated with IRF2 in subcutaneous fat, contributing to a network regulated by this gene at a 10% FDR, highlighting the interplay of cortisol signaling and IRF2's regulatory influences.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs1348224, specifically the G allele (minor allele), showed a negative effect on Phenotypic Axis 1, indicating a protective effect against cognitive impairment in Parkinson's disease. This finding was consistent with previously reported protective effects of this locus for Parkinson's disease with dementia and dementia with Lewy bodies.
title: Universal continuous severity traits underlying hundreds of Parkinson’s disease clinical features

finding: The NR3C2 gene variant rs2070951 interacted with high levels of plasma corticotropin-releasing hormone related to postpartum depression.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The TLL1 gene polymorphism (rs1503298) was associated with coronary heart disease, identifying a potential genetic marker for heart conditions.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs6822844 was associated with Crohn's disease as reported by Hollis-Moffatt et al. in 2010, which consolidated evidence linking this variant to the disease. Additionally, Louahchi et al. in 2016 reported that rs6822844 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis in the Algerian population. This finding highlighted the significance of the KIAA1109/TENR/IL2/IL21 locus in immune-related diseases.
title: Genetic deletion of Kiaa1109 in mice leads to developmental defects at the neuromuscular junction

finding: In the context of exploring pleiotropy, the SNP rs144276707 was linked to three proteins: IL6ST, ICAM1, and TIMP1. It was found that ICAM1 and TIMP1 shared pathways, while all three proteins exhibited shared protein-protein interactions (PPIs). These findings provided support for the notion that rs144276707 likely exerts its influence through vertical pleiotropy, thereby validating the SNP as a potential instrument for Mendelian randomization (MR) analyses.
title: EpiGraphDB: A database and data mining platform for health data science

finding: The study revealed that the CD38 missense SNP (rs1800561, 418C>T, Arg140Trp) had a higher genotypic frequency than the wild type allele (CC) among patients with Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) in Sudan. This finding suggested a potential correlation between this SNP and the demographic factors such as age and gender, showing higher frequencies in male patients and those aged 60 and younger. Additionally, the SNP was associated with significant increases in certain hematological parameters, specifically the total white blood cell counts (TWBCS) and absolute lymphocyte counts, though no significant correlation was observed concerning hemoglobin concentration.
title: Bio-informatic Analysis of Missense Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs) in Human CD38 Gene Associated with B-Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

finding: It was found to be associated with left middle frontal cortex connectivity, showing a z-score of 6.59.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: It was identified as an eQTL for DCLK2, important for neural migration, with a z-score of 6.28.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This missense variant in SLC39A8 showed significant associations in both regional connectivity (z-score of 5.77) and tract-wise connectivity (z-score of 8.74), and has been previously linked with white matter integrity.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: Located in RP11-180C1.1, this SNP showed a significant multivariate association.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The study highlighted that the SNP rs13102462, associated with the CUX1 gene, was linked to enhanced pancreatic cancer formation. Specifically, it was found that CUX1 enhances chromosomal instability and, when activated, may synergize with KRAS mutations to induce MEK/ERK-dependent proliferation, thereby increasing tumorigenic potential.
title: Cut homeodomain transcription factor is a novel regulator of cortex glia morphogenesis and maintenance of neural niche

finding: The SNP rs1578330963 A>G in gene FRAS1 was identified as a missense variant and was found to be pathogenic, linked to Fraser syndrome 1 with established pathogenic variants reported previously.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: In the context of Belhabib et al. (2021), this SNP was examined for its role in the interaction between extracellular matrices and cancer-associated fibroblasts, illustrating its importance in cancer diagnosis and therapy, particularly relevant to colorectal cancer.
title: Deciphering stiffness-driven changes in colorectal cancer by proteomics

finding: The SNP rs13143615 was studied in the context of chemotherapy-induced myopathy and cachexia, revealing its potential implications in the development of acute cachexia in patients undergoing chemotherapy for acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
title: Haptoglobin and glutamine synthetase may biomark cachexia induced by anti-acute myeloid leukemia chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs6825004 was linked to the SCARB2 locus, identified as a significant contributor in the context of rare coding variant burden analyses, highlighting its potential role in PD.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The SNP rs13133214 was associated with CD33 expression levels in acute myeloid leukemia (AML) patients. This association was crucial for developing targeted therapies such as the bispecific antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) designed to target both CD33 and CD7. The study illustrated that targeting specific combinations of surface antigens related to this SNP significantly improved treatment selectivity and effectiveness against AML cells, differentiating them from healthy haematopoietic cells.
title: Development of a bispecific Antibody–Drug Conjugate targeting CD7 and CD33 to treat Acute Myeloid Leukaemia

finding: The SNP rs13143408 was reported as a positive original finding in the context of therapeutic cancer vaccination. It was associated with the presentation of immunopeptidomics-discovered antigens that conferred protective antitumor efficacy, indicating a potential role in enhancing immune responses in cancer patients.
title: Endogenous viral elements constitute a complementary source of antigens for personalized cancer immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs10001928 was identified as a pQTL for MUC5B concentration, indicating its potential role in influencing mucin levels relevant to COPD.
title: Genetic Regulators of Sputum Mucin Concentration and Their Associations with COPD Phenotypes

finding: This SNP was noted as a top SNP for the PCDH7 gene, being significant in 196 previous GWAS, particularly for educational attainment (P=1.44E-06), hence related to traits possibly influencing aggression indirectly.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: The minor allele of SNP rs764154313 tagged six of the nine non-canonical CAG repeat alleles, specifically the (CAG)_n(CCG)_12(CCT)_2 allele. This indicated its effectiveness in identifying pure CAG repeat alleles lacking CAACAG regions in Huntington's disease.
title: FAN1 nuclease activity affects CAG expansion and age at onset of Huntington’s disease

finding: The minor allele of SNP rs183415333 successfully tagged the allele with an extra CAACAG cassette, (CAG)_n(CAACAG)_2CCGCCA(CCG)_7(CCT)_3, in 93.8% of individuals carrying this non-canonical repeat sequence, demonstrating its strong association with the expanded CAG repeat.
title: FAN1 nuclease activity affects CAG expansion and age at onset of Huntington’s disease

finding: The highly pleiotropic rs13107325 variant was associated with multiple phenotypes, including hypertension and schizophrenia, replicating its established associations in prior studies.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The study by Lucchini et al. (2020) indicated that the rs356219 polymorphism in the SNCA gene was associated with Parkinson Disease and related parkinsonism symptoms. This finding suggested that genetic variations at this SNP could have significant implications in understanding individual susceptibility to neurodegenerative diseases.
title: A partial Drp1 knockout improves autophagy flux independent of mitochondrial function

finding: The SNP rs1801058 was associated with phenotypic effects like hypertension, nephrosclerosis, and kidney issues, particularly influencing the interaction between the GRK4 gene and the drug Metoprolol.
title: Comprehensive assessment of Indian variations in the druggable kinome landscape highlights distinct insights at the sequence, structure and pharmacogenomic stratum

finding: Similar to rs1801058, the SNP rs313549 was highlighted for its significance in the GRK4 gene, and it was part of the analysis where it was grouped with other common variants reflecting similar allele frequencies between the IndiGen and 1000 Genome populations.
title: Comprehensive assessment of Indian variations in the druggable kinome landscape highlights distinct insights at the sequence, structure and pharmacogenomic stratum

finding: The SNP rs1024323 was examined in the context of pharmacogenetics, demonstrating impacts related to drug interactions and contributing to phenotypes associated with cardiovascular issues and hypertension.
title: Comprehensive assessment of Indian variations in the druggable kinome landscape highlights distinct insights at the sequence, structure and pharmacogenomic stratum

finding: The rs13107325 SNP showed a genome-wide significant association with schizophrenia. The direction of the effect was consistent, where alleles that increased left-handedness also elevated the risk of schizophrenia.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 48 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: The rs7689303 SNP in SH3RF1 was associated with increased schizophrenia risk and longer sleep duration, indicating its complex role in phenotypic traits related to sleep.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: The study mentioned that MCT1 was identified as a new prognostic biomarker and its therapeutic inhibition improved response to Temozolomide in human glioblastoma, implying a significant role of rs13143468 in MCT1-related pathways in cancer.
title: ME3BP-7 is a targeted cytotoxic agent that rapidly kills pancreatic cancer cells expressing high levels of monocarboxylate transporter MCT1

finding: The study reported a novel <italic>SNCA</italic><sup>A53T</sup> heterozygous iPSC line, which involved a SNP (rs104893877) that resulted in a change of the amino acid at position 53 from alanine to threonine. This change was linked to the pathophysiology of dopaminergic neurons derived from the genetically engineered iPSCs, suggesting its relevance in understanding the mechanisms of Parkinson's disease.
title: Diverging Parkinson’s Disease Pathology between patient-derived GBAN370S, LRRK2G2019S and engineered SNCAA53T iPSC-derived Dopaminergic Neurons

finding: The D451E substitution in GC vitamin D-binding protein was previously associated with altered vitamin D levels in African and European populations, exhibiting a higher allele frequency of 58% in Europeans compared to 7.3% in Africans.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: This SNP was also linked to the epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition in cancer. Similar to rs9100134, it played a role in understanding the regulation of NFkB signaling and the interplay between cell morphology and signaling pathways during EMT.
title: Identification of phenotype-specific networks from paired gene expression-cell shape imaging data

finding: The SNP rs13112550 was associated with a finding that implicated MARCH8 in the suppression of tumor metastasis and the degradation of both STAT3 and CD44 in breast cancer cells, which relates to phenotypes of tumor self-renewal and metastasis in triple negative breast cancer (TNBC). This discovery was derived from the publication by Chen et al. in 'Cancers'.
title: CD81 partners with CD44 in promoting exosome biogenesis, tumor cluster formation, and lung metastasis in triple negative breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs13112666 was associated with the study on quiescent glioblastoma stem cells (GSCs), where the authors identified important transcription regulators influencing quiescence. Although the specific role of this SNP was not detailed, it related to critical pathways in the context of glioblastoma and marked a significant finding in understanding the genetics of cellular states in cancer.
title: Identification of genes with oscillatory expression in glioblastoma – The paradigm of SOX2

finding: At the <italic>ABCG2</italic> locus, the SNP <italic>rs2231142</italic> (p.Gln141Lys) was established as a dominant causal variant, implicating its critical role in serum urate levels.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control

finding: The SNP <italic>rs11723382</italic> at the <italic>SLC2A9</italic> locus was identified as having a strong association with serum urate levels, influencing both expression and transport mechanisms.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control

finding: The SNP chr4:105409456:G:A was found to correlate with higher expression levels of the transcript ENST00000348706 and lower expression levels of ENST00000341695. This finding was linked to the presence of a rare heterozygous variant within the vicinity of the ASTS gene PPA2, which was identified as a splicing outlier by GTEx.
title: Transcriptome variation in human tissues revealed by long-read sequencing

finding: The SNP chr4:105449015:G:A exhibited association with the transcript expression patterns, specifically with significant expression alterations in transcript ENST00000348706 and ENST00000341695. This variant was also categorized as a rare heterozygous variant impacting the ASTS gene PPA2, which highlights its role in aberrant transcript splicing.
title: Transcriptome variation in human tissues revealed by long-read sequencing

finding: The missense variant at locus chr4:73412072:A:G was found to have a positive impact on calcium levels but a negative impact on albumin levels, suggesting that the effects of missense variants on calcium are not mediated by albumin level itself. This finding was based on the results from the ALLSPICE test, which indicated significant heterogeneity in the effects of rare missense variants as compared to pLoF variants related to the <italic>ALB</italic> gene.
title: Effect heterogeneity reveals complex pleiotropic effects of rare coding variants
